SourceText: Was your teen in a good mood when you tried to set the rule? It is best to set rules when the situation is calm. If you or your teen are tired or hungry, it is better to talk about rules at a later time.
text: Je, kijana wako alikuwa na hali nzuri kihisia mlipojaribu kuweka sheria? Ni vizuri zaidi kutengeneza sheria wakati kukiwa na hali ya utulivu. Kama wewe au kijana wako atakuwa amechoka au ana njaa, ni vizuri zaidi kuzungumzia sheria baadaye.

SourceText: We were not able to stick to the rule.
text: Hatukuweza kufuata sheria.

SourceText: The rule needs to be specific and realistic. Make sure to have a rule that can be kept easily, like having one meal together every Sunday instead of every night. Do you need to be more flexible about the rule?
text: Sheria zinapaswa ziwe mahususi na zinazotekelezeka. Hakikisha kuwa una sheria inayoweza kufuatwa kwa urahisi, kama vile kula mlo mmoja pamoja kila Jumapili badala ya kila siku usiku. Je, unahitaji kuwe na uwezekano zaidi wa kubadilisha sheria hiyo?

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to introduce a consequence together?
text: Je, mlipata changamoto zozote mlipojaribu pamoja kuweka athari?

SourceText: I got very angry when my teen broke the rule.
text: Nilikasirika sana pale kijana wangu alipovunja sheria.

SourceText:
When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better. 

Next time your teen makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!
text:
Kupumzika kabla ya kujibu kunatusaidia kutulia na kujibu vizuri zaidi.

Kijana wako akikukasirisha tena, jaribu kwanza kupumzika. Kuvuta pumzi ndefu chache tu kunaweza kuleta mabadiliko makubwa!

SourceText: My teen got very angry with me after I gave the consequence.
text: Kijana wangu alinikasirikia sana nilipomuamuru afanye athari.

SourceText:
When your teen gets angry, you might need to walk away until you are both calm.

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. Listen to your teen’s explanation, and react calmly as you agreed if they used the “@global.safety_word” or broke a rule in order to stay safe.
text:
Kijana wako anapokasirika, unaweza kuhitaji kuondoka karibu nae hadi nyote mtakapokuwa mmetulia.

Tazama ili kuhakikisha kuwa adhabu ni ya kawaida na ya busara. Sikiliza maelezo ya kijana wako, na hakikisha unatoa "@global.safety_word” au kama alivunja sheria ili kuwa salama.
note: The string “@global.safety_word” should not be translated.

SourceText: I introduced the consequence without first discussing it with my teen.
text: Niliweka athari bila kuijadili kwanza na kijana wangu.

SourceText: Can you make a consequence for if this happens again? When we establish a consequence together with our teens, the consequence will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Je, unaweza kuweka athari kwa ajili ya jambo hili likitokea tena? Tunapoweka athari pamoja na vijana wetu, athari hizi zitakuwa na uwezekano mkubwa wa kutekelezeka, na vijana wetu watakuwa tayari zaidi na watakuwa na uwezo zaidi wa kufuata sheria hiyo.

SourceText: I forgot to follow through with the consequence.
text: Nilisahau kufuatilia athari mpaka mwisho.

SourceText: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.
text: Sisi sote huwa tunakosea! Kadri tunavyokuwa na msimamo kwenye athari tulizoziweka, ndivyo watoto wetu watakavyokuwa na uwezekano mkubwa wa kuchagua kuwa na mwenendo chanya siku za usoni.

SourceText: Even with the consequence, my teen still does not follow the rule.
text: Pamoja na kuweka athari, bado kijana wangu hafuati sheria.

SourceText:
If your teen keeps breaking rules, you might need to spend more positive time with them. 

Try to keep going with your other goals  – like self-care, one-on-one time, and praise. All these skills will help your teen feel more loved and secure… and you less stressed!
text:
Kama kijana wako anaendelea kuvunja sheria, unaweza kuhitaji kutumia muda chanya zaidi pamoja naye.

Jaribu kuendelea na malengo yako mengine – kama kujithamini, muda wa kuzungumza wawili, na usifiaji. Ujuzi huu wote utamsaidia kijana wako kuhisi anapendwa zaidi na kulindwa… na wewe kupunguza msongo wa mawazo!

SourceText: We only created a negative consequence, not a positive consequence.
text: Tuliweka njia ya malipo hasi tu, na si malipo chanya.

SourceText: It can be difficult to think of positive consequences sometimes. Positive consequences will encourage your teen to take more responsibility, and you will see the difference!
text: Wakati mwingine ni vigumu kufikiria athari chanya. Athari zitamchochea kijana wako kuwajibika zaidi, na utaona mabadiliko!

SourceText: My teen suggested being hit as a negative consequence.
text: Kijana wangu alipendekeza kuchapwa kama athari hasi.

SourceText:
Teens can be used to seeing hitting as the only possible consequence for breaking rules. 

Brainstorm some calm consequences with them that could help them understand that they have done something wrong. These will be more effective and will set positive examples!
text:
Vijana wanaweza kuzoea kuona kuchapwa ndo athari pekee ya kuvunja sheria.

Fikiria kwa undani pamoja nao kuhusu baadhi ya athari nyepesi zinazoweza kuwasaidia kuelewa kwamba wamefanya kosa. Hizi zitaleta ufanisi zaidi na kutoa mifano chanya!

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to resolve the problem with your teen?
text: Je, ulipata changamoto yoyote ulipojaribu kutatua tatizo na kijana wako?

SourceText: I forgot the steps of problem solving.
text: Nilisahau hatua za kutatua matatizo.

SourceText: It takes some practice to use all four steps of problem solving. Next time a problem comes up, look at the four steps together with your teen – it will make a big difference!
text: Inachukua muda kidogo na mazoezi kuweza kutumia hatua zote nne za kutatua matatizo. Tatizo litakapotokea tena, pitia hatua hizi nne pamoja na kijana wako – kufanya hivyo kutaleta mabadiliko makubwa!

SourceText: I started with the solutions right away.
text: Nilianza na suluhisho moja kwa moja.

SourceText: When we have a problem, we always want to get to the quickest end result and can forget about the steps. To come up with the best solution together, it is helpful to first have a full understanding of the problem and the different solutions.
text: Tunapokuwa na tatizo, mara zote huwa tunataka kulitatua haraka sana na tunaweza kusahau hatua za kulitatua tatizo. Ili kupata suluhisho bora kwa pamoja, ni vema kwanza kulielewa tatizo kikamilifu na njia mbalimbali za kulitatua.

SourceText: Four steps of problem solving
text: Hatua nne za kutatua matatizo

SourceText: We could not agree on a solution to try out and we got into an argument.
text: Hatukuweza kukubaliana kuhusu suluhisho la kulijaribu hivyo tuliishia kulumbana.

SourceText: Sometimes it can be difficult to agree with everyone in the family, especially if everyone is not yet calm. You could agree to try one solution first, and then another. Also, if you get stuck, try to get together later to agree on the solution together.
text: Wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kukubaliana na kila mtu katika familia, hasa kama kila mtu bado hajatulia. Mnaweza kukubaliana kujaribu suluhisho moja kwanza, na kisha mjaribu suluhisho lingine. Pia, kama mtakwama, jaribuni kukutana baadaye ili mkubaliane pamoja kuhusu suluhisho hilo.

SourceText: I got angry when the problem came up and I forgot to use the problem-solving steps.
text: Nilikasirika tatizo lilipotokea, nikasahau kutumia hatua za kutatua matatizo.

SourceText: When a problem comes up, we all get angry or stressed sometimes. Remember, when you feel angry or stressed, you can take a pause to help you stay calm and then solve the problem you are facing.
text: Tatizo linapojitokeza, huwa tunakasirika au kufadhaika wakati mwingine. Kumbuka, unapohisi hasira au msongo wa mawazo, unaweza kupumzika kwanza ili utulie halafu ndipo utatue tatizo linalokukabili.

SourceText: My teen got angry and did not want to talk about the problem.
text: Kijana wangu alikasirika na hakutaka kuzungumzia tatizo hilo.

SourceText: Your teen might be too overwhelmed to deal with the problem right away. Recognise and name their emotions, and create a time later in the day or week to discuss and solve the problem together. By giving your teen time, the problem can be solved well.
text: Kijana wako anaweza kushindwa kabisa kushughulikia tatizo mara moja. Zitambue na kuzipa majina hisia zake, halafu tafuta muda baadaye siku hiyo au wiki hiyo mjadili na kutatua tatizo hilo pamoja. Unapotenga muda kwa ajili ya kijana wako, tatizo linaweza kutatuliwa vizuri.

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to map risks and support with your teen?
text: Je, ulikuwa na changamoto yoyote ulipojaribu kuhainisha sehemu za hatari na za msaada ukiwa na kijana wako?

SourceText: My teen and I disagreed on which areas and online activities were unsafe.
text: Mimi na kijana wangu hatukukubaliana kuhusu maeneo na shughuli za mtandaoni ambazo hazikuwa salama.

SourceText: Well done for trying the activity! When we listen to our teenagers, even if we disagree, we learn to understand their thinking. Try and find time to do the activity again – try to really listen and show you understand them before sharing your thoughts.
text: Hongera kwa kujaribu shughuli hii! Tunapowasikiliza vijana wetu, hata kama hatukubaliani nao, tunajifunza kuelewa wanavyofikiri. Jaribu kutafuta muda wa kufanya shughuli hii tena – jaribu kusikiliza na kuonesha kuwa unawaelewa kabla ya kuwashirikisha mawazo yako.

SourceText: My teen identified the house of someone I trust as unsafe. I was shocked and did not know what to do.
text: Kijana wangu alitambua nyumba ya mtu ninayemwamini kuwa si salama. Nilishtuka na sikujua cha kufanya.

SourceText: It is shocking to learn that people who are close to us and who we trust may be a danger to our teens. Remember to take a pause when you are upset, and try to listen calmly to your teen. Find someone you can talk to about this, perhaps a friend or support service, so you can get the support you need.
text: Ni jambo la kushtua kujua kwamba watu walio karibu nasi na tunaowaamini wanaweza kuwa hatari kwa vijana wetu. Kumbuka kuchukua pumziko unapokuwa umekasirika, na jaribu kumsikiliza kijana wako kwa utulivu. Tafuta mtu unayeweza kuzungumza naye kuhusu jambo hili, labda rafiki au huduma ya msaada, ili uweze kupata msaada unaohitaji.

SourceText: My teen insisted that the bar (or another place I do not feel is safe) is safe for them to visit. I do not know how to convince my teen.
text: Kijana wangu alisisitiza kwamba baa (au mahali pengine ninapohisi si salama) ni salama kwake kupatembelea. Sijui jinsi ya kumshawishi kijana wangu.

SourceText: This can be very frustrating. To find a solution, your teen needs to feel heard – so listen calmly to your teen's reasons, and only then share your own thoughts. Then, think together about a rule that allows them to have fun but stay safe.
text: Jambo hili linaweza kukatisha tamaa sana. Ili kupata suluhisho, kijana wako anahitaji kuhisi kuwa anasikilizwa – kwa hiyo, sikiliza kwa utulivu sababu za kijana wako, halafu ndipo umshirikishe maoni yako. Kisha, shirikianeni kuweka sheria inayomruhusu kufurahi huku akiwa salama.

SourceText: As an adult, I feel responsible to protect – but when I told my teen what is safe and what is not, my teen got angry.
text: Kama mtu mzima, ninahisi ninawajibika kumlinda – lakini nilipomwambia kijana wangu kuhusu kilicho salama na kisicho salama, alikasirika.

SourceText: Our teenagers may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our teens in the mapping activity and really listen to them, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.
text: Vijana wetu wanaweza kujua mambo yanayohusu jamii zetu na teknolojia ambayo hatuyajui. Tunapowashirikisha kikamilifu vijana wetu kwenye shughuli ya ubainishaji na kuwasikiliza, watajisikia kuwa wanasikilizwa na kuthaminiwa, na inaweza kuwa rahisi zaidi kupata mpango unaokubaliwa na kila mmoja.

SourceText: It was hard to identify support resources available in my community, because I do not know my community so well / there are few services available.
text: Ilikuwa vigumu kutambua rasilimali zinazotoa msaada katika jamii yangu, kwa sababu siijui vizuri jamii yangu / kuna huduma chache zinazopatikana.

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!
text: Ni vigumu kujua kila kitu kuhusu jamii zetu. Shirikisha rafiki au mwanafamilia mwingine katika shughuli yako ya ubainishaji. Unaweza hata kutembelea baadhi ya huduma zinazopatikana na kuuliza wanachofanya. Kadri tunavyojua mengi, ndivyo tunavyoweza kuziweka salama familia zetu!

SourceText: I do not know much about technology, so I do not know how to talk about it with my teen.
text: Sifahamu mengi kuhusu teknolojia, kwa hiyo sijui jinsi ya kuizungumzia na kijana wangu.

SourceText: That is totally fine! You can still support your teen. Ask your teen to explain the gadgets they use – you could do this during one-on-one time. This is a great opportunity to show interest in your teen’s life and to discuss potential risks together. If you are not sure which rules to set, you can always agree, with your teen, to try a new rule for two weeks and then discuss how things are going and change the rule if needed!
text: Hakuna shida kabisa! Bado unaweza kumsaidia kijana wako. Muulize kijana wako aeleze vifaa vya kielektroniki anavyotumia – unaweza kumuuliza wakati mnapozungumza wawili. Hii ni fursa nzuri sana ya kuonesha moyo wa kupenda kujua maisha ya kijana wako na kujadili pamoja hatari zinazoweza kutokea. Kama hamna uhakika muweke sheria gani, kila mara unaweza kukubaliana na kijana wako kujaribu sheria mpya kwa wiki mbili, kisha mtajadili jinsi mambo yanavyoenda na kubadilisha sheria ikibidi!

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to prepare for a possible crisis with your teen?
text: Je, ulikuwa na changamoto yoyote ulipojaribu kujiandaa kwa ajili ya janga linaloweza kutokea na kijana wako?

SourceText: My teen told me that something serious happened to them and I did not know how to handle it.
text: Kijana wangu aliniambia kuwa kuna jambo kubwa limempata na sikujua jinsi ya kulishughulikia.

SourceText: Praise your teen for telling you; that is not easy to do! Remember, you can use all the skills you picked from your toolbox: Take a pause, use the four steps of problem solving, and reach out to get the support you and your teen need!
text: Msifie kijana wako kwa kukuambia; kufanya hivyo si jambo rahisi! Kumbuka, unaweza kutumia ujuzi wote uliojifunza kwenye kivungezana: Pumzika kidogo, tumia hatua nne za kutatua matatizo, halafu tafuta msaada unaouhitaji wewe na kijana wako!

SourceText: Get support
text: Pata msaada

SourceText: The conversation made me very uncomfortable because I was reminded of a negative experience I had.
text: Mazungumzo hayo yalininyima raha kabisa kwa sababu yalinikumbusha wakati mbaya nilioupitia.

SourceText: When we are reminded of such experiences, it is normal to feel upset or angry. It is important to find a time when you are calm, so that you can think of what support you need. You may need to talk to someone.
text: Tunapokumbushwa nyakati kama hizo, ni kawaida kuhisi kufadhaika au kukasirika. Ni muhimu kutafuta muda ambao umetulia, ili uweze kufikiria msaada unaouhitaji. Unaweza kuhitaji kuzungumza na mtu.

SourceText: One of us did not feel comfortable.
text: Mmoja wetu hakujisikia vizuri.

SourceText: This is difficult stuff to talk about. Find a relaxing time for it. We know it is much easier to not talk about these things and to hope they will never happen to us. However, learning to deal with crisis is like getting insurance; it is ALWAYS best to think about them and be prepared.
text: Haya ni mambo magumu kuyazungumzia. Tafuta muda wa utulivu kwa ajili hiyo. Tunajua ni rahisi zaidi kutozungumzia mambo haya na kuamini kuwa hayatakuja kututokea. Hata hivyo, kujifunza jinsi ya kushughulikia hali ya matatizo ni kama kupata bima; DAIMA ni bora zaidi kuifikiria na kujiandaa mapema.

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when talking to your teen about body changes and intimate relationships?
text: Je, umekuwa na changamoto yoyote unapozungumza na kijana wako kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi?

SourceText: It made me uncomfortable.
text: Ilinifanya nikose raha.

SourceText:
Talking about body changes, intimate relationships, and sex can be uncomfortable – many parents feel this way! 

Remember, these are all normal parts of life. The more you talk about them and educate your teen, the more prepared they are for keeping themselves healthy and safe.
text:
Kuzungumza kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili, mahusiano ya kimapenzi, na ngono inaweza kuwa ngumu – wazazi wengi wanajisikia hivi!

Kumbuka, haya yote ni kawaida katika maisha. Kadri unavyoyazungumzia na kumuelimisha kijana wako, ndio watakua wamejiandaa zaidi kujiweka salama na kulinda afya yao.

SourceText: It made my teen uncomfortable.
text: Ilimfanya kijana wangu akose raha.

SourceText:
Teens often do not want to speak to their parents about body changes, intimate relationships, and sex. Tell your teen that that is normal and you also went through this.
 
If they do not want to talk to you, give them resources so they can learn about the topic. Tell your teen that you are happy to speak with them any time!
text:
Vijana mara nyingi hawataki kuzungumza na wazazi wao kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili, mahusiano ya kimapenzi, na ngono. Mwambie kijana wako kwamba hiyo ni kawaida na wewe pia ulipitia hayo.

Ikiwa hawataki kuzungumza nawe, wape nyenzo ili waweze kujifunza kuhusu mada hizo. Mwambie kijana wako kwamba unafurahi kuzungumza naye wakati wowote!

SourceText: I do not know where to find resources to support my teen’s development.
text: Sijui nitapata wapi rasilimali za kusaidia maendeleo ya kijana wangu.

SourceText: It can be hard to find resources! Go to your nearest clinic or another support service and ask what resources they may have available.
text: Inaweza kuwa ngumu kupata rasilimali! Nenda kwenye kliniki iliyo karibu nawe au huduma nyingine ya usaidizi na kuuliza ni rasilimali gani zinaweza kuwepo.

SourceText: I think my teen is too young to be talking about these things.
text: Nadhani kijana wangu ni mdogo sana kuzungumza juu ya mambo haya.

SourceText: Talking about relationships and sex from an early age reduces the chance that teens end up in dangerous or unhealthy situations! It helps them know what is safe and healthy, so they can make good choices to keep themselves safe.
text: Kuzungumza juu ya mahusiano na ngono tangu umri mdogo kunapunguza uwezekano wa vijana kuishia katika hali hatarishi au mbaya! Inawasaidia kufahamu kilicho salama na chenye afya, ili waweze kufanya maamuzi mazuri kujiweka salama.

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when talking about the @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title with your teen?
text: Je, ulikuwa na changamoto yoyote wakati wa kuzungumza kuhusu @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title na kijana wako?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: My teen and/or I felt uncomfortable.
text: Kijana wangu na/au mimi tulijisikia vibaya.

SourceText:
Talking about potential dangers in our direct environment is never easy. However, dangerous situations can happen to anyone and helping your teen be prepared can make the biggest difference to keep them safe.

Try to have another conversation or practise with your teen so you can both get more confident with your new skills to stay safe.
text:
Kuzungumza juu ya hatari zinazowezekana katika mazingira yetu halisi sio rahisi kabisa. Hata hivyo, hali hatari zinaweza kutokea kwa mtu yeyote na kumsaidia kijana wako kuwa tayari kunaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa zaidi ili kumuweka salama.

Jaribu kuwa na mazungumzo mengine au fanya mazoezi na kijana wako ili nyote wawili muweze kujiamini zaidi na ujuzi wenu mpya ili kubaki salama.

SourceText: I discovered my teen experienced a dangerous situation or trauma.
text: Niligundua kijana wangu alipata hali ya hatari au kiwewe.

SourceText:
It can be hard for teens to open up about a difficult situation or trauma they experienced, especially if it happened while they were in a place or with people that you may not approve of as a parent.
Remember to breathe and listen to what your teen needs. You can find support together if needed.
text:
Inaweza kuwa vigumu kwa vijana kufunguka kuhusu hali ngumu au kiwewe walichopatia, hasa ikiwa ilitokea walipokuwa mahali au pamoja na watu ambao huenda hukuidhinisha kama mzazi. 
Kumbuka kuvuta pumzi na kusikiliza kile kijana wako anahitaji. Mnaweza kutafuta msaada pamoja ikiwa utahitajika.

SourceText: The conversation reminded me of a difficult experience I had.
text: Mazungumzo yalinikumbusha kuhusu hali ngumu niliyopatia.

SourceText:
It is normal to feel upset or angry when we are reminded of such experiences. Think about what support you may need. Taking good care of yourself is essential for taking good care of your family.

Once you are in a calmer space, you can try again to talk to your teen about how they can stay safe.
text:
Ni jambo la kawaida kukasirika au kukasirika tunapokumbushwa mambo kama hayo. Fikiria juu ya msaada gani unaweza kuhitaji. Kujitunza vizuri ni muhimu ili kutunza familia yako vizuri. 



Unapokuwa katika sehemu tulivu, unaweza kujaribu tena kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu jinsi anavyoweza kukaa salama.

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when sharing how you feel with your teen?
text: Je, ulipata changamoto ulipomshirikisha kijana wako hisia zako?

SourceText: I was afraid my teen would think I was weak.
text: Niliogopa kijana wangu angeniona mimi dhaifu.

SourceText: Sharing feelings, especially the difficult ones, sets an important example for your teen! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.
text: Kushirikishana hisia, hasa zile ngumu, huonesha mfano wa kuigwa kwa kijana wako! Kwa hakika humfanya kila mtu kwenye familia kuwa imara zaidi, kwa sababu mnaweza kuelewana na kusaidiana vizuri zaidi.

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable about naming specific difficult feelings.
text: Sikujisikia vizuri kuhusu kutaja hisia fulani ngumu.

SourceText: Being specific is not rude or insensitive – it really helps others to understand you clearly and this prevents confusion in the family. Feelings like sadness and anger are part of our lives. When we feel those emotions, it can help to share them with our teens and others. This way, our teens can also learn to share their emotions and we can support each other through difficult times.
text: Kuwa mahususi sio ukorofi wala kutojali- inasaidia wengine kukuelewa vizuri na hii huzuia hali ya kuchanganya mambo katika familia. Hisia kama huzuni na hasira ni sehemu ya maisha yetu. Tunapohisi hisia hizo, inaweza kusaidia kushirikishana na vijana wetu na wengine. Kwa njia hii, vijana wetu wanaweza pia kujifunza kutushirikisha hisia zao na tunaweza kusaidiana katika nyakati ngumu.

SourceText: My teen felt uncomfortable when I shared my feelings.
text: Kijana wangu hakujisikia vizuri nilipomshirikisha hisia zangu.

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it and keep showing a good example by observing and sharing your feelings. Over time, your teen will learn to do the same, and they will feel even more loved and cared for!
text: Kuanza kitu kipya mara zote ni vigumu. Jipe muda wa kuzoea na endelea kuonyesha mfano mzuri kwa kutambua hisia zako na kuwashirikisha wengine. Baada ya muda, kijana wako atajifunza kufanya hivyohivyo, na atahisi kupendwa na kutunzwa mno!

SourceText: When I shared my feelings, my teen asked many questions, which made me uncomfortable.
text: Nilipomshirikisha kijana wangu hisia zangu, aliuliza maswali mengi ambayo yalinifanya nisijikie raha.

SourceText: Sharing feelings helps your teen to be aware and learn to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It is up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later by saying, “I am feeling angry/stressed now. Could you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight.”
text: Kuwashirikisha wengine hisia zako humsaidia kijana wako kufahamu na kujifunza kufanya hivyohivyo. Unaweza kuchagua mambo unayotaka kuwashirikisha wengine kuhusu hali hiyo. Ni juu yako! Unaweza pia kuchagua kujibu maswali baadaye kwa kusema, “Sasa hivi ninahisi hasira/msongo wa mawazo. Unaweza kunipa muda, tafadhali? Tunaweza kuzungumza zaidi kuhusu jambo hili leo usiku.”

SourceText: I was too sad or overwhelmed to try sharing my feelings – I prefer to be alone when I feel like that.
text: Nilihuzunika au kuzidiwa nilipojaribu kushirikishana hisia zangu - napenda kuwa peke yangu ninapohisi hivyo.

SourceText: It is okay to not want to share at that time. Find some time to explain later, when you feel calmer, so that everyone can understand.
text: Si vibaya kutotaka kuwashirikisha wengine kwa wakati huo. Tafuta muda wa kuwaelezea baadaye, unapohisi utulivu zaidi, ili kila mtu aelewe.

SourceText: Challenges other parents experience:
text: Changamoto wanazopitia wazazi wengine:

SourceText: Your goal was to spend one-on-one time with your teen.
text: Lengo lilikuwa kuwa na muda wa pamoja na kijana wako.

SourceText: Sometimes it will be easy and fun to spend time with your teens, and sometimes it will be more challenging. Spending time together will definitely improve your relationship!
text: Wakati mwingine ni rahisi na inafurahisha kutumia muda pamoja na vijana wako, na wakati mwingi inakuwa ina changamoto zaidi. Kutumia muda pamoja itaboresha mahusiano yenu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult for you to spend time with your teen. We all have challenges sometimes. Just be patient with yourself and your teen – things will get better. Well done for trying!
text: Pole kusikia kwamba ilikuwa vigumu kwako kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Wakati mwingine, sisi sote tunakabiliwa na changamoto. Jivumilie tu na mvumilie kijana wako – mambo yatakuwa mazuri. Hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Your goal was to praise your teen.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kumsifia kijana wako.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our teens. Next time you spend one-on-one time with your teen, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”.
text: Muda mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kukumbuka kuwasifia vijana wetu. Wakati mwingine ukiwa unatumia muda wa pamoja na kijana wako, jaribu na fikiria kitu kimoja unachoweza kumsifia. Unaweza hata ukasema, “ Asante kwa kutumia muda pamoja na mimi!”.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Keep up the praise – you will see your teen do more and more of the behaviour you like to see!
text: Ni vizuri sana kusikia ilienda vizuri! Endelea kusifia – utamuona kijana wako anafanya zaidi na zaidi tabia unazopenda kuziona akizifanya!

SourceText: It sometimes takes a bit of time to adjust to praising, but it makes a big difference, you will see.
text: Wakati mwingine inachukua muda kidogo kuanza kusifia, lakini huleta mabadiliko makubwa, utaona.

SourceText: Sorry that you struggled with this. Starting with praise can take some practice, but you will see the positive results soon!
text: Pole kwa kuwa ulipambana na hili. Kuanza kusifia kunaweza kunahitaji mazoezi, lakini utaona matokeo mazuri hivi karibuni!

SourceText: You deserve some praise, too. Thank you again for using @global.parent_app. It shows you really care!
text: Unastahili pongezi pia. Asante kwa mara nyingine kwa kutumia @global.parent_app. Inaonesha unajali sana!
note: The string @global.parent_app. should not be translated.

SourceText: Your home practice was to try out REAL, POSITIVE and EXACT instructions with your teen.
text: Zoezi lako la nyumbani lilikuwa kujaribu kutoa maelekezo YANAYOTEKELEZEKA, CHANYA na SAHIHI kwa kijana wako.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. You are a star!
text: Nimefurahi kusikia ilienda vizuri. Wewe ni shujaa!

SourceText: Giving instructions in a new way takes some practice. Keep trying, you will soon see the difference it makes!
text: Kutoa maagizo kwa njia mpya kunahitaji mazoezi fulani. Endelea kujaribu, hivi karibuni utaona tofauti yake!

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing! Well done for trying to give your teen positive instructions and for building a positive relationship with your teen. 

Your teen deserves praise and YOU do as well!
text:
Asante kwa kushirikisha wengine! Hongera kwa kujaribu kumpa kijana wako maelekezo chanya na kwa kujenga uhusiano chanya na kijana wako.

Kijana wako anastahili kusifiwa na WEWE pia!

SourceText:
This week, your goal was: Whenever you are feeling stressed or upset, take five breaths in and out before you react. 

Your goal was also to talk to your teen about how you both felt in a stressful situation.
text:
Wiki hii, lengo lako lilikuwa: Wakati wowote unapohisi msongo wa mawazo au kukasirika, unavuta pumzi tano ndani na nje kabla ya kujibu.

Lengo lako lilikuwa pia kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu jinsi nyinyi wawili mlivyohisi katika hali ya msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: Life can be so stressful. Every small step counts. Keep up the good work!
text: Maisha yanaweza kutupa msongo wa mawazo. Kila hatua ndogo inahesabiwa. Endelea na kazi nzuri!

SourceText: Your goal was to make a family budget and savings plan.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kutengeneza bajeti ya familia na mpango wa kuweka akiba.

SourceText: It is never easy to talk about money. Well done on starting the conversation and teaching your teen about this.
text: Haijawahi kuwa rahisi kamwe kuzungumza juu ya pesa. Hongera sana kwa kuanzisha mazungumzo na kumfundisha kijana wako kuhusu hili.

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying. Helping your teen understand money better will benefit them so much in life!
text: Pole kusikia ilikuwa ngumu kwako. Umefanya vizuri kujaribu. Kumsaidia kijana wako kuelewa pesa vizuri itamnufaisha sana maishani!

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing your experiences! Well done for thinking about how you can budget and save with your family. This will really help you to work towards your family goals. 

Together you can achieve so many good things!
text:
Asante kwa kushirikisha uzoefu wako! Hongera sana kwa kufikiria jinsi unavyoweza kupanga bajeti na kuweka akiba na familia yako. Kufanya hivyo kutakusaidia sana kuweza kufikia malengo ya familia yako.

Kwa pamoja, mnaweza kufanikisha mambo mengi sana mazuri!

SourceText: Your goal was to make ONE rule with your teen.
text: Lengo lako ilikuwa kutengeneza sheria moja na kijana wako.

SourceText: It can be hard to create your first rule together, but you will see the benefits of involving your family. Keep trying!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuunda sheria yako ya kwanza pamoja, lakini utaona manufaa ya kuhusisha familia yako. Endelea kujaribu!

SourceText: Well done for this! It is not easy, and teenagers will not keep to the rules all the time, but making a few key rules together is a great start. Praise yourself for trying this – we are proud of you!
text: Umefanya vizuri sana kwa hili! Si rahisi, na vijana hawawezi kutii sheria wakati wote, lakini kwa kutengeneza sheria muhimu kwa pamoja ni mwanzo mzuri. Jipongeze kwa kujaribu hili – tunajivunia wewe!

SourceText: Your goal was to introduce ONE positive consequence (for your teen taking responsibility) and ONE negative consequence (for your teen breaking a household rule).
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kuweka athari MOJA chanya (kwa kijana wako kuwajibika) na athari MOJA hasi (kwa kijana wako kuvunja sheria ya kaya).

SourceText: Staying calm and consistent can be hard, but you are doing so well. You can do this!
text: Kukaa kwa utulivu na thabiti inaweza kuwa ngumu, lakini unafanya vizuri sana. Unaweza kufanya hii!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. Setting consequences together will make your teen want to follow the rules more often!
text: Pole kwamba hii ilikuwa ngumu kwako. Kuweka matokeo pamoja kutafanya kijana wako atake kufuata sheria mara nyingi zaidi!

SourceText: Your goal was to try and resolve a problem or conflict together with your teen.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kujaribu kutatua tatizo au mgogoro pamoja na kijana wako.

SourceText: Solving problems together takes some practice. The more often you involve your teen when you are both calm, the better it will go. Well done for trying!
text: Kutatua matatizo pamoja kunahitaji mazoezi fulani. Kadiri unavyomhusisha kijana wako mara nyingi wakati wote mmetulia, ndivyo mambo yatakavyokuwa mazuri zaidi. Umefanya vizuri kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Your goal was to map risks and support systems with your teen – both in your community and online.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kubainisha maeneo ya hatari na sehemu za msaada pamoja na kijana wako – kwenye jamii yako na mtandaoni.

SourceText: Even if it did not go so well yet, you will get there! Mapping risks and support systems together will help your family. Well done for trying.
text: Hata kama haijaenda vizuri bado, Utafanikiwa! Kubainisha maeneo hatari kwa pamoja na mifumo ya msaada itasaidia familia yako. Vizuri sana kwa kujaribu.

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss a possible crisis situation with your teen and make a plan for it.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kujadili na kijana wako hali ya mgogoro inayoweza kutokea na kuweka mpango wa kukabiliana nayo.

SourceText: It can be hard to think and talk about a crisis happening in your family. By trying you are already on the right path. Keep up the good work!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuzungmzia majanga yanayotokea katika familia yako. Kwa kujaribu tu, tayari upo katika njia sahihi. Endelea na kazi nzuri!

SourceText: Sorry that it did not go so well. This is not easy to do. Try to sit down and discuss it with your teen again. Also, is there someone your teen trusts who could join you in the discussion with your teen?
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo hayakwenda vizuri sana. Si rahisi kufanya hivyo. Jaribu kukaa chini na kulijadili tena na kijana wako. Pia, je, kuna mtu ambaye kijana wako anamwamini anayeweza kuungana na wewe kwenye mazungumzo na kijana wako?

SourceText: Your goal was to look at the stories in this module together with your teen and let it spark a discussion about body changes and intimate relationships.
text: Lengo lako likikua kuzipitia hadithi katika moduli hii pamoja na kijana wako na kuiruhusu kuibua mazungumzo kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

SourceText: Well done for trying it out – you took a very important step to help your teen!
text: Hongera kwa kuijaribu - ulichukua hatua muhimu sana kumsaidia kijana wako!

SourceText: Talking about these sensitive topics can be uncomfortable for both you and your teen. The more you try, the better it will get. It is worth every bit of your effort!
text: Kuzungumza kuhusu mada hizi nyeti kunaweza kukukosesha raha wewe na kijana wako. Unapojaribu zaidi, itakuwa bora zaidi. Inastahili kila juhudi yako!

SourceText: It can be hard to talk to your teen about these things. That is okay. Well done for trying, you will get another opportunity again soon!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu mambo haya. Hiyo ni sawa. Hongera kwa kujaribu, utapata fursa nyingine tena hivi karibuni!

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss the @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title with your teen.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kujadili @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title na kijana wako.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: Well done for involving your teen! Discussing these difficult topics can help keep your teen safe when it matters most.
text: Hongera kwa kumshirikisha kijana wako! Kujadili mada hizi ngumu kunaweza kusaidia kumweka salama kijana wako katika nyakati ngumu sana.

SourceText: Talking about potentially dangerous situations with your teen can be challenging, but just know that you started an important conversation! Keep up the good work.
text: Kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu hali zinazoweza kuwa hatari kunaweza kuwa vigumu, lakini jua tu kwamba umeanzisha mazungumzo muhimu! Endelea na kazi nzuri.

SourceText: Discussing potential dangers and how to respond can be a trigger for any parent and teen. The fact that you tried already makes a big difference and really shows you care.
text: Kujadili hatari zinazoweza kutokea na jinsi ya kujibu kunaweza kuwa kichocheo kwa mzazi na kijana yeyote. Ukweli kwamba umejaribu tayari hufanya tofauti kubwa na inaonyesha kuwa unajali.

SourceText: Well done for exploring solutions to your challenges. Go try them out. Your relationship with your teen will get stronger and stronger!
text: Hongera sana kwa kutafuta njia za kutatua changamoto zako. Nenda ukazijaribu. Uhusiano wako na kijana wako utaimarika zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText: This week, your goal was: Share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.
text: Wiki hii, lengo lako lilikuwa: Kumshirikisha kijana wako jinsi unavyohisi, na uwaombe pia wataje hisia zao.

SourceText: Well done! Sharing feelings will help your family to support each other and get through this difficult time together.
text: Hongera! Kuwashirikisha hisia zako itafanya familia yako wasaidiane kwa pamoja na kuondokana na hali hii ngumu pamoja.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can be challenging at first. Try again another time. It will help you and your family.
text: Kuongea kuhusu hisia zako inaweza kuwa changamoto mwanzoni. Jaribu tena wakati mwingine. Itakusaidia wewe na familia yako.

SourceText: Losing someone impacts everyone differently. Be kind to yourself and take some time to notice and share how you feel when you are ready. You will see it will help you and your family.
text: Kupoteza mtu inaathiri kila mtu tofauti. Jikarimishe mwenyewe na pata muda kutambua na kushirikishana jinsi unavyohisi ukiwa tayari. Utaona itakusaidia wewe na familia yako.

SourceText: Well done for exploring solutions to your challenges. Go try them out. Together with your teen you can get through difficult times stronger.
text: Hongera sana kwa kutafuta suluhisho la changamoto zako. Nenda ukajaribu. Wewe na kijana wako mnaweza pitia nyakati ngumu zaidi.

SourceText: That is okay, do not be too hard on yourself. We encourage you to try and do it when you can.
text: Hiyo ni sawa, usiwe mgumu sana kwako mwenyewe. Tunakuhimiza ujaribu kuifanya unapoweza.

SourceText: Amazing that it went so well. Keep doing more activities together and you will find that is a great way to learn together!
text: Inafurahisha kwamba ilienda vizuri. Endelea kufanya kazi pamoja na utagundua kwamba ni njia nzuri ya kujifunza pamoja!

SourceText: Well done for doing the activity! It is normal to have ups and downs. Keep trying these activities and hopefully next time is great.
text: Hongera kwa kufanya shughuli! Ni kawaida kuwa na heka heka. Endelea kujaribu shughuli hizi na tunatumaini kuwa wakati ujao utakuwa mzuri.

SourceText: Do not be hard on yourself if things did not go as planned. Being a parent means that things will not always go as planned.
text: Usijisumbue endapo mambo hayakwenda kama ilivyopangwa. Kuwa mzazi inamaanisha kuwa mara nyingi mambo hayataenda kama ilivyopangwa.

SourceText: Well done for spending time together! That is how your relationship will get stronger and you will help your teen learn important skills for life.
text: Umefanya vizuri kwa kutumia muda pamoja! Hivyo ndivyo uhusiano wako utakavyoimarika na utamsaidia kijana wako kujifunza ujuzi muhimu maishani.

SourceText: Good that you tried the activity! It can take some time for everyone to get used to new things. Try it again tomorrow – spending time together sets your teen up for success in life!
text: Ni vizuri kwamba ulijaribu shughuli! Inaweza kuchukua muda kwa kila mtu kuzoea mambo mapya. Ijaribu tena kesho - kutumia muda pamoja humtayarisha kijana wako kwa mafanikio maishani!

SourceText: Sorry that things did not go as you hoped. Try this or another activity again next time you have a few minutes to spare. The fact that you are here shows you want the best for your teen!
text: Samahani kwamba mambo hayakwenda kama ulivyotarajia. Jaribu shughuli hii au nyingine tena wakati mwingine ukiwa na dakika chache za kusawazisha. Ukweli kwamba uko hapa unaonyesha kuwa unatarajia mazuri kwa kijana wako!

SourceText: So good that you managed to try this activity together. Doing something fun together is a great way for your teen to learn new skills.
text: Ni vizuri sana kwamba umeweza kujaribu shughuli hii pamoja. Kufanya kwa pamoja  kitu cha kufurahisha ni njia nzuri kwa kijana wako kujifunza ujuzi mpya.

SourceText: Spending time together makes a big difference. With just a few minutes together every day, you will see your relationship grow and your teen learn many things they don’t learn at school.
text: Kukaa na kijana wako pamoja huleta utofauti mkubwa. Mkitumia dakika chache tu pamoja kila siku, utaona uhusiano wenu unakua na kijana wako atijifunza mambo mengi ambayo hajifunzi shuleni.

SourceText: We all have moments where things do not work out. Try again tomorrow. You will see the difference and your teen will thank you later for taking time for them!
text: Sisi sote tuna wakati ambapo mambo hayaendi sawa. Jaribu tena kesho. Utaona tofauti na kijana wako atakushukuru baadaye kwa kupata muda kwa ajili yake!

SourceText: Let’s talk about how your home activity with your teen went.
text: Hebu tuzungumze kuhusu jinsi shughuli zako za nyumbani na kijana wako zilivyoenda.

SourceText: That’s okay, hopefully you can try it soon and see how it turns out.
text: Hiyo ni sawa, ni matumaini kuwa unaweza kuijaribu hivi karibuni na uone jinsi itatokea.

SourceText: Great that you could try this activity with your teen! Your teen is learning so much just by spending time with you.
text: Inapendeza kwamba unaweza kujaribu shughuli hii na kijana wako! Kijana wako anajifunza mengi sana kwa kupata muda wa kuwa pamoja nawe.

SourceText: Well done for trying the activity. Things do not always go smoothly from the start. Try again tomorrow. Your teen is learning new skills and you are becoming closer as a family.
text: Hongera kwa kujaribu shughuli hii. Mambo huwa hayaendi sawa mwanzoni. Jaribu tena kesho. Kijana wako anajifunza ujuzi mpya na mnakuwa karibu zaidi kama familia.

SourceText: Sorry that today was hard. You can try again another day. By choosing to do an everyday activity or household chore together, you can spend quality time with your teen while still getting your other work done. Everyone wins!
text: Pole kwamba siku ya leo ilikuwa ngumu. Unaweza kujaribu tena siku nyingine. Kwa kuchagua kufanya shughuli za kila siku au kazi ya nyumbani kwa pamoja, mnaweza kutumia muda bora na kijana wako huku mkiendelea kufanya kazi zenu nyingine. Kila mtu anashinda!

SourceText: Well done for trying one of the activities! Remember that these activities can be done many times and this will support your teen’s development and learning.
text: Hongera kwa kujaribu moja ya shughuli hizi! Kumbuka kwamba shughuli hizi zinaweza kufanywa mara nyingi na hii itamsaidia kijana wako kukua na kujifunza.

SourceText: Did you have a chance to try this?
text: Je, ulipata nafasi ya kujaribu hili?

SourceText: How did it go?
text: Je, liliendaje?

SourceText: That’s wonderful! Well done for spending time together. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your teen!
text: Vizuri sana! Hongereni kwa kutumia muda pamoja. Kufanya hivyo kunaweka msingi wa uhusiano mzuri sana na kijana wako!

SourceText: Good for you! One-on-one time shows your teens they are important to you. It really makes a difference!
text: Heri yako! Kutumia muda wa pamoja unawaonesha vijana wako kuwa wao ni watu muhimu kwako. Kufanya hivyo kunaleta mabadiliko!

SourceText: Wonderful! Spending time with your teen may make your teen more willing to help out more often. You are doing great!
text: Vizuri sana! Kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako kunaweza kumfanya kijana wako awe tayari kusaidia mara nyingi. Unafanya vizuri sana!

SourceText: Well done! One-on-one time with your teen gives you a chance to learn more about your teen’s interests and abilities. You are a star!
text: Hongera! Kutumia muda wa pamoja na kijana wako unakupa nafasi ya kujifunza zaidi kuhusu mambo anayoyapendelea na uwezo wake. Wewe ni mshindi!

SourceText: Excellent job! Spending time together helps to build a strong and positive relationship between you and your teen.
text: Kazi nzuri sana! Kutumia muda pamoja kunasaidia kujenga uhusiano mzuri na imara kati yako na kijana wako.

SourceText: Sometimes it will be easy and fun to spend time with your teens, and sometimes it will be more challenging. Spending time together will greatly improve your relationship; well done for trying!
text: Wakati mwingine, kutumia muda pamoja na vijana wako kutakuwa rahisi na kutafurahisha, na wakati mwingine kutakuwa kugumu zaidi. Kutumia muda pamoja kutaboresha sana uhusiano wenu; hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult for you to spend time with your teen. We all have challenges sometimes. Just be patient with yourself and your teen - things will get better. Well done for trying!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kwamba ilikuwa vigumu kwako kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Wakati mwingine, sisi sote tunakabiliwa na changamoto. Jivumilie tu na mvumilie kijana wako – mambo yatakuwa mazuri. Hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well; you are a star!
text: Ni jambo zuri sana kusikia kuwa mambo yameenda Wewe ni mshindi!

SourceText: Wonderful! You deserve all the happy times!
text: Vizuri sana! Unastahili kufurahi nyakati zote!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. You are a star for trying!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Wewe ni mshindi kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Amazing to hear it made you feel good! Keep up the great work. Your teen is learning so much from you!
text: Inafurahisha sana kuona umejisikia vizuri! Endeleza kazi hiyo nzuri sana. Kijana wako anajifunza mengi kutoka kwako!

SourceText: Talking about how we feel can be difficult at first, but you and your teen will get used to it. Keep trying, and you will see the positive results!
text: Kuzungumza kuhusu tunavyohisi kunaweza kuwa kugumu mwanzoni, lakini wewe na kijana wako mtazoea. Endelea kujaribu, utaona matokeo mazuri!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. Talking about your finances together really makes your family stronger!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri. Kuzungumzia fedha zako pamoja kunaimarisha zaidi familia yako!

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Consistent rules help make our teens feel secure, and keep them safe!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Sheria thabiti husaidia kuwafanya vijana wetu kujisikia salama, na kuwaweka salama!

SourceText: Sorry that this has been difficult. Creating rules together requires some practice but it is worth it!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa jambo hili limekuwa gumu. Kuweka sheria pamoja kunahitaji mazoezi, lakini kuna faida!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult. Setting consequences together will make your teen want to follow the rules more often!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Kutafuta pamoja njia za kufanya malipo kutamfanya kijana wako atake kufuata sheria mara nyingi!

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Sometimes we just have to keep trying. Find a time when you and your teen are calm and try again to talk through a problem using the four steps of problem-solving. Together, you can do so much!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Wakati mwingine tunapaswa kuendelea kujaribu. Tafuta muda ambao wewe na kijana wako mtakuwa mmetulia halafu mjaribu tena kuzungumzia tatizo kwa kutumia hatua nne za kutatua matatizo. Pamoja, mnaweza kufanya makubwa!

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Talking about risks and support options prevents problems and really helps to keep your teen safe.
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kuzungumzia hatari na njia za msaada huzuia matatizo na husaidia sana kumweka salama kijana wako.

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Mapping risks and places to get support can be challenging and emotional. It really does help to keep your teen safe!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Kuonyesha maeneo ya hatari na ya kupata msaada kunaweza kuleta changamoto na hisia kali. Kufanya hivyo kunasaidia sana kumweka salama kijana wako!

SourceText: Sorry that it didn’t go so well. This is not easy to do. Try to sit down and discuss it with your teen again. Also, is there someone your teen trusts who could join you in the discussion with your teen?
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo hayakwenda vizuri sana. Si rahisi kufanya hivyo. Jaribu kukaa chini na kulijadili tena na kijana wako. Pia, je, kuna mtu ambaye kijana wako anamwamini anayeweza kuungana na wewe kwenye mazungumzo na kijana wako?

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kuweka athari sahihi husaidia vijana kuwa na tabia nzuri zaidi na kufanya maisha ya familia kuwa tulivu zaidi.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! When your teen learns how to solve problems, they can use that skill their whole life. What a gift!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kijana wako anapojifunza kutatua matatizo, anaweza kutumia ujuzi huo maishani mwake mwote. Zawadi iliyoje!

SourceText: Other parents’ questions
text: Maswali ya wazazi wengine

SourceText:
Many parents really want to support their teens, but struggle to talk about sensitive topics like body changes and intimate relationships.

Let’s look at a few questions from other parents to help you get started.
text:
Wazazi wengi wanataka sana kusaidia vijana wao, lakini upata wakati mgumu kuzungumza kuhusu mada nyeti kama vile mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi. 

Hebu tuangalie maswali machache kutoka kwa wazazi wengine ili kukusaidia kuanza.

SourceText: Warning signs
text: Ishara za onyo

SourceText:
People around us can make us feel respected, happy and safe. But sometimes, people can pressure us and make us feel uncomfortable. This can happen to teenagers and adults. 

When we know the warning signs, we can try and stop the situation to stay safe.

Let’s look at some scenarios.
text:
Watu wanaotuzunguka wanaweza kutufanya tujisikie kuheshimiwa, kuwa na furaha na salama. Lakini nyakati fulani, watu wanaweza kutushinikiza na kutufanya tukose raha. Hii inaweza kutokea kwa vijana na watu wazima.

Tunapojua ishara za onyo, tunaweza kujaribu na kukomesha hali hiyo ili tubaki salama.

Hebu tuangalie baadhi ya matukio

SourceText: Use your voice
text: Tumia sauti yako

SourceText:
When we do not feel safe, we are allowed to do, say, and believe anything that helps keep us safe. The goal is to get away!

Let’s think about the scenario when @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2 was forced into a car by a man.

How could @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2 use her voice to get away?
text:
Wakati hatujisikii salama, tunaruhusiwa kufanya, kusema, na kuamini chochote kinachosaidia kutuweka salama. Lengo ni kuondoka!

Hebu tufikirie hali ambapo @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2 alilazimishwa kuingia kwenye gari na mwanamume.

Je, @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2 angewezaje kutumia sauti yake kutoroka?

SourceText: Use your body
text: Tumia mwili wako

SourceText:
When our voice does not stop the situation, we can use our bodies to defend ourselves. 

@global.w_svp_teen_girl_2’s attacker has some weak spots she can target in order to get away. The same can work for you:
text:
Pale sauti zetu zinaposhindwa kuzuia hali hiyo, tunaweza kutumia miili yetu kujilinda.

Anayemshambulia @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2 ana sehemu dhaifu za kulenga ili kukimbia. Hali hiyo inaweza kukusaidia pia:
note: The string @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2’s should not be translated.

SourceText: Name your feelings
text: Taja hisia zako

SourceText:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel. 

Let's practice naming feelings.
text:
Tunapopitia wakati mgumu, inaweza kusaidia kuzungumzia au kuandika jinsi tunavyohisi.

Wacha tujizoeze kutaja hisia.

SourceText: What could I do?
text: Nini unaweza kufanya?

SourceText: Let’s think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.
text: Hebu tufikirie shughuli unazoweza kufanya na kijana wako ili kuwasaidia kujifunza.

SourceText: Doing chores together
text: Kufanya kazi za nyumbani pamoja

SourceText: Cleaning up is an important life skill. Get your teen to help you clean the house and make it fun!
text: Usafi ni ujuzi wa muhimu katika maisha. Mchukue kijana wako akusaidie usafi wa nyumba na ifanye iwe ya kufurahisha!

SourceText:
1. Make a list of all the chores in the house with your teen. For example: washing dishes, sweeping, cooking, making the beds, or doing laundry.
2. Every week, let each family member choose a chore they want to do. 
3. Agree when the chore should be done by.
4. Agree on what the consequence will be if it is not finished, and what small reward you can give as motivation to do the chore.
5. When the chore is done, praise your teen and let them mark it as 'done' on your list of chores. Praise and seeing progress are great motivation!
text:
1. Tengeneza orodha ya kazi zote za nyumbani pamoja na kijana wako. Kwa mfano: kuosha vyombo, kufagia, kupika, kutandika vitanda, au kufua
2. Kila wiki, acha kila mwanafamilia achague kazi anayotaka kufanya.
3. Kubali wakati kazi hiyo inapaswa kufanywa na.
4. Kubaliana juu ya matokeo yatakuwaje ikiwa haijakamilika, na ni thawabu gani ndogo unaweza kutoa kama motisha ya kufanya kazi hiyo.
5. Kazi inapokamilika, msifu kijana wako na umruhusu atie alama kuwa 'imekamilika' kwenye orodha yako ya kazi za nyumbani. Kusifu na kuona maendeleo ni motisha kubwa!

SourceText:
* When your teen is part of the decision, your teen will be more willing to help out.
* A reward does not have to cost money and can be something small, like going to bed a bit later, having more time with friends, or doing a fun (free) activity together.
* If your teen did not complete the chore, do not discipline them harshly. Instead, ask them why they were not able to complete the task and give them the consequence you decided on earlier.
text:
* Kijana wako anapokuwa sehemu ya uamuzi huo, kijana wako atakuwa tayari kukusaidia.
* Zawadi si lazima igharimu pesa na inaweza kuwa kitu kidogo, kama vile kulala baadaye, kuwa na wakati mwingi na marafiki, au kufanya shughuli ya kufurahisha (bila malipo) pamoja.
* Ikiwa kijana wako hakumaliza kazi hiyo, usiwaadhibu kwa ukali. Badala yake, waulize kwa nini hawakuweza kukamilisha kazi na uwape matokeo uliyoamua mapema.

SourceText: Traditional game
text: Michezo ya asili

SourceText: Playing Bao can be a fun way to spend time with your teen. They will be excited to play a game with you and not only do chores.
text: Kucheza Bao inaweza kuwa njia ya kufurahisha ya kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Watakuwa na hamasa kucheza mchezo pamoja na wewe na sio tu kufanya kazi.

SourceText:
You can play by drawing a Bao board in the sand and finding 32 small seeds, stones, or other small objects.

The board has 2 rows with 8 small pits in each one, and 2 larger pits at the ends of the rows.
text:
Unaweza kucheza kwa kuchora Matundu ya bao kwenya ardhi na kutafuta mbegu ndogo 32, mawe, au vitu vidogovidogo. 

Ubao unakuwa na pande mbili yenye matundu madogo 8 kila pande, na matundu mawili makubwa mwishoni mwa pande hizo mbili.

SourceText:
1. Place 2 pieces (seeds, stones or whatever you found) in each of the smaller pits. The larger pits at the end of each row should be empty.
2. Decide who will go first. Choose one pit from your side, pick up the stones (there should be 2) and move in a circle around the board, drop one stone into each pit. It is then the other person's turn. The goal is to get all your stones into your big pit before the other person.
3. Keep playing until you have no more stones or no one can move any stones anymore. The person with the most stones in the big pit wins.
text:
1. Weka vipande viwili (mbegu, mawe au chochote utakachokipata) katika kila tundu dogo. Matundu makubwa kwa kila upande yanatakiwa yasiwe na kitu.
2. Muamue yupi ataanza. Chagua tundu moja katika upande wako, chukua mawe (yanatakiwa yawe mawili) na kutembea katika mzunguko ndani ya ubao, dondosha jiwe moja katika kila kishimo. Ni zamu ya mtu mwingine. Lengo ni kuweka mawe yote katika shimo kubwa kabla mtu mwingine.
3. Endelea kucheza mpaka ukiwa huna mawe tena au hakuna mtu anaweza kuzungusha mawe tena. Mtu mwenye mawe mengi katika shimo kubwa anashinda.

SourceText:
* If you played before, tell your teen stories about you playing the game.
* Play a practice game to help your teen understand the rules.
* Celebrate your teen’s successes and encourage them to keep practising, even if they do not win right away.
text:
* Kama ulicheza kabla, msimulie kijana wako kuhusu ulivyocheza mchezo huu.
* Cheza mchezo wa majaribio kumsaidia kijana wako kuelewa sheria.
* Sheherekea mafanikio ya kijana wako na muhimize kuendelea kufanya mazoezi hata kama hajashinda sasa.

SourceText: Walking together
text: Tembea pamoja

SourceText: Walking around your community is an easy and fun way to spend quality time together. It is good exercise and helps your teen learn about their community.
text: Kutembea katika jamii yako ni rahisi na njia ya kufurahisha kutumia muda pamoja. Ni mazoezi mazuri na yanasaidia kijana wako kujifunza kuhusu jamii yao.

SourceText:
1. Plan: Discuss with your teen to choose a time and a place to walk together. It could be a nearby park, market, or any interesting area. If you were going there anyway, ask your teen if they want to come with you.
2. Observe and explore: Encourage your teen to ask questions about what they see on the walk. This could be about people, nature or buildings.
3. Learn together: Tell your teen things you know about the area. For example, who lives in different directions, your favourite flower, or what the area looked like long ago.
text:
1. Panga. Jadili na  kijana wako mmchague muda na mahali kutembea pamoja. Inaweza kuwa sehemu ya wazi ya karibu, sokoni, au sehemu yoyote ya kuvutia. Na kama unaenda sehemu hiyo, muulize kijana kama anataka kwenda na wewe.
2. Tazama na chunguza. Muhamasishe kijana wako kuuliza maswali kuhusu wanachoona njiani mkitembea. Hii inaweza kuwa kuhusu watu, mandhari au majengo.
3. Tujifunze pamoja. Mwambie kijana wako kuhusu vitu unavyojua eneo hilo. Kwa mfano, watu wanaoishi pande tofauti, maua yako pendwa, au jinsi gani eneo hilo lilikuwa linaonekana kipindi cha nyuma

SourceText:
* Use technology: Bring along your smartphone to take pictures of interesting things you see on the walk. Let your teen take photos and talk about it!
* Make it regular: Schedule regular walks and explore new locations to keep the activity fresh and fun.
text:
* Tumia teknolojia: Tembea na simu janja yako kwa ajili ya kupiga picha ya vitu vinavyovutia unavyoviona wakati unatembea. Acha kijana wako apige picha na kuziongelea!
*Fanya kitu cha mara kwa mara: Pangeni matembezi ya mara kwa mara na tafuta maeneo mapya kufanya zoezi kuwa jipya na shirikishi.

SourceText: Cooking traditional food
text: Pika chakula cha asili

SourceText: Cooking traditional @global.regional food with your teen is a great way to connect, learn new skills, and share stories about your culture.
text: Kupika chakula cha asili @global.regional food na kijana wako ni njia bora ya kuwaunganisha, kujifunza ujuzi mpya, na kusilimuliana kuhusu tamaduni yako.
note: The string @global.regional should not be translated.

SourceText:
1. Choose a recipe: Find a traditional recipe that you and your teen would like to prepare. You can also ask friends and family for their favourites.
2. Gather ingredients: Ask your teen to help you get all the necessary ingredients and materials. 
3. Clean and prepare the cooking area: Make sure the kitchen area is clean and tidy before you start cooking. Teach your teen to wash their hands thoroughly when working with food.
4. Enjoy the meal: Eat the meal you prepared together! Talk about the flavours and textures of the food and share stories about traditional food in your culture.
5. Clean up: Once you have finished eating, clean up the cooking area together.
text:
1. Chagua aina ya mapishi. Tafuta mapishi ya kitamaduni ambayo wewe na kijana wako mngependa kuandaa. Unaweza pia kuuliza marafiki na familia kile wanachopendelea.
2. Andaa viungo. Uliza kijana wako akusaidie kupata viungo na vyote muhimu.
3. Safisha na andaa eneo la kupikia. Hakikisha eneo la jikoni ni safi na nadhifu kabla ya kuanza kupika. Mfundishe kijana wako kunawa mikono vizuri anapoandaa chakula.
4. Furahia chakula. Kula chakula mlichoandaa pamoja! Zungumza kuhusu ladha na muundo wa chakula na mshirikishane hadithi kuhusu vyakula vya kitamaduni katika jamii yenu.
5. Safisha. Mara baada ya kumaliza kula, safisheni kwa pamoja sehemu ya kupikia.

SourceText:
* Plan with your teen: Ask your teen in the morning if they can help you with the cooking tonight. This gives them time to plan their school work and time with friends.
* Involve them: Tell them what you are cooking tonight and ask them if they know the ingredients. 
* Clear tasks: Ask your teen to chop the food or check the heat of the pots. They will be more interested if they help you and not only watch you cook.
* Make it regular: Ask them to help you with the cooking more and let them try different jobs like chopping different vegetables or starting a fire.
text:
* Panga na kijana wako: Muulize kijana wako kama anaweza kukusaidia kupika usiku. Hii, inawapa muda wa kupangilia kazi zao za shule na muda pamoja na marafiki.
* Wahusishe: Waambie ni nini unapika usiku na wauliza kama wanajua viungo husika.
* Gawa kazi: Muulize kijana wako aandae chakula na kuangalia hali ya joto ya sufuria. Watakuwa na shauku zaidi kama watakusaidia na sio kukuangalia tu kupika.
* Ifanye iwe ya mara kwa mara: Waambie wakusaidie kupika zaidi na waache wajaribu kazi nyingine kama kukata mboga tofauti au kuwasha moto.

SourceText: Gardening
text: Shughuli za bustani

SourceText: Gardening is a fun way to spend quality time with your teen. It is also very useful for them to learn how to grow food.
text: Shughuli za bustani ni njia ya kufurahisha ya kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Na pia ni muhimu sana kwao kujifunza namna ya kupanda mimea ya chakula.

SourceText:
1. Choose some plants: Ask your teen to help you choose some plants to grow in the garden. This will make them feel involved.
You could choose plants you can eat, like vegetables or herbs, which you can grow and then cook together. 
2. Get creative with containers: You do not need lots of space to plant a garden. You can use old broken buckets, tin cans, or even plastic bottles as pots to plant in.
3. Plant the seeds: Make planting the seeds a fun activity. Have a "planting party" where you and your teen take turns planting the seeds in the soil. 
4. Water and care for the plants: Create a time table for watering and caring for the plants. Let your teen take charge of this task and ask them to look after the plants they planted.
5. Watch the plants grow: Encourage your teen to write down the changes they see every week to see how much the plants have grown.
text:
1. Chagua baadhi ya mimea: Mwambie kijana akusaidie kuchagua baadhi ya mimea ya kupanda katika bustani. Hii itawafanya wajione wanahusishwa.
Unaweza kuchagua mimea ambayo unaweza kula, kama mboga za majani au mimea dawa, ambayo unaweza kupanda na pia kuzipika kwa pamoja.
2. Kuwa mbunifu na vifaa vya kutunzia: Huhitaji sehemu kubwa ya kupanda bustani. Unaweza kutumia ndoo mbovu, makopo, au chupa za plastiki kama vyungu vya kupandia.
3. Panda mbegu: Fanya kupanda mbegu kama jambo la furaha. Fanya "Sherehe ya upandaji mbegu" na kijana wako, panda mbegu kwa kubadilishana na kijana wako.
4. Mwagilia na jali mimea: Tengeneza ratiba ya kumwagilizia na kujali mimea. Mwache kijana wako asimamie jukumu hili na waambie waiangalie mimea waliyopanda.
5. Angalia mimea ukikuwa: Muhamasishe kijana wako aandike mabadiliko anayoyaona kila wiki ili kuona kwa kiasi gani mimea inakuwa.

SourceText:
* Let your teen make some of the decisions, like where to dig the holes or which container to plant in. 
* Make gardening social by inviting friends or family to join the fun.
text:
* Muache kijana wako afanye baadhi ya maamuzi, kama wapi pakuchimba mashimo au kontena lipi lipandwe nini.
* Fanya upandaji mbegu kuwa jambo la kijamii kwa kuwaalika marafiki au familia washiriki furaha hio.

SourceText: Charades
text: Mchezo wa mafumbo

SourceText: Charades is an easy, fun game that will teach your teen to think quickly, work together and be bold.
text: Mchezo wa mafumbo ni rahisi, wa kufurahisha utamsaidia kijana wako kufikiri kwa haraka, kufanya kazi kwa pamoja na kuwa jasiri.

SourceText:
1. One person thinks of a word, which they don’t tell anyone else.
2. They then have to act out the word, without speaking, to try and get the other people to guess the word.
3. Some words you could try to act out are things like sweeping, eating, playing a sport, or brushing teeth. 
4. If you guess the word right, it is the other person's turn.
text:
1. Mtu mmoja anafikiria neno ambalo hawamwambii mtu yeyote yule.
2. Halafu wanafanya maigizo kulingana na hilo neno, bila kuongea, kujaribu na kuwafanya watu wengine wabuni hilo neno.
3. Baadhi ya maneno unaweza jaribu ni kama kufagia, kula, kucheza michezo au kusugua meno.
4. Ukipatia neno hilo kwa usahihi, ni zamu ya mtu mwingine.

SourceText:
* Make sure everyone gets a turn to act out words or phrases.  
* Remember to praise your teen for trying. 
* If your teen is struggling to guess, give them hints on what it could be.
* If the game is too easy, try more difficult words. 
* Remember to have fun and support each other for the whole game.
text:
* Hakikisha kila mmoja anapata nafasi ya kuigiza neno au misemo.
* Kumbuka kumpongeza kijana wako kwa kujaribu.
* Kama kijana wako anapata changamoto, mpatie vidokezo kuhusu nini inaweza kuwa.
* Kama mchezo ni rahisi, jaribu maneno au misemo migumu.
* Kumbuka kuwa na furaha na msaidiane kwa pamoja katika mchezo wote.

SourceText: Role play
text: Maigizo

SourceText:
Role-playing is when you pretend to be someone in a certain situation, and act out how you think things will go. 

This is a fun way to help your teen understand how others might act or feel, and for you to learn more about how your teen thinks and feels.
text:
Igizo ni pale ambapo unajifanya kuwa mtu katika hali fulani, na igiza namna unafikiri vitu vitakavyoenda.

Hii ni njia ya furaha ya kumsaidia kijana wako aelewe jinsi wengine watafanya au kujisikia, na kwa ajili yako kujifunza zaidi kuhusu namna kijana wako anavofikiria na kujisikia.

SourceText:
1. Ask your teen if they want to try out this “role-playing” with you.
2. Ask your teen to choose a situation that they would like to act out. It can be something they saw at school, in your community, or on social media.  For example, being a teacher and student at their school.
3. Let your teen decide who should play which role, and act out the scenario together. 
4. Take time to talk about what you learned through role-playing. Ask questions like, "How did you feel acting out that role?" or, "What did you learn about that situation?". This will help your teen to think about how other people think and feel.
text:
1. Muulize kijana wako kama anataka kujaribu "kuigiza" huku na wewe.
2. Mwambie kijana wako achague hali ambayo angependa kuigiza. Inaweza kuwa kitu walichokiona shuleni, katika jumuiya yako, au kwenye mitandao ya kijamii. Kwa mfano, kuwa mwalimu na mwanafunzi katika shule yao.
3. Mwache kijana wako aamue ni nani anapaswa kucheza nafasi gani, na muigize kisa hicho pamoja.
4. Chukua muda wa kuzungumza juu ya ulichojifunza kupitia igizo dhima. Uliza maswali kama, "Ulijisikiaje ukiigiza jukumu hilo?" au, "Ulijifunza nini kuhusu hali hiyo?". Hii itamsaidia kijana wako kufikiria jinsi watu wengine wanavyofikiri na kuhisi.

SourceText:
* Take turns acting different roles. You can also swap roles to see how it changes the situation.
* Keep the activity fun. It doesn’t always have to be role play about something real. 
* Ask your teen to act as their favourite hero. Ask what they would do if they had super powers for a day.
text:
* Peaneni zamu ya kuigiza nafasi tofauti. Unaweza kubadilisha nafasi na kuangalia namna gani inaweza kubadilisha hali.
*Fanya zoezi lile la kufurahisha. Sio lazima iwe igizo kuhusu kitu halisi.
*Muambie kijana wako aigize kama shujaa. Waambie watafanya nini kama wangelikuwa na nguvu kwa siku.

SourceText: Find the pair
text: Tafuta jozi hiyo

SourceText:
Hide and seek is a fun game that many people played when they were children. 

In this version of the game, you add a challenging twist for your teen.
text:
Kombolela ni mchezo ambao watu wengi walicheza utotoni. Katika mchezo huu, tutaongeza mabadiliko ili kuifanya iwe na changamoto zaidi kwa kijana wako.

Katika mchezo huu, utaficha baadhi ya vifaa vya kila siku vya nyumbani Kisha kijana wako atalazimika kukumbuka vitu hivyo na kutafuta vinavyofanana navyo.

SourceText: Pairs of any small objects you can find around the house (for example spoons, cups, bowls, empty boxes, shoes) Make sure you have two of each object.
text: Jozi za vitu vidogo vidogo unavyoweza kupata kuzunguka nyumba (kwa mfano vijiko, vikombe, bakuli, masanduku tupu, viatu) Hakikisha una viwili kati ya kila kitu.

SourceText:
1. Hide one of each object around the room. Make sure they are not too difficult to find, but also not too easy.
2. Show your teen the objects they need to find.
3. Let your teen look for the objects. When they find one, they must run back to you, name the object, and put it next to the matching object.
4. Repeat the process until all pairs of objects have been found.
text:
1. Ficha moja ya kifaa ndani ya chumba. Hakikisha hakuna ugumu katika kuvitafuta, lakini pia sio rahisi sana.
2. Waonyeshe vijana wako vitu wanavotakiwa kuvitafuta.
3. Acha kijana wako atafute vitu. Baada ya kupata kimoja, anatakiwa kukimbia kurudi kwako, kutaja kifaa hicho na akiweke karibu na kifaa kinachofanana nacho.
4. Rudia mchakato huo mpaka jozi zote zimetimia.

SourceText:
* Try to make the game more challenging by making the objects harder to find. 
* You can time how long it takes your teen to find all the objects and ask them to try and beat their time. 
* Choose objects with different shapes, sizes, and colours.
text:
* Jaribu kufanya mchezo kuwa mgumu zaidi kwa kufanya vitu kuwa vigumu kupatikana.
* Unaweza pia kupima ni muda gani inachukuwa kijana wako kutafuta vitu vyote na waulize wajaribu kwenda na muda uliopangwa.
* Chagua vitu vyenye maumbo tofautitofauti, ukubwa, na rangi.

SourceText: Instead of a matching pair, show your teen an object that is “connected to” the object you hid in the room. For example, show your teen a sock, and they will search for something connected with that, like a shoe.
text: Badala ya kulinganisha jozi, muoneshe kijana wako kifaa ambacho kinahusiana na kingine ulichokificha. Kwa mfano, muoneshe kijana soksi, na watatafuta kitu kinachohusiana na soksi, kama kiatu.

SourceText: Mystery box
text: Sanduku la mafumbo

SourceText: Mystery Box is a fun game in which you place an object inside a box, and let your teen ask questions to figure out what the object is.
text: Boksi la ajabu ni mchezo wa kufurahisha ambapo unaweka kitu ndani ya boksi, na unamruhusu kijana wako aulize maswali ili kufahamu kitu hicho ni nini.

SourceText:
You can use anything as a ‘box’ (a bucket, sack, packet), as long as your teen can not see what is inside.

You also need something to hide inside the mystery box.
text:
Unaweza kutumia chochote kama ‘boksi’ (ndoo, gunia, pakiti), alimradi tu kijana wako hataona kilichoko ndani. 

Pia unahitaji kitu cha kukificha ndani ya boksi la maajabu.

SourceText:
1. Place any object inside the “Mystery Box”, without showing your teen.
2. Your teen now asks you questions to try and guess what it is. You can only answer with “Yes” or “No”.
3. When your teen is sure of the answer, they have to say, “I believe the mystery box is hiding …” and give their answer.
4. Swap roles with your teen and let them choose an object to hide in the box and you try to guess what it is.
text:
1. Weka kitu chochote ndani ya "boksi la maajabu", bila kumwonyesha kijana wako kile kitu ni nini.
2. Kijana wako sasa akuulize maswali ili kujaribu kukisia ni kitu gani. Unaweza tu kujibu kwa "Ndiyo" au "Hapana". 
3. Kama kijana wako ana uhakika wa jibu, wanapaswa kusema, "Ninaamini boksi la maajabu limeficha kitu flani.
4. Badili majukumu na kijana wako na uwaruhusu kuchagua kitu cha kuficha kwenye boksi na unajaribu kukisia ni nini kimefichwa.

SourceText:
* You can use different objects. You can also introduce themes, such as animals or fruits, to make the game more exciting. 
* You can allow your teen to choose the objects or themes. This makes them feel more involved and part of the game.
* Your teen can close their eyes and touch the mystery item to guess what it is.
text:
* Unaweza kutumia vitu tofauti. Unaweza pia kutambulisha mada, kama vile wanyama au matunda, ili kuufanya mchezo kuwa wa kusisimua zaidi.
* Unaweza kuruhusu vijana wako kuchagua vitu au maudhui, na kuwafanya kujisikia kushiriki zaidi na sehemu ya mchezo.
* Kijana wako anaweza kufunga macho yake na kugusa kitu cha fumbo ili kukisia ni nini.

SourceText: Memory game
text: Mchezo wa kumbukumbu

SourceText: Memory games are a fun way to help your teen focus more and learn how to remember information.
text: Michezo ya kumbukumbu ni njia ya kufurahisha ya kumsaidia kijana wako kua makini na kujifunza jinsi ya kukumbuka maelezo.

SourceText:
Ten small items, like a leaf, spoon, cup, seed, pencil, coin, stone, key.  It can be anything you find.

You also need a cloth or something else to cover the items.
text:
Vitu kumi vidogo, kama jani, kijiko, kikombe, mbegu, penseli, sarafu, jiwe, ufunguo. Inaweza kuwa chochote unachopata.

Pia unahitaji kitambaa au kitu kingine kufunika vitu.

SourceText:
1. Prepare a space where you can put the ten items.
2. Ask your teen to look at the items for 1 minute.
3. After 1 minute, cover the items with a cloth or some clothes.
4. Ask your teen to try and name all the items. They can write down what they remember.
5. Remove the covering and let the teen see if they remembered all the items.
6. Ask them how they remembered each one.
7. Now it is your turn. Let your teen be the master of the game – your teen chooses some items and tests your memory.
text:
1. Tayarisha nafasi ambapo unaweza kuweka vitu kumi.
2. Mwambie kijana wako aangalie vitu hivyo kwa dadika moja.
3. Baada ya dakika moja, funika vitu kwa kitambaa au baadhi ya nguo.
4. Mwambie kijana wako ajaribu kuvipa majina vitu vyote. Wanaweza kuandika kile wanachokumbuka.
5. Ondoa kifuniko na kuruhusu kijana aone ikiwa alikumbuka vitu vyote.
6. Waulize jinsi walivyomkumbuka kila kimoja wapo.
7. Sasa ni zamu yako. Mruhusu kijana wako awe bwana wa mchezo - kijana wako anachagua baadhi ya vitu na kujaribu kumbukumbu yako.

SourceText:
* You can time the activity to make it more exciting and competitive. 
* You can also ask your teen to come up with a story that involves all the items.
text:
* Unaweza kuweka muda wa shughuli ili kuifanya iwe ya kusisimua na yenye ushindani.
* Unaweza pia kumwomba kijana wako atoe hadithi inayohusisha vitu vyote.

SourceText: Cooking
text: Kupika

SourceText: Cooking together is a wonderful opportunity to talk and connect, while also teaching your teen life skills.
text: Kupika pamoja ni fursa nzuri ya kuzungumza na kuungana, huku pia ukimfundisha kijana wako stadi za maisha

SourceText:
1. Set a time and day that you and your teen are going to cook together. This will help both of you plan.
2. Teach them about what you are going to make together. Show them the ingredients and let them help measure how much you will be using today.
3. Give them a job to do, like fetching water, chopping, or stirring.
4. Enjoy the meal as a family and let your teen enjoy the pride of contributing to the family
text:
1. Weka muda na siku ambayo wewe na kijana wako mtapika pamoja. Hii itawasaidia wote wawili kupanga.
2. Wafundishe kuhusu kile mtakachotengeneza pamoja. Waonyeshe viungo na waruhusu wakusaidie kupima ni kiasi gani utatumia leo.
3. Wape kazi ya kufanya, kama kuchota maji, kukatakata, au kukoroga.
4. Furahia mlo kama familia na umruhusu kijana wako afurahie fahari ya kuchangia katika familia

SourceText:
* Involve them in the planning process by letting them choose the recipe or ingredients.
* Allow your teen to do as much as possible, including washing, measuring, cutting, and mixing.
* Encourage your teen to ask questions and to share what they are learning.
* Praise their efforts, even if the food does not turn out perfectly.
* Your teen will learn important life skills by cooking together: How to prepare food and plan well, appreciating the effort cooking takes, and how good it feels to contribute to family life.
* You might find that your teen has been wanting to help you cook but did not know how to ask.
text:
* Washirikishe katika mchakato wa kupanga kwa kuwaruhusu kuchagua mapishi au viungo.
* Mruhusu kijana wako afanye mengi iwezekanavyo, kutia ndani kuosha, kupima, kukata, na kuchanganya.
* Mtie moyo kijana wako aulize maswali na kushiriki kile anachojifunza.
* Sifa juhudi zao, hata ikiwa chakula hakitokei kikamilifu.
* Kijana wako atajifunza stadi muhimu za maisha kwa kupika pamoja: Jinsi ya kuandaa chakula na kupanga vizuri, kuthamini jitihada zinazofanywa kupika, na jinsi inavyopendeza kuchangia maisha ya familia.
* Huenda ukaona kwamba kijana wako amekuwa akitaka kukusaidia kupika lakini hajui jinsi ya kuuliza.

SourceText: Storytelling
text: Kusimulia hadithi

SourceText: Storytelling is a wonderful way to help your teen feel more connected with you, as well as with their family, history and culture.
text: Storytelling is a wonderful way to help your teen feel more connected with you, as well as with their family, history and culture.

SourceText:
1. Choose a time and place where you and your teen can talk comfortably. This could be after dinner, before bedtime, or during a walk outside.
2. Start by sharing your own story. It could be something that happened today, something you remember as a child or a memory that is special to you.
