3. After you finish your story, ask your teen if they have any questions. If they don’t have any, ask them to share their own story with you.  
4. Listen to your teen's story, ask questions, and show interest in what they have to say.
5. If your teen is struggling to come up with a story, ask something like "What is your favourite childhood memory?" or "What is a tradition in our family that you enjoy?". They can even make up a story.
text:
1. Chagua wakati na mahali ambapo wewe na kijana wako mnaweza kuketi na kuzungumza kwa raha. Hii inaweza kuwa baada ya chakula cha jioni, kabla ya kulala, au wakati wa matembezi nje.
2. Anza kwa kushirikisha hadithi yako mwenyewe. Inaweza kuwa kitu kilichotokea leo, kitu unachokumbuka ukiwa mtoto, au kumbukumbu ambayo ni maalum kwako.
3. Baada ya kumaliza hadithi yako, muulize kijana wako kama ana maswali yoyote. Ikiwa hawana, waambie wakushirikishe hadithi yao.
4. Sikiliza hadithi ya kijana wako, uliza maswali na uonyeshe kupendezwa na kile anachosema.
5. Ikiwa kijana wako anapata changamoto kupata hadithi, pendekeza vidokezo kama vile "Kumbukumbu uliyoipenda zaidi utotoni" au "Ni mila gani katika familia yetu ambayo unafurahia?".

SourceText:
* Create a safe space for your teen to share their stories. They will share more with you if they feel like you won’t be upset with them.
* Give your teen time to think and come up with their own story. This may not be easy for them to do.
text:
* Tengeneza nafasi salama kwa kijana wako kukushirikisha hadithi zao. Watakushirikisha zaidi ikiwa wanahisi kama hutakerwa nao.
* Mpe kijana wako muda wa kufikiria na kuja na hadithi zao wenyewe. Hili si rahisi kwao kufanya.

SourceText: Music and dance
text: Muziki na kucheza

SourceText: Dancing is a fun way to get exercise, and a great way to learn about your teen’s interests.
text: Kucheza mziki ni njia ya kufurahisha ya kufanya mazoezi, na njia nzuri ya kujifunza kuhusu mambo yanayomvutia kijana wako.

SourceText:
1. Ask your teen what music they like. Show real interest by asking more questions like where they heard it and what they like about it.
2. Teach each other your favourite dance moves or learn new ones together. 
3. Once you have learned some new dance moves, practise them together. Remember to have fun.
text:
1. Muulize kijana wako ni muziki gani anaopenda. Onyesha shauku ya kweli kwa kuuliza maswali zaidi kama mahali walipoisikia na kile wanachopenda kuihusu.
2. Fundishaneni mitindo ya miziki mnazozipenda au jifunzeni mpya pamoja.
3. Mara tu unapojifunza miondoko ya mziki mpya, ifanyieni mazoezi pamoja. Kumbuka kufurahia.

SourceText:
* Let your teen show you music and dance moves.
* Don't take it too seriously, be silly and have fun together.
text:
* Acha kijana wako akuonyeshe muziki na miondoko ya kucheza.
* Usichukulie kwa uzito sana, puuzia na mufurahie pamoja.

SourceText: Goal setting
text: Mpangilio wa malengo

SourceText:
Setting weekly goals together teaches your teen how to set achievable tasks and work towards their larger long-term goals. 

This is a great way to bond and to support their personal growth and success in education.
text:
Kuweka malengo ya kila wiki pamoja humfundisha kijana wako jinsi ya kuweka kazi zinazoweza kufikiwa na kufanyia kazi malengo yao makubwa ya muda mrefu. 

Hii ni njia nzuri ya kushikamana na kusaidia ukuaji wao wa kibinafsi na mafanikio katika elimu.

SourceText:
1. At the start of each week, sit down with your teen and ask them to choose one goal for that week. Make sure the goal is specific and can be done in one week. 
2. Share your own goal with your teen and try to support each other to reach your goals.
3. During the week, praise your teen for working on their goal. Celebrate their hard work.
4. If your teen does not reach their goal, use it as an opportunity to learn: Talk about why they did not reach it. What could they do better next time? Encourage them to re-plan their goal for next week.
5. Do this every week to start the habit of setting goals and completing them.
text:
1. Mwanzo wa kila wiki, keti chini na vijana wako na uwaombe kuchagua lengo moja la kutimiza wiki hiyo. Hakikisha ni lengo maalum, na linaweza kukamilishwa kwa wiki moja.
2. Wshirikishe vijana wako lengo lako na jaribu kusaidiana ili kutimiza malengo yenu.
3. Ndani ya wiki, msifu kijana wako kwa kufanyia kazi lengo lake. Sherehekea bidii yao.
4. Ikiwa kijana wako hatatimiza lengo lake, itumie kama fursa ya kujifunza: Zungumza kuhusu kwa nini hawakutiza lengo. Je, ni kipi wangeweza kufanya vizuri zaidi wakati ujao? Wahimize kupanga upya lengo lao la wiki ijayo.
5. Fanya hivi kila wiki ili kujenga tabia ya kuweka malengo na kuyakamilisha.

SourceText:
* Let your teen choose their own goal.
* Make sure the goal is small enough for them to do in one week. Teens are more likely to set more goals if they complete their last goal. 
* Praise your teen for trying! They will put more effort in if they see that you care about their goal.
text:
*Acha kijana wako achague malengo yake mwenyewe. 
*Hakikisha lengo laweza kufanyika ndani ya wiki moja. vijana wanauwezo wa kuweka malengo zaidi kama watakamilisha malengo lililopita.
*Msifu kijana wako kwa kujaribu! ataongeza juhudi zaidi ikiwa anaona unajali malengo yake.

SourceText: Realise my strength
text: Tambua nguvu zangu

SourceText: Helping your teen understand their strengths makes them feel confident in life and helps them take steps to grow in other areas as well.
text: Kumsaidia kijana wako aelewe uwezo wake inamfanya ajiamini maishani na inamsaidia kuchukua hatua za kukua katika maeneo mengine pia.

SourceText:
1. Talk about your teen’s strengths. Ask them:
   * Which 3 things are you good at? (These can be small things, such as being on time for school, washing the dishes, or something they do with their friends.)
   * What helped you to be good at these things? (Make sure to talk about hard work and practice.)
2. Talk about your teen’s areas of improvement. Ask them:
   * What would you love to be better at? 
   * What can you do to reach that goal, and how can I help you? (Break down the big goal into smaller achievable goals/steps.)
3. Write down these smaller goals and encourage your teen to tick them off as they accomplish them.
4. Celebrate each achievement and encourage your teen to keep working towards their bigger goal.
text:
1. Zungumza kuhusu uwezo wa kijana wako. Waulize:
   * Je, ni vitu gani 3 unavyovifaa? (Haya yanaweza kuwa mambo madogo, kama vile kufika kwa wakati shuleni, kuosha vyombo, au kitu wanachofanya na marafiki zao.)
   * Ni nini ilikusaidia kuwa muzuri katika mambo hayo? (Hakikisha unazungumza juu ya bidii na mazoezi.)
2. Zungumza kuhusu maeneo ya uboreshaji ya kijana wako. Waulize:
   * Je, ungependa kuwa bora zaidi katika nini?
   * Unaweza kufanya nini ili kufikia mradi huo, na ninaweza kukusaidia jinsi gani? (Gawanya lengo kubwa kuwa malengo/hatua ndogo zinazoweza kufikiwa.)
3. Andika malengo haya madogo na umtie moyo kijana wako ayaweke alama anapoyatimiza.
4. Sherehekea kila mafanikio na umtie moyo kijana wako aendelee kufanyia kazi lengo lake kubwa zaidi.

SourceText:
* Remember that teens will try more if they find things fun.
* Celebrate each step along the way and offer praise when your teen faces challenges.
text:
* Kumbuka kwamba vijana watajaribu zaidi ikiwa watapata mambo ya kufurahisha.
* Sherehekea kila hatua ukiendelea na umsifu kijana wako anapokabiliana na changamoto.

SourceText: Cleaning and organising
text: Kusafisha na kupangilia

SourceText: Every house needs some cleaning and organising sometimes. Working with your teen to do this provides an opportunity for bonding and teamwork.
text: Kila nyumba inahitaji kusafishwa na kupangwa wakati mwingine. Kufanya kazi na kijana wako kufanya hili inawapa fursa ya kuwa karibu na kufanya kazi ya pamoja.

SourceText:
1. Identify a specific area in your home that needs cleaning and organising, such as a room, cupboard, or area on the floor.
2. Talk to your teen about what needs to be done to clean the space (Like sorting items into groups, or dusting a surface).
3. Give specific tasks to each person and work together to complete them. 
4. As you clean and organise, take the opportunity to talk and connect with your teen. Ask them about their interests and share stories from your own life.
5. When you are finished, take a moment to appreciate what you did and praise your teen for their part.
text:
1. Anza kwa kutambua eneo maalum katika nyumba yako au sehemu ya jamii ambayo inahitaji kusafishwa na kupangiliwa, kama vile chumba, kabati au eneo kwenye sakafu.
2. Ongea na kijana wako kuhusu kile kinachohitajika kufanywa ili kusafisha eneo (kama vile kupanga vitu katika makundi, au kufuta vumbi).
3. Toa kazi maalum kwa kila mtu na kufanya kazi pamoja ili kuzikamilisha.
4. Unaposafisha na kupangilia, chukua fursa ya kuzungumza na kuwauliza nini wanapenda na wasimulie kuhusu maisha yako. 
5. Mnapomaliza, mshukuru kijana wako na msifie kwa kile alichofanya kwa mchango wao.

SourceText:
* Let your teen come up with an idea for what they think should be cleaned or organised.
* Take breaks and take your time. Remember to keep things fun. The goal is to spend time with your teen and teach them about being tidy and organised.
text:
* Acha kijana wako atoe wazo la kile anachofikiri kinafaa kusafishwa au kupangwa.
*Pumzika kwa muda. Kumbuka kufanya mambo ya kufurahisha. Lengo ni kutumia muda na kijana wako na kuwafundisha kuhusu kuwa nadhifu na kupangwa.

SourceText: Why do you think @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 reacted the way she did?
text: Unafikiri ni kwa nini @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 aliitikia jinsi alivyofanya?
note: The string @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: She was shocked that @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 had condoms.
text: Alishtuka kuwa @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 alikuwa na kondomu.

text: Alihisi kukosewa heshima na kukasirishwa na @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1.

SourceText: She was scared @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 was already having sex.
text: Aliogopa kuwa @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 alikuwa tayari anafanya ngono.

SourceText: She felt ashamed to talk about sex.
text: Aliona aibu kuzungumza juu ya ngono.

SourceText: When we are angry or scared, we can say or do things that hurt others and harm our relationships.
text: Tunapokuwa na hasira au hofu, tunaweza kusema au kufanya mambo ambayo yanaumiza wengine na kuharibu uhusiano wetu.

SourceText: How will this affect @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1’s relationship with @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1?
text: Je, hii itaathiri vipi uhusiano wa @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 na @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1?

SourceText: @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 may not trust @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 in the future.
text: @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 huenda asimwamini @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 katika siku zijazo.

SourceText:
Yes, all of these are true. After this argument, @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 is likely to look for information and advice from other places (also if something goes wrong with a relationship or in her life).

She may get into situations that are not healthy or safe, and may not want to talk to @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 about it even if she has questions or needs help. She may feel worried that @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 will judge her choices or feel ashamed of her.
text:
Ndiyo, haya yote ni kweli. Baada ya mabishano haya, @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 ana uwezekano wa kutafuta habari na ushauri kutoka sehemu zingine (na pia kama kitu kitaenda vibaya kwenye uhusiano au maishani mwake).

Anaweza kupata hali ambazo si za kiafya au salama, na huenda hataki kuzungumza na @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 kuhusu ilo jambo hata kama ana maswali au anahitaji usaidizi. Anaweza kuwa na wasiwasi kwamba @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 atahukumu chaguo zake au ataona aibu kwake.

SourceText: When we stay calm, share how we feel, and look for solutions together, it will help us all – even if we are not sure of the right outcome. You can learn to manage tricky situations and problems together with your teen.
text: Tunapokuwa watulivu, tukishirikisha watu jinsi tunavyohisi, na kutafuta suluhu pamoja, itatusaidia sisi sote - hata kama hatuna uhakika wa matokeo sahihi. Unaweza kujifunza kumudu hali na matatizo magumu kwa pamoja na kijana wako.

SourceText: Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships?
text: Nani anapaswa kuanzisha mazungumzo kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi?

SourceText: The teen’s friends
text: Marafiki wa kijana

SourceText: Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.
text: Kumbuka, marafiki wakati mwingine wanaweza kupotosha au kuwa na habari isiyo sahihi.

SourceText: The teen
text: Kijana

SourceText: Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.
text: Kijana wako anaweza kujisikia wasiwasi au hofu ya kuanzisha mazungumzo hayo na wewe.

SourceText: The parent
text: Mzazi

SourceText:
Yes, you will probably need to start the conversation. It is okay to feel uncomfortable. Be open and use the correct words ( for example: use words like breasts, penis and/or vagina). 

It can help to practise the conversation with a friend (maybe another friend with a teenager) or relative, and get more information from your community health worker or social worker. You can better guide your teen when you have the right information. 

It is okay to not know all the answers as well. If your teen asks you a question, you can always say: “I don’t know about that. Let me get some answers and come back to you about it.”
text:
Ndio, labda utahitaji kuanza mazungumzo. Ni sawa kujisikia wasiwasi. Kuwa wazi na kutumia maneno sahihi (kwa mfano: tumia maneno kama matiti, uume na / au uke). 

Inaweza kusaidia kufanya mazungumzo na rafiki (labda rafiki mwingine na kijana) au ndugu na kupata taarifa zaidi kutoka kwa wafanyakazi wa afya ya jamii au mfanyakazi wa kijamii. Unaweza kuongoza vizuri kijana wako wakati una habari sahihi. 

Ni sawa pia kutojua majibu yote. Kama kijana wako anauliza swali, unaweza daima kusema: "Sijui kuhusu hilo. Ngoja nipate majibu na nirudi kwako kuhusu jambo hili."

SourceText: When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
text: Ni wakati gani mzuri wa kuanza kuzungumza juu ya mabadiliko ya mwili na uhusiano wa kingono?

SourceText: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend
text: Ukigundua kuwa wana rafiki wa kiume au rafiki wa kike

SourceText:
It is important that your teen knows about body changes and intimate relationships before they reach that stage, so they are ready and can make good choices.

If you discover that your teen is having sex, try to share your feelings or worries in a calm way so you can find a way forward together. Anger towards your teen will make them less likely to open up with you about hard topics.
text:
Ni muhimu kwamba kijana wako kujua kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi kabla ya kufikia hatua hiyo, hivyo wanakuwa tayari kufanya maamuzi sahihi.

Ukigundua kuwa kijana wako anafanya ngono, jaribu kushiriki hisia zako au hofu yako kwa utulivu ili muweze kusonga mbele kwa pamoja. Hasira kwa kijana wako itawafanya wasiwe wazi kwako na kufunguka kuhusu mada ngumu.

SourceText: When they turn 10
text: Wakifikisha miaka 10

SourceText:
From the age of 10, children start to enter the puberty stage and need to already know about how their bodies and feelings may change. 

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Kuanzia umri wa miaka 10, watoto huanza kuingia katika hatua ya kubalehe na wanahitaji kujua tayari jinsi miili na hisia zao zinaweza kubadilika. 

Hii pia itawasaidia kukabiliana na hisia za kingono kwa usalama.

SourceText: Before they turn 10
text: Kabla hawajafikisha miaka 10

SourceText:
Discussions around body changes and intimate relationships can start early, before the age of 9, by responding to questions a child may have. 

You do not need to go into detail – just answer their questions in a simple and honest way that works for their age.
text:
Majadiliano kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kingono yanaweza kuanza mapema, kabla ya umri wa miaka 9, kwa kujibu maswali ambayo mtoto anaweza kuwa nayo.

Huna haja ya kuingia kwa undani - jibu tu maswali yao kwa njia rahisi na ya uaminifu ambayo inafanya kazi kwa umri wao.

SourceText: When you get an opportunity
text: Unapopata fursa

SourceText:
Parents never feel ‘ready’ to have these conversations with their teen. When your teen asks you a question or when you see a situation together that relates to body changes or relationships (for example in magazines or in your community), you can use that as an opening to start the conversation. You can ask “What do you think about what we saw?” or “How did that make you feel?”. 

You do not have to have all the answers, just use the opportunity when it comes up!
text:
Wazazi hawako 'tayari' kuwa na mazungumzo haya na vijana wao. wakati Kijana wako anapokuuliza swali au unapoona hali inayohusiana na mabadiliko ya mwili au mahusiano (kwa mfano katika magazeti au katika jumuiya yako), unaweza kutumia hilo kama mwanya wa kuanzisha mazungumzo. Unaweza kuuliza "Unafikiria nini kuhusu tulichoona?" au "Hilo lilikufanya uhisije?".

Sio lazima uwe na majibu yote, tumia tu fursa hiyo inapokuja!

SourceText: How can I best keep my teen safe?
text: Ninawezaje kumuweka kijana wangu kuwa salama?

SourceText: I determine what my teen can and cannot do
text: Ninaamua kile ambacho kijana wangu anaweza na hawezi kufanya

SourceText:
When we are too controlling, our teens may end up doing the things we do not want them to do. 

When we give our teens space to make their own decisions and guide them, they generally behave more responsibly.
text:
Tunapodhibiti sana, vijana wetu wanaweza kuishia kufanya mambo ambayo hatupendi wayafanye.

Tunapowapa vijana wetu nafasi ya kufanya maamuzi yao wenyewe na kuwaongoza, kwa ujumla huwajibika zaidi.

SourceText: I keep information or bad influences away from them
text: Ninaweka taarifa au ushawishi mbaya mbali nao

SourceText:
Teens get information and pressure from many different sources that we cannot control. 

It is our role as parents to prepare them and guide them well, so they can  learn how to tell the difference between good and bad information, and be confident to make their own decisions.
text:
Vijana hupata taarifa na msukumo kutoka vyanzo mbalimbali ambavyo hatuwezi kuzuia.

Ni jukumu letu kama wazazi kuwaandaa na kuwaongoza vizuri, ili wajifunze jinsi ya kutofautisha taarifa nzuri na mbaya, na wakawa na ujasiri wa kufanya maamuzi yao binfasi.

SourceText: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen
text: Ninatengeneza uhusiano mzuri wa kuaminika na wenye afya pamoja na kijana wangu

SourceText:
Your teen will trust you, when they feel you trust them. They are more likely to ask for advice or share when they have a problem if they are used to talking to you.

Praise and thank your teen whenever they share, and avoid judging their questions or behaviour so they feel safe to come to you again and again.
text:
Vijana wako watakuamini, endapo wakihisi  unawaamini. Itakuwa vyema kukuomba ushauri au kukushirikisha matatizo yao ikiwa wamezoea kuongea nawe.

Msifie na mshukuru kijana wako kila wanapokushirikisha, na zuia kuhukumu maswali yao au tabia ili wajisikie salama kuja kwako mara kwa mara.

SourceText: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen
text: Ninajadili madhara na suluhisho pamoja na kijana wangu

SourceText:
To make a good decision, we have to think through the consequences. When you have a problem, have an open discussion with your teen. Listen to each other’s opinions and discuss solutions together.

Every challenge is an opportunity to help your teen understand that each action has consequences and you can work together to find a solution.

When you work through a tricky situation or conversation together, remember to praise and recognise yourselves for your great teamwork.
text:
Kufanya maamuzi mazuri, tunapaswa kufikiri juu ya matokeo yake. Tukiwa na tatizo, tunafanya mjadala pamoja na kijana sikiliza mawazo ya kila mmoja na kutafuta suluhisho pamoja.

Kila changamoto ni fursa ya kumsaidia kijana wako aelewe kwamba kila kitendo kina matokeo na mnaweza mkafanya kazi kwa pamoja kutafuta suluhisho.

Unapofanya kazi katika hali ngumu au mazungumzo pamoja, kumbuka kusifia na kujitambua kwa kazi nzuri ya pamoja.

SourceText: I emphasise that pressure is never okay
text: Ninasisitiza kwamba kushinikiza sio sawa

SourceText:
To stay safe, your teen needs to understand the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones. 

A respectful relationship is when we feel cared for, involved in decision making, happy and safe. An unhealthy relationship is when we feel pressured to do something, uncomfortable with decisions or actions, or unsafe in any other way. 

In any relationship or sexual activity, you should never be pushed or convinced to do something you do not feel comfortable with, and you should never force others either. You can learn more about this in the @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title.
text:
Ili kukaa salama, kijana wako anahitaji kuelewa tofauti kati ya tabia ya heshima na mahusiano na yale yasiyofaa.

Mahusiano ya heshima ni wakati tunapohisi kuthaminiwa, kushirikishwa katika kufanya maamuzi, furaha na usalama. Mahusiano yasiyofaa ni wakati tunapohisi kulazimishwa kufanya jambo fulani, kutoridhika na maamuzi au vitendo, au kutokuwa salama kwa njia nyingine yoyote.

Katika uhusiano wowote au shughuli za kingono, hupaswi kamwe kusukumwa au kushawishiwa kufanya kitu ambacho hujisikii vizuri nacho, na pia hupaswi kuwalazimisha wengine pia. Unaweza kujifunza zaidi kuhusu hili katika @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_svp.in_text_title. should not be translated.

SourceText: How can I help prevent  my teen from having sex too young?
text: Ninawezaje kusaidia kuzuia kijana wangu kufanya ngono akiwa bado mdogo?

SourceText: Keep any information about sex away from them
text: Weka taaarifa za ngono mbali nao

SourceText:
Teenagers get right and wrong information about sex from many different sources at an early age, including school, their friends, and social media.

Knowing about sex does not mean they are having sex themselves already. Having good information can help teenagers understand sex, be clear about safe and unsafe interactions with others, and why they may want to choose to wait to have sex.

Not knowing about sex can lead to problems, for example when teens do not understand how pregnancy happens or what risks sex can have.
text:
Vijana hupata taarifa sahihi na zisizo sahihi kuhusu ngono kutoka vyanzo mbalimbali katika umri mdogo, ikiwa ni pamoja na shuleni, marafiki zao, na katika mitandao ya kijamii.

Kujua kuhusu ngono haimaanishi kuwa wanafanya ngono wenyewe tayari. Kuwa na taharifa sahihi kunaweza kuwasaidia vijana kuelewa ngono, kuwa wazi kuhusu mwingiliano salama na usio salama na wengine, na kwa nini wanaweza kutaka kuchagua kusubiri kufanya ngono.

Kutojua kuhusu ngono kunaweza kusababisha matatizo, kwa mfano wakati vijana hawaelewi jinsi mimba inavyotokea au ni athari gani zinatokana na ngono.

SourceText: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend
text: Kuwakataza kua na rafiki wa kike au kiume

SourceText:
Your teen may have a boyfriend or girlfriend without telling you. 

If you push them to hide their relationships, they may not  come to you when they have questions or problems (about their partner or other things), and they may end up in dangerous situations without you knowing.
text:
Kijana wako anaweza kuwa na mpenzi wa kiume au wa kike bila kukuambia. 

Kama ukiwafanya wafiche mahusiano yao, wanaweza wasije kwako wanapokuwa na maswali au matatizo (kuhusu mwenza wao au mambo mengine), na wanaweza kuishia katika hali hatarishi bila wewe kujua.

SourceText: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait
text: Kuwa na majadiliano ya wazi juu ya namna na sababu za wao kusubiri

SourceText:
Teens are finding their way in life. They are looking around them – to friends and media – to figure out who they are now and what they want for their future. Because of this, other people may push them to do things they are not ready for.

Try to discuss and explore together how they could wait to have sex until they are ready and in a safe relationship, and can better understand and handle any consequences. Be calm and focus on guiding them to make healthy decisions, even if they are not the decisions you would choose to make.
text:
Vijana wanatafuta njia yao katika maisha. Wanaangalia mazingira yao - marafiki na vyombo vya habari - kujua wao ni nani sasa na wanataka nini kwa ajili ya maisha yao ya baadaye. Kwa sababu hii, watu wengine wanaweza kusababisha wafanye mambo ambayo hawako tayari kufanya.

Jaribu kujadili na kuchunguza pamoja nao wanaweza kusubiri kufanya ngono mpaka wawe tayari na katika uhusiano salama, na wanaweza kuelewa vizuri na kushughulikia madhara yoyote. Kuwa mtulivu na uzingatie kuwaongoza kufanya maamuzi yenye afya, hata kama sio maamuzi ambayo ungechagua kufanya.

SourceText: Check out the other options too.

SourceText: When we lose someone we love, it helps to recognise and share our feelings as a family.
text: Pale tunapompoteza mtu tunayempenda, inasaidia kutambua na kushirikishana hisia zetu kama familia.

text: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 huenda asimwamini @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1

SourceText: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 and @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1 might talk less and feel more alone.
text: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 na @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1 wanaweza kuzungumza kidogo na kuhisi upweke zaidi

SourceText: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 might show more challenging behaviour.
text: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 anaweza kuonyesha zaidi tabia yenye changamoto
note: The string @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each other’s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.
text: Kila mtu hukabiliana na huzuni kwa njia tofauti. Tunaweza kusaidiana kwa kukubali hisia za kila mmoja wetu na kuja na mawazo kwa pamoja ili kusaidiana

text: Kwa nini @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 alijibu hivi?

text: Ndiyo, haya yote ni kweli. @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 alijibu hivi kwa sababu mama yake hakuzungumza naye kuhusu siku yake, alimlaumu kwa kutokupika na hakumshukuru @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 kwa kusaidia kazi za nyumbani.

SourceText: How will this affect the relationship between @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 and @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1?
text: Hii itaathiri vipi uhusiano kati ya @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 na @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1?

SourceText: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 will not want to help with house chores, as her mother did not appreciate it.
text: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 hatataka kusaidia kazi za nyumbani, kwa kuwa mama yake hakuthamini mchango wake.

text: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 hataweza kuongea na mama yake kuhusu matatizo yake kwa sababu hakupewa nafasi ya kuzungumza.
note: The string @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 will treat her siblings the same way that her mother treats her.
text: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 atawatendea ndugu zake kama vile mama yake anavyomtendea
note: The string @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: These are all true. @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 will not want to help around the house or speak to her mother about her problems because her mother does not thank her or listen to her. @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 will also treat her siblings the same way because that is what she has learnt from her mother.

note: The string @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText:
Yes, taking a moment to talk while doing house chores helped them both!

By taking time for yourself, asking your teen to do a house chore or activity with you, and giving them space to talk to you, you are creating a safe space for them to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a healthy relationship with your teen. This will help them learn important things they do not learn at school.
text:
Ndiyo, kuchukua muda wa kuzungumza wakati mkifanya kazi za nyumbani kuliwasaidia wote wawili!

Kwa kuchukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe, Muombe kijana wako kufanya kazi ya nyumbani au shughuli nawe, na kuwapa nafasi ya kuzungumza nawe, unatengeneza mazingira salama kwa  wao kujifunza pamoja.

Hii ni njia rahisi ya kujenga uhusiano mzuri na kijana wako. Hii itawasaidia kujifunza mambo muhimu ambayo hawajifunzi shuleni.

SourceText:
Yes, these are clear warning signs! Your partner (or anyone else) should never try to push or convince you to do something you do not want to do or feel unsure about. Even if you do something once, this does not mean you have to do it again – you are allowed to change your mind at any time, even during an intimate moment.

A partner who really loves and respects you will ask if you are okay, listen to you, and stop if you want to. They would never push you into something you do not want to do.
text:
Ndiyo, hizi ni ishara za wazi na maonyo! Mpenzi wako (au mtu mwingine yeyote) kamwe asijaribu kukulazimisha au kukushawishi kufanya kitu ambacho hutaki kufanya au kuhisi kutokuwa na uhakika. Hata kama unafanya kitu mara moja, hii haimaanishi lazima ufanye tena - unaruhusiwa kubadilisha akili yako wakati wowote, hata wakati wa mapenzi. 

Mpenzi ambaye anakupenda na kukuheshimu atakuuliza ikiwa uko sawa, atakusikiliza, na kukuacha kama utaki. Hawatakusukuma kamwe kwenye kitu ambacho hutaki kufanya.

If @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1 stays silent, his friend will likely keep doing this. @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1 can help his friend see that his behaviour makes girls feel scared, angry, or sad, and is not okay.

text:
Ndio, hizi zote ni alama za onyo! "Hapana" yako inabidi iheshimiwe.

Kumbuka pia, kama watu nyumbani au mtaani wanatumia kilevi na madawa ya kulevya hii ni alama ya onyo, maana hizo zinamfanya mtu awe na hasira, mwenye fujo na vurugu.

SourceText: Reflect on the positive
text: Tafakari mambo chanya

SourceText:
At the end of the day, take a minute to: 

* Talk to your teen about one fun thing they did. 
* Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
* You are a star!
text:
Mwisho wa siku, pata dakika chache:

* Kuongea na kijana wako kuhusu kitu cha kufurahisha alichofanya
* Jipongeze kwa kitu kimoja ulichofanya vizuri leo.
* Wewe ni mshindi!

SourceText: Check-in chat
text: Simulizi ya kuanzia

SourceText:
* Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
* Ask each other, “What difficulty did you face today?”
* Ask each other, “How can I help you?”
* Try to do this together every day; it could be when you are eating dinner together or before you go to bed.
text:
* Ulizaneni, “Kitu gani kilikufurahisha leo?”
* Ulizaneni, “Ulikabiliana na shida gani leo?”
* Ulizaneni, “Ninaweza kukusaidiaje?”
* Jaribuni kufanya hivyo pamoja kila siku; inaweza kuwa wakati mnapokula pamoja chakula cha usiku au kabla ya kwenda kulala.

SourceText: Dream travel
text: Safari ya ndoto

SourceText:
* You can’t always travel, but you can always dream! Ask your teen these questions:
* Where would you want to travel to? How long would you be away? What would you pack? What would you do on your trip? What would you see?
* Look at a map together or draw one.
* Choose a country that your teen has never heard of and learn more about the country.
text:
* Huwezi kusafiri kila wakati, lakini unaweza kuota kila wakati! Muulize kijana wako maswali haya:
* Je, ungependa kusafiri kwenda wapi? Utakaa huko kwa muda gani? Utafungasha nini? Utafanya nini kwenye safari yako? Utaona nini?
* Angalieni ramani pamoja au choreni ramani.
* Chagua nchi ambayo kijana wako hajawahi kuisikia halafu mjifunze zaidi kuhusu nchi hiyo.

SourceText: Famous party
text: Chama maarufu

SourceText: You and your teenager can plan a guestlist of the famous people you’d most like to invite to your party. You can each have five people – they can be from the past or from the present time. Who would you invite? And would your guests get on well together?
text: Wewe na kijana wako mnaweza kutengeneza orodha ya wageni maarufu ambao mngependa kuwaalika kwenye sherehe yenu. Kila mmoja anaweza kuwa na watu watano – wanaweza kuwa watu wa zamani au wa sasa. Je, ungemwalika nani? Na, je, wageni wako wataweza kukaa pamoja vizuri?

SourceText: Two truths, one lie
text: Kweli mbili, uongo mmoja

SourceText:
* Think of three statements about yourself. Two must be true and one must be a lie.
* It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example: I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing. 
* Say them to your teenager and ask them to guess which one is a lie. 
* Did they guess correctly? Was it a surprise?
* Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text:
* Fikiria kauli tatu kuhusu wewe. Mbili ni lazima ziwe za kweli na moja ni lazima iwe ya uongo.
* Inaweza kusaidia kufikiria mambo ambayo ungetamani kuyapata, ndoto zako, mambo yalliyokutokea shuleni, mambo unayopenda au usiyopenda. Kwa mfano: Sipendi ndizi, somo ninalolipenda zaidi ni sayansi, na ninatamani sana ningejua kuimba.
* Ziseme kwa kijana wako na mwambie akisie kauli ipi ni ya uongo.
* Je, amekisia kwa usahihi? Je, alikushangaza?
* Sasa mwambie na yeye afanye hivyohivyo. Je, mmejifunza jambo jipya kuhusu kila mmoja wenu?

SourceText: Time machine
text: Mashine ya wakati

SourceText: Tell your teenager something about when you were a teenager yourself. What things didn’t exist then? Phones with internet? What did you do for fun? What did you worry about? Don’t worry if they don’t tell you something in return – what’s important is that they listen and remember. Sometimes our teenagers forget that their parents are people too!
text: Mwambie kijana wako jambo fulani kuhusu wewe mwenyewe ulipokuwa kijana. Je, ni vitu gani havikuwepo wakati huo? Simu zenye intaneti? Ulifanya mambo gani ili kujifurahisha? Mambo gani yalikupa wasiwasi? Usijali kama yeye hatakuambia chochote – cha muhimu ni kwamba anasikiliza na kukumbuka. Wakati mwingine vijana wetu wanasahau kuwa wazazi wao ni watu pia!

SourceText: Superpowers
text: Nguvu kubwa

SourceText:
* Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds. 
* Ask your teen, “If you had the superpower to […], how would you use it?”
* Encourage them to give their superhero a name and act it out. 
* Now let your teen choose a superpower for you.
* Make sure you act out your superpower, too!
text:
* Fikiria kuhusu nguvu kuu. Kwa mfano, kwenda popote papo hapo, kusoma akili za wengine, kusafiri wakati mwingine.
* Muulize kijana wako, “Kama ungekuwa na nguvu ya ajabu […], ungeitumiaje?”
* Mhimize kumpa shujaa wake jina na kumuigiza.
* Sasa mwache kijana wako akuchagulie nguvu ya ajabu.
* Hakikisha unaigiza pia namna ya kuitumia hiyo nguvu yako ya ajabu!

SourceText: Just a friendly chat
text: Maongezi ya kirafiki

SourceText:
Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.

It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…

Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text:
Zungumza na kijana wako kuhusu jambo analopenda.

Linaweza kuhusu kitu chochote atakachochagua kuzungumzia: michezo, marafiki, muziki, watu mashuhuri...

Jaribu kumsikiliza kijana wako na mpe nafasi ya kuzungumza.

SourceText: The interrupter
text: Mdakizi

SourceText:
* Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
* Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
* The storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
* When the story is finished, try with a different storyteller!
text:
* Chagueni msimuliaji ili aanze kubuni hadithi.
* Wasikilizaji wa simulizi hiyo wanaweza kumkatiza na kusema neno fulani wakati wowote.
* Msimuliaji anatakiwa kuingiza neno hilo kwenye hadithi yake.
* Hadithi inapoisha, jaribuni kumpa nafasi msimuliaji mwingine!

SourceText: Three options
text: Machaguo matatu

SourceText:
* Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane.
* Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
* Ask them why?
* Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text:
* Fikiria kuhusu hali tatu tofauti. Kwa mfano, kuendesha gari, kusafiri kwa boti au kurusha ndege.
* Mwambie kijana wako na muulize, "Kipi ungependa?'
* Muulize kwa nini?
* Sasa fikiria kuhusu hali tatu zaidi au muombe kijana wako afanye kwa ajili yako.

SourceText: Yes, no or maybe
text: Ndiyo, hapana au labda

SourceText:
* Ask each other questions. They can be any questions about things you like or what you did today.
* The only rule is that you can’t answer “yes”, “no” or “maybe”.
* How long can you last? How creative can you get with your answers?
* Swap over and play again!
text:
* Ulizaneni maswali. Yanaweza kuwa maswali yoyote kuhusu mambo mnayopenda au kile mlichofanya leo.
* Sheria pekee ya mchezo huu ni kwamba huwezi kujibu "ndiyo", "hapana" au "labda".
* Je, unaweza kuendelea kufanya hivyo kwa muda gani? Je, majibu yako yanaweza kuwa na ubunifu kiasi gani?
* Badilishaneni zamu za kuuliza na kujibu na mcheze tena!

SourceText: Memory game – "On Saturday..."
text: Mchezo wa kumbukumbu - "Siku ya Jumamosi..."

SourceText:
* First person says, “On Saturday, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”.
* Second person adds to first person, “On Saturday, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend).
* Each person adds to the previous, trying to think of all of the fun things to do on Saturday.
text:
* Mtu wa kwanza anasema, “Siku ya Jumamosi, nitaenda... (k.m., kwenda kwenye bustani)”.
* Mtu wa pili anaongeza kwa mtu wa kwanza, “Siku ya Jumamosi, nitaenda kwenye bustani na... (k.m., tembelea rafiki yangu wa karibu).
* Kila mtu anaongeza ya awali, akijaribu kufikiria mambo yote ya kufurahisha ya kufanya Jumamosi.

SourceText: Make up a story
text: Buni Hadithi

SourceText:
* Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
* Let your teen make up the next sentence.
* Then you make up a sentence.
* Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
* Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
* Ask your teen what their favourite part of the story was!
text:
* Anza hadithi kw kusema "Hapo zamani za kale kulikuwa na..."
* Muache kijana wako atengeneze sentensi inayofuata.
* Kisha unatunga sentensi.
* Fanyeni kwa zamu mpaka mpate hadithi nzuri mpya.
* Hakikisha mnamaliza hadithi kwa kitu chanya.
* Muulize kijana wako ni sehemu gani ya hadithi aliyoipenda zaidi!

SourceText: Co-chef
text: Mpishi mwenza

SourceText:
* Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat. 
* Prepare it together!    
* Let them have a turn at being the head chef – they lead, and you follow their instructions. 
* You can even help them to make a budget for the ingredients! 

Don’t think it will work? Ask your teens what THEY would like for you and them to do together. Let them lead. Relax. Have fun.
text:
* Muulize kijana wako chakula gani angependa kula.
* Kiandaeni pamoja!
* Mwache ashike zamu ya kuwa mpishi mkuu - aongoze na ufuate maelekezo yake.
* Unaweza hata ukamsaidia kutengeneza bajeti ya mahitaji!

Unadhani itafanikiwa? Waulize vijana wako nini WANGEPENDA wewe na wao mfanye pamoja.
Waache waongoze. Tulia. Furahia.

SourceText: Dance moves
text: Miondoko ya kucheza

SourceText:
* Create a set of dance moves to your teen's favourite songs. 
* One person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.  
* Everyone takes turns being the leader. 
* Perform it for the household!
text:
* Buni miondoko ya kucheza miziki inayopendwa na kijana wako.
* Mtu mmoja anacheza mwondoko fulani halafu wengine wote wanafuatisha.
* Kila mtu anapewa zamu ya kuongoza.
* Chezeni mbele ya familia!

SourceText: Mirror
text: Kioo

SourceText:
* This game can be played in pairs or with many people in a group.
* Stand facing each other or in a circle. 
* One person leads first and everyone else copies them, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
* Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone else to follow! Explore moving different body parts. Move them up in the air or close to the ground.
* After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
* Try it with no leaders!
text:
* Mchezo huu unaweza kuchezwa na watu wawili wawili au na watu wengi wakiwa kwenye kikundi.
* Simameni mkitazamana au kwa mduara.
* Mtu mmoja aongoze kwanza halafu wengine wamfuatishe, wakijaribu kucheza kwa wakati mmoja kama kiongozi wao anavyocheza.
* Hakikisheni kiongozi anacheza polepole vya kutosha ili kila mtu aweze kumfuatisha! Jaribuni kuchezesha viungo tofauti vya mwili. Vichezeshe juu na chini.
* Baada ya muda, mtu mwingine awe kiongozi. Kila mtu apewe nafasi ya kuongoza.
* Jaribuni kucheza bila kiongozi!

SourceText: What's new?
text: Kuna nini kipya?

SourceText:
* Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or on your foot, juggling, making soup?
* Take turns in trying the new skill out.
* Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text:
* Fikiria ujuzi mpya unaoweza kujifunza pamoja na kijana wako. Kwa mfano, kuchezea mpira hewani au kwa mguu wako bila kuudondosha, kupiga chenga, kupika supu?
* Peaneni zamu za kujaribu ujuzi mpya.
* Hakikisheni mnasifiana, na jaribuni kujifunza na kucheza pamoja!

SourceText: Get active!
text: Changamka!

SourceText:
* Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing.
* Pick one together and try it out. 
* If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
* Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text:
* Fikirieni pamoja aina tatu za mazoezi. Kwa mfano, kutembea, kukimbia polepole, kucheza muziki au mpira wa miguu.
* Chagueni zoezi moja halafu mlijaribu.
* Kama nyote wawili mnalipenda, amueni mtakuwa mnalifanya mara ngapi. Mara moja au mbili kwa wiki? Kila asubuhi?
* Fikirieni pamoja njia za kulifanya liwe la kufurahisha zaidi. Je, mnaweza kukimbia polepole hadi kituo fulani? Je, mpeane zamu za kuwa kocha? Je, mpeane motisha kwa zawadi ndogo ya bure?

SourceText: Name that tune
text: Taja jina la wimbo huo

SourceText:
* The first person gets to choose or sing a song.
* Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder they can guess the singer).
* The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader.
text:
* Mtu wa kwanza anachagua au anaimba wimbo.
* Watu wengine wote wanatakiwa kutaja jina la wimbo huo (ili kufanya zoezi liwe ngumu zaidi, wanaweza pia kutaja jina la mwimbaji).
* Mtu wa kwanza kutaja kwa usahihi ndiye atakayefuatia kuwaongoza wengine.

SourceText: Pass the snap
text: Pitisha kitufe

SourceText:
This game is best with at least 3 people.
* Start in a circle and pass one “snap” around the circle (or a “clap” if you cannot snap).
* You “snap” once to throw the “snap”, and once to catch it. Look at the person you are throwing it to.  
* The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.  
* You can bounce the “snap”, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.  
* When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing the “snap”.  
* Can you throw under the leg? Behind the back? Through your head? Intercept a pass? Have fun with the “snap”!
text:
Mchezo huu ni mzuri mkiwa angalau watu watatu.
* Anza katika mduara na mrushie  mwingine kitufe kwenye mduara (au "mpigie kofi" kama huwezi kumkonyeza).
* Unamrushia mara moja na yeye kudaka mara moja. Mwangalie mtu unayemrushia.
* Namna mtu mwingine atadaka itategemea na uelekeo (juu, chini, moja kwa moja, upande, kudunda juu ya ardhi) na nguvu uliyotumia kurusha.
* Unaweza ukadunda kitufe, kukirusha hewani, na kukimata mda mfupi kabla hujakirusha kwa mwingine.
* Kila mmoja akielewa vizuri, mnaweza kuanza kutembea chumbani, mkiendelea kurushiana kitufe.
*Je unaweza kukirusha chini ya mguu? Nyuma ya mgongo? Kupitia kichwani kwako? Kukatisha pasi? Furahia kitufe!

SourceText: Family workout
text: Mazoezi ya familia

SourceText:
Choose a sport or exercise to do together. Decide on a schedule. Are you going to do it every day? For how long? 

Try it out for a week. At the end of the week, ask yourself and your family these questions:
* How is it going? 
* How did you feel at the start of the week? 
* How do you feel at the end of the week? 
* What can we do differently next week?
text:
Chagueni mchezo au mazoezi ya kufanya pamoja. Amueni ratiba itakavyokuwa. Je, mtafanya kila siku? Kwa muda gani?

Jaribuni kwa wiki moja. Mwishoni mwa wiki, wewe na familia yako jiulizeni maswali haya:
* Je, mchezo unaendeleaje?
* Je, mlijisikiaje mwanzoni mwa wiki?
* Je, mnajisikiaje mwishoni mwa wiki?
* Je, jambo gani tunaweza kulifanya kwa njia tofauti wiki ijayo?

SourceText: Make housework fun
text: Fanya kazi za nyumbani zifurahishe

SourceText: Household chores aren’t fun… or are they? You can make them into a game!
text: Je, kazi za nyumbani hazifurahishi... au zinafurahisha? Unaweza kuzifanya kuwa mchezo!

SourceText:
Take turns being the “leader”. Say the intro sentences to get everybody started. Then the “leader” gives an instruction and everyone does the activity as fast as possible:
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Touch something red.” 
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Jump up and down ten times.”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Put the shoes in the shoe rack.”
text:
Peaneni zamu za kuwa "kiongozi". Sema sentensi za utangulizi ili kumchangamsha kila mtu. Kisha "kiongozi" atatoa maelekezo halafu kila mtu afanya shughuli haraka iwezekanavyo:
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Gusa kitu chekundu."
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Ruka juu na chini mara kumi."
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Kuna moto mlimani!"
* Wote: "Kimbia, kimbia, kimbia!"
* Kiongozi: "Weka viatu kwenye kabati ya viatu."

SourceText: What are you doing?
text: Unafanya nini?

SourceText: Here is a fun game you can do with your family!
text: Huu hapa ni mchezo wa kufurahisha unaoweza kuucheza na familia yako!

SourceText:
This game is best when more than 2 people play.
* One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner. 
* Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
* The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”  
* The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?” 

The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text:
Mchezo huu unafaa kuchezwa na watu wawili au zaidi.
* Mtu mmoja anajifanya kuwa anafanya jambo fulani – kwa mfano, kuchana nywele au kupika chakula cha usiku.
* Mtu mwingine anauliza, “Unafanya nini?”
* Mtu wa kwanza anatakiwa kusema jambo lisilohusiana na kuchana nywele, kwa mfano, “Ninafunga viatu vyangu.”
* Kisha mtu wa pili anaanza kujifanya kuwa anafunga viatu vyake mpaka mtu mpya atakapouliza, “Unafanya nini?”

Kila mara, ni lazima jibu liwe tofauti na kile unachokifanya kweli!

SourceText: Crazy chicken
text: Kuku kichaa

SourceText:
* Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
* Do it as fast and loud as you can.
* Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with both feet.
* Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
* Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text:
* Tingisheni mikono yenu ya kushoto hewani mara 8 huku mkihesabu hadi 8.
* Fanyeni hivyo kwa haraka sana na kwa sauti kubwa kadri muwezavyo.
* Rudieni kufanya hivyo kwa mkono mwingine. Rudieni kufanya hivyo kwa miguu yote miwili.
* Fanyeni mara 7, kisha mara 6 na kuendelea hadi mara 1.
* Kila mtu aite kwa sauti "Kuku kichaa" kisha acheze kama kuku kichaa kadri awezavyo!

SourceText: Notice the good
text: Tambua yaliyo mazuri

SourceText:
Praise really is powerful. 

Let’s look at the example of @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name and her daughters:
text:
Kusifia kuna nguvu sana.

Hebu tuangalie mfano wa @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name na mabinti zake:
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: When @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name is busy, her two daughters often fight. But today, her older daughter actually helped her sister with her schoolwork!
text: Pindi @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name anapotingwa na shughuli, mara nyingi mabinti zake wawili hupigana. Lakini leo, binti yake mkubwa alimsaidia mdogo wake kufanya kazi yake ya shule!
note: The string @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Thank you for doing your schoolwork, @global.w_praise_girl, and thank you for helping your sister,  @global.w_praise_teen_girl. I'm so proud of you!"
text: @global.w_praise_female_caregiver_name: "Hongera kwa kufanya kazi yako ya shule, @global.w_praise_girl, na hongera kwa kumsaidia mdogo wako, @global.w_praise_teen_girl. Ninajivunia sana wewe!"

SourceText: Negative instructions
text: Maelekezo hasi

SourceText: Let’s see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver tells @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "DON'T":
text: Hebu tuone ni nini kitatokea kama @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver atamwambia @global.w_instruct_teen_girl "USIFANYE HIKI":

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was cleaning the house while @global.w_instruct_teen_girl was practising dance moves with her friend.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t make such a mess while I am cleaning the house. You are in the way!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alikuwa anasafisha nyumba wakati @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alikuwa anafanya mazoezi ya kucheza muziki na rafiki yake. 

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Usivuruge/usichafue wakati ninasafisha nyumba. Unaniingilia!"

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “But I need to practise for the school competition. You never let me do anything.”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “Don’t you talk back to me!”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: "Lakini ninahitaji kufanya mazoezi kwa ajili ya mashindano ya shule. Hujawahi kuniruhusu kufanya kitu chochote." 

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Usinijibu!"

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Arrg!! Why am I being yelled at all the time????”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver to herself: “That child is always making trouble.”
text:
@global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Aah!! Kwanini huwa unanifokea kila wakati????”

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver (akijisemea): "Huyu mtoto analeta shida kila wakati."

SourceText: Positive instructions
text: Maelekezo chanya

SourceText:
Thank you for thinking along! 

Let’s go back in time and see what happens if @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver gives a positive instruction:
text:
Asanteni kwa kufikiria pamoja!

Hebu turudi nyuma tuone kinachoweza kutokea kama @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver atatoa maelekezo chanya:
note: The string @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver was cleaning the house while @global.w_instruct_teen_girl was practising dance moves with her friend.  

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “@global.w_instruct_teen_girl, it is nice to see you practise dance moves with your friend. Please take it outside so I can finish cleaning the house. Afterwards, you can show me your dance."
text:
@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver alikuwa anasafisha nyumba wakati @global.w_instruct_teen_girl alikuwa akifanya mazoezi ya kucheza na rafiki yake.

@global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: “@global.w_instruct_teen_girl, ni vizuri kukuona ukifanya mazoezi ya kucheza na rafiki yako. Tafadhali kafanyieni nje ili niweze kumaliza kufanya usafi wa nyumba. Baadaye, unaweza kunionesha unavyocheza."

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl: “Okay, @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver!”
text: @Je, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl na @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver walijisikiaje!”

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl and her friend enjoy practising their dance moves.
text: @global.w_instruct_teen_girl na rafiki yake wanafurahia mazoezi yao ya kucheza muziki.
note: The string @global.w_instruct_teen_girl should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Thank you for practising outside while I finished cleaning, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Now I have some time to watch your dance."
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Asante kwa kufanya mazoezi nje wakati nilipokuwa namalizia kufanya usafi, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl. Sasa nina muda wa kuangalia namna unavyocheza muziki."

SourceText: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Wow, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! You have such good dance moves!"
text: @global.w_instruct_female_caregiver: "Waoow, @global.w_instruct_teen_girl! Unacheza vizuri sana!"

SourceText: Ignoring our emotions
text: Anapuuzia hisia zetu

SourceText: Let’s look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:
text: Hebu tuangalie mfano wa jinsi ambavyo wakati mwingine msongo wa mawazo unaweza kutuzidia sana, sisi sote:

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Can I have money to buy some airtime?”  

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “Leave me alone and mind your own business!”
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: "Ninaomba pesa ya kununulia mpira."

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: "Niache nilivyo, kafanye mambo yako!"

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “What did I do? You never listen!”  

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “I said leave me alone or you will get a beating!”
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Nimekosea nini? Huwa hunisikilizi!”

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: "Nimesema niache nilivyo, la sivyo utapata kipigo!"

SourceText: @global.w_stress_girl: “Look! I have made a house!”
text: @global.w_stress_girl: "Ona! Nimejenga nyumba!”
note: The string @global.w_stress_girl: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Who cares about your stupid house!”
text: @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: "Nani anajali nyumba yako ya kijinga hiyo!"
note: The string @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: Acknowledging our emotions
text: Kutambua hisia zetu

SourceText: Thank you for thinking along! Let’s go back in time and see what @global.w_stress_male_caregiver does now:
text: Asanteni kwa kufikiria pamoja! Hebu turudi siku za nyuma ili kuelewa @global.w_stress_male_caregiver anachokifanya sasa:
note: The string @global.w_stress_male_caregiver should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_stress_male_caregiver lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed, when @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1 entered.
text: @global.w_stress_male_caregiver amefukuzwa kazi. Alikuwa amekaa nyumbani akihisi kufadhaika na msongo wa mawazo, pindi @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1 alipoingia.

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Can I have money to buy some airtime?”  

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver (taking a breath): “I’m sorry son. I had a difficult day today. The boss fired me.”
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: "Ninaomba pesa ya kununulia mpira."

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver (akishusha pumzi): “Samahani, mwanangu. Siku ya leo imeniendea vibaya. Bosi amenifukuza kazi.”

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Oh no!  I need a new school uniform.”  

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “I’ll try, son, and your @global.w_stress_female_caregiver’s job will help us get by while I look for another job.”
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Ooh, jamani! Ninahitaji sare mpya ya shule.”

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: "Nitajaribu, mwanangu, na kazi ya @global.w_stress_female_caregiver yako itatusaidia wakati ninatafuta kazi nyingine."

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “I can help out with looking for work, too, @global.w_stress_male_caregiver?”  

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “No it’s okay, @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1. I appreciate your offer. The most important thing is that you work hard at school. Thanks for listening to me.”
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: "Je, ninaweza pia kusaidia kutafuta kazi, @global.w_stress_male_caregiver?"

@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “Hapana, usijali, @global.w_stress_teen_boy_1. Ninashukuru kwa msaada wako. Jambo muhimu zaidi ni kwamba ufanye bidii shuleni. Ninakushukuru kwa kunisikiliza.”

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “Let’s play some soccer together. It will help me get this stress off my mind for a bit.”  

@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Okay, @global.w_stress_male_caregiver!”
text:
@global.w_stress_male_caregiver: “Hebu tukacheze mpira pamoja. Itanisaidia kidogo kuondokana na huu msongo wa mawazo.”

@global.w_stress_teen_boy_1: “Sawa, @global.w_stress_male_caregiver!”

SourceText:
Think back to when you were a teenager. 

Was there ever a time when you were in danger but you could not tell your family because they would have been angry?

This ALMOST happened to @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2 and @global.w_stress_teen_girl! Let’s have a look:
text:
Kumbuka wakati ulipokuwa kijana.

Je, kulikuwa na wakati wowote ambao ulikuwa hatarini lakini hukuweza kuiambia familia yako kwa sababu wangekasirika?

Hali hiyo ILIKARIBIA KABISA kumtokea @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2 na @global.w_stress_teen_girl! Hebu tuangalie:

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_2: "Don’t tell the adults, but I am going to bar with my friends tonight" 

@global.w_stress_teen_girl: "Have fun! I have told them I am staying with my girlfriend, but I am actually going to a cool party."
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_boy_2: "Usiwaambie wakubwa, leo usiku nitaenda baa na marafiki zangu."

@global.w_stress_teen_girl: "Nenda ukale raha! Mimi nimewaambia nitakuwa na shoga yangu, lakini ninaenda kwenye bonge la sherehe."

SourceText: @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2: "I think they are dealing drugs. We could all get arrested. But I can’t tell my parents – they will be so angry!"
text: @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2: "Nadhani hawa jamaa wanafanya biashara ya madawa ya kulevya. Sisi sote tunaweza kukamatwa. Lakini siwezi kuwaambia wazazi wangu – watakasirika sana."
note: The string @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_stress_teen_girl: "I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This boy says he will take me but he wants us to go to his house first. I can’t tell my parents – I lied about coming to this party."
text: @global.w_stress_teen_girl: "Ninaogopa. Kila mtu amelewa sana hawezi kuendesha gari kunipeleka nyumbani. Huyu mvulana anasema atanipeleka lakini anataka twende kwanza nyumbani kwake. Siwezi kuwaambia wazazi wangu – niliwadanganya ili niweze kuja kwenye sherehe hii."
note: The string @global.w_stress_teen_girl: should not be translated.

SourceText:
These are dangerous situations! Thankfully, @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2 and @global.w_stress_teen_girl then remembered what @global.w_stress_parent told them:  

"I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it. 

Shall we use an imaginary ‘@global.safety_word_example_1’ as @global.safety_word? Just say something about @global.safety_word_example_1, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry – even if you are doing something you should not."
text:
Hizi ni hali za hatari! Kwa bahati nzuri, @global.w_stress_teen_boy_2 na @global.w_stress_teen_girl walikumbuka kile @global.w_stress_parent alichowaambia:

"Ninajali sana usalama wenu kuliko kitu chochote. Mkipata shida yoyote, au kuogopa kitu, mnaweza kunipigia simu nije kuwasaidia wakati wowote, au kunieleza shida hiyo.

Je, tunaweza kutumia ya kufikirika  '‘@global.safety_word_example_1 kama @global.safety_word? Sema tu kitu  kuhusu @global.safety_word_example_1, Ninaahidi kuwa nitajitahidi kadri ya uwezo wangu kusaidia na sitakasirika – hata mkiwa mnafanya jambo ambalo hampaswi kulifanya."

SourceText:
@global.w_stress_teen_girl: "@global.w_stress_parent, how is @global.safety_word_example_1 doing now?"

@global.w_stress_parent (on the other side of the phone): "Not well. We need you at home. I will come pick you up right away. Where are you?"
text:
@global.w_stress_teen_girl: "@global.w_stress_parent, unaendeleaje @global.safety_word_example_1 kwa sasa?"

@global.w_stress_parent (kwa upande mwingine wa simu): "Sio sawa. Tunakuhitaji nyumbani. Nitakuja kukuchukua mara moja. Uko wapi?"

SourceText: Money problems
text: Matatizo ya pesa

SourceText:
It can be hard to make ends meet every month. Many families have this problem! 

Including @global.w_money_grandma – let's have a look:
text:
Kupata mahitaji ya mwezi siku linaweza kuwa jambo gumu. Familia nyingi zina tatizo hili!

Akiwemo @global.w_money_grandma – hebu tuangalie:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I have been taking care of my grandchildren, @global.w_money_teen_girl and @global.w_money_teen_boy, since their parents died when they were young. We often struggle with money, as I only receive a small grant."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: "Nimekuwa nikiwatunza wajukuu wangu, @global.w_money_teen_girl na @global.w_money_teen_boy, tangu wazazi wao walipofariki wakiwa wadogo. Mara nyingi tunahangaika sana kupata pesa, kwani ninapata kiasi kidogo tu cha msaada."

SourceText: @global.w_money_grandma: "I am so stressed. I don’t have any money left. And now I am fighting with my teens over things they want – again."
text: @global.w_money_grandma: "Nina msongo mkubwa wa mawazo. Sina pesa yoyote iliyobaki. Na sasa – kwa mara nyingine – ninapambana na vijana wangu kuhusu vitu wanavyotaka."
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma: should not be translated.

SourceText: Preparing for the future
text: Kujianda kwa ajili ya wakati ujao

SourceText:
Great work, you have completed the first 3 steps! 

Let's see how @global.w_money_grandma made a plan with her money, just like you are doing:
text:
Kazi nzuri sana, mmekamilisha hatua 3 za kwanza!

Hebu tuone jinsi @global.w_money_grandma alivyoweka mpango wa pesa zake, kama tu mnavyofanya:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText:
"I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I do not know where to get the money.  Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. 

I should save, but that feels impossible!"
text:
"Ninataka wajukuu wangu wawe na maisha bora siku zijazo, lakini sijui mahali pa kupata pesa. Matapeli wa mikopo ni hatari na kuwalipa ni ghali sana.

Ninapaswa kuweka akiba, lakini ninahisi hilo haliwezekani!"

SourceText: "My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"
text: "Lengo langu ni kuhakikisha mjukuu wangu wa kiume ataweza kupata elimu ya juu ya sekondari na mjukuu wangu wa kike anaweza kutimiza ndoto yake ya kusoma chuo kikuu. Ninawezaje kuweka akiba ya pesa nyingi kutokana na pesa kidogo nilizo nazo?"

SourceText: "I know – let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a savings and loans group."
text: "Ninajua – hebu tuanze na mpango! Kwanza, ngoja nitengeneze bajeti – mpango wa ninavyoweza kuweka akiba ya pesa zangu. Halafu nitaweka akiba ya pesa kidogo tu kwa wakati mmoja – nitajiunga hata na kikundi cha kuweka na kukopa."

SourceText: "I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but do not need."
text: "Ninapaswa pia kuzungumza na wajukuu wangu wachague vitu vinavyotuwezesha kutumia pesa kidogo kila wiki. Watanisaidia kufikiria vitu tunavyovitaka lakini hatuvihitaji."

SourceText:
A few years later:

"Look, we reached our dreams! I did not borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for @global.w_money_teen_boy’s high school and save some money for @global.w_money_teen_girl’s university. I am so proud of this.”
text:
Miaka michache baadaye:

"Ona, tumetimiza ndoto zetu! Sikukopa pesa yoyote kwa marafiki au kwa matapeli wa mikopo. Kwa kuweka akiba kidogokidogo kila wiki, niliweza kulipia ada ya sekondari kwa @global.w_money_teen_boy na kuweka akiba kwa ajili ya chuo kikuu ya @global.w_money_teen_girl. Ninajivunia sana jambo hili.”

SourceText: Coping with emergencies
text: Kuendana na dharura

SourceText: Saving is important for one more reason: emergencies! @global.w_money_grandma also learnt this along the way:
text: Kuweka akiba ni muhimu kwa sababu moja kubwa: dharura! @global.w_money_grandma naye alijifunza hivyo:
note: The string @global.w_money_grandma should not be translated.

SourceText: “One night there was a horrible storm that broke my roof. Everything was flooded. I suddenly had to find money to fix the roof. I just felt defeated.”
text: “Usiku mmoja kulikuwa na dhoruba ya kutisha iliyoezua paa la nyumba yangu. Kila kitu kiliharibiwa na mafuriko. Ghafla ilibidi nitafute pesa za kukarabati paa. Nilihisi kushindwa kabisa.”

SourceText: Making a rule
text: Kutunga sheria

SourceText: Let's read what happened with @global.w_rules_teen_boy and his @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1:
text: Hebu tusome kilichotokea kwa @global.w_rules_teen_boy na @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1:

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "You always come home late!"

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: "No I don’t, I don’t even know what late means! Stop nagging me."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "Kila wakati unachelewa kurudi nyumbani!"

@global.w_rules_teen_boy: "Siyo kweli, hata sijui kuchelewa maana yake ni nini! Acha kunisumbua."

SourceText: Which specific rule could @global.w_rules_teen_boy and @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 create together?
text: Je, ni sheria ipi maalum ambayo @global.w_rules_teen_boy na @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1 wanaweza kutengeza kwa pamoja?

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That is right, and it is also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset. What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?”
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: "Hiyo ni kweli, na vilevile sio salama kwenye eneo hili kuwa huko nje baada ya jua kuzama. Unafikiri ni muda gani mzuri kwako kurudi nyumbani?”
note: The string @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 10pm?"  

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “That is a bit late, what about 6pm? Or something in the middle?"
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Je, ninaweza kurudi nyumbani saa 4 usiku?"

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Hapo utakuwa umechelewa kidogo, vipi saa 12 jioni? Au katikati hapo?"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “I could come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday?” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Je, ninaweza kurudi nyumbani saa 12 jioni siku ninazoamka kwenda shule na saa 4 usiku siku za Ijumaa na Jumamosi?”

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Ndiyo, safi sana. Kuanzia sasa, sheria yetu hapa nyumbani ni kwamba unatakiwa kurudi nyumbani saa 12 jioni siku unazoamka kwenda shule na saa 4 usiku siku za Ijumaa na Jumamosi. Lakini kila wakati uje nyumbani na rafiki. Sawa?"

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Okay, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1” 

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you very much, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for helping to come up with a good rule together. I am proud to see how responsible you are getting.”
text:
@global.w_rules_teen_boy: “Sawa, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1”

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Asante sana, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, kwa kusaidia kuweka sheria nzuri pamoja. Ninaona fahari kuona jinsi unavyowajibika.”

SourceText:
The next day...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Thank you, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, for coming home on time. After you finish your schoolwork we can have your favourite meal for dinner.”
text:
Siku iliyofuata...

@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_1: “Asante, @global.w_rules_teen_boy, kwa kuja nyumbani mapema. Ukimaliza kazi zako za darasani, uje tuandae chakula ambacho huwa unapendelea kwa ajili ya usiku wa leo.”

SourceText: Online safety
text: Usalama mitandaoni

SourceText: Rules are important to keep your teens safe – not only offline, but also online. There’s more about this in the @global.weekly_workshop on safety planning, but let’s already have a first look now!
text: Sheria ni muhimu ili kuwaweka salama vijana wako – sio tu akiwa hayupo mtandaoni, bali hata akiwa mtandaoni. Kuna mengi zaidi kuhusu jambo hili kwenye @global.weekly_workshop inayohusu kupanga namna ya usalama, lakini sasa ngoja tuangalie kitu cha kwanza!
note: The string @global.weekly_workshop should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, have you done your homework?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Just a minute @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, I’m finishing this @global.teen_social_medium video."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_rules_teen_girl, umefanya kazi ya nyumbani?"

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Subiri kidogo @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2, ninamalizia hii video ya @global.teen_social_medium."

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like @global.teen_social_medium."

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "All my friends are on it, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Unajua kucheza vizuri! Niambie kwa nini unapenda @global.teen_social_medium."

@global.w_rules_teen_girl: "Marafiki zangu wote wamejiunga, @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2. Nina waipendao zaidi ya 600 na wafuasi 120."

SourceText:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of how well you dance, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. But we need to make sure you are safe. 

I know your friends look at @global.teen_social_medium, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens."
text:
@global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Ninajuvia sana jinsi unavyocheza vizuri, @global.w_rules_teen_girl. Lakini tunahitaji kuhakikisha kuwa uko salama.

Ninajua marafiki zako wanaangalia @global.teen_social_medium, lakini unapotumia akaunti huria, elewa kwamba kuna watu wengine wanaotazama video za vijana ili kukidhi mahitaji yao ya kingono. Wakati mwingine wanawasiliana na vijana. Wanajifanya kuwa watu wema lakini wanaishia kuwatishia na kuwadhalilisha vijana."

SourceText: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "I’m proud of you @global.w_rules_teen_girl!"
text: @global.w_rules_female_caregiver_2: "Ninajivunia sana wewe @global.w_rules_teen_girl!"

SourceText: Home late
text: Kuchelewa nyumbani

SourceText: Let's read what happened with @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 and his @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver:
text: Hebu tusome kile kilichotokea kwa @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 na @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver wake:

SourceText: @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! What time is this? You are late!”
text: @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! Sasa hivi ni saa ngapi? Umechelewa kurudi!"

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “I can explain, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, I can.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, you are not keeping our rule! I will give you a hiding!”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Naomba nikueleze, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, naomba nikueleze."

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, haufuati sheria yetu! Nitakuchapa sana!”

SourceText: @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “That’s unfair! You never listen to me!! I hate you!”
text: @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “Hiyo siyo sawa! Huwa siku zote hunisikilizi!! Ninakuchukia!”
note: The string @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: Discussing and using consequences
text: Kujadili na kutumia adhabu

SourceText: Let's go back to @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 and his @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver
text: Hebu turudi kwa @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 na @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "I am concerned that you are often still coming home late, @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1. What can we do to help you remember to come home in time?"

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "If I come home in time, maybe I can stay up 30 minutes later than usual?"
text:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Nina wasiwasi kuona mara nyingi bado unachelewa kurudi nyumbani, @global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1. Je, tufanye nini ili kukusaidia ukumbuke kuwahi kurudi nyumbani?

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Je, nikiwahi kurudi nyumbani, ninaweza kuchelewa kulala kwa dakika 30 kuliko kawaida?"

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “That is a good idea! And what should we do if you don’t follow the rule?”  

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 (mumbles):  “Mgmluuhm...”
text:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Hilo ni wazo zuri! Na usipofuata hiyo sheria, tufanyeje?"

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1 (akiumauma maneno): "Mgmluuhm..."

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Oh come on, I know you have some ideas."

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Okay…. What about: I have to do my homework?"
text:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Sema! Najua una mawazo mazuri."

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Sawa…. Vipi kama: Nifanye kazi ya shuleni?"

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "You have to do your homework anyway. If you forget the rule, it is fair that you will not be able to see your friends the next day."

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Okay, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver."
text:
@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Hakuna shida kwa sababu unatakiwa pia ufanye kazi yako ya shuleni. Ukisahau sheria hiyo, basi hautaenda kuwatembelea marafiki zako siku inayofuata."

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Sawa, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver."

SourceText:
The next day...

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! What time is it! It is late!”
text:
Siku iliyofuata...

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! Sasa hivi ni saa ngapi? Umechelewa! ”

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “Sorry @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver – you can go back to sleep.”  

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “It is WAY past the time you were supposed to be home!”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Samahani, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver – unaweza kurudi kulala."

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Muda uliotakiwa kurudi nyumbani umeshapita SANA!"

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “I can explain, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, I can.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, it is the middle of the night and you came home later than we agreed. Whatever the reason is, you must understand that this is not acceptable. @global.w_consequence_female_caregiver and I felt really worried.”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Naomba nikueleze, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, naomba nikueleze."

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, sasa hivi ni usiku wa manane na umerudi nyumbani baada ya muda tuliokubaliana. Hata uwe na sababu gani, ni lazima uelewe kwamba hii haikubaliki. Mimi na @global.w_consequence_female_caregiver tulikuwa na wasiwasi sana."

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “My friends wanted me to stay longer. They were calling me a baby for having to go home already.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “I know it can be hard to say no to your friends. Let’s talk more about this in the morning when we have had some rest.”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Marafiki zangu walitaka niendelee kukaa nao. Walikuwa wananiita mtoto nilipotaka kuwahi kurudi nyumbani.”

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Najua ni vigumu kuwakatalia marafiki zako. Hebu tulale, tupumzike kwanza, halafu kesho asubuhi tutazungumza kuhusu jambo hili."

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “I am sorry I worried you and @global.w_consequence_female_caregiver.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “Thank you. Now go to bed, but just to be clear, as you came home later than we agreed, you will not be allowed to go out tomorrow night.”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: "Samahani, nilikupa wasiwasi wewe na @global.w_consequence_female_caregiver."

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: "Asante. Sasa nenda ulale, lakini ngoja nikukumbushe tena, ukichelewa kurudi nyumbani kuliko tulivyokubaliana, kesho usiku hautaruhusiwa kutoka nyumbani.”

SourceText: The new phone
text: Simu mpya

SourceText: Let’s look at what happened to @global.w_solve_teen_girl and her @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1 when @global.w_solve_teen_girl got a phone from a boy… can you believe it!
text: Hebu tuangalie kile kilichotokea kwa @global.w_solve_teen_girl na @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1 pindi @global.w_solve_teen_girl alipopewa simu na mvulana… waweza kuamini!

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: “@global.w_solve_teen_girl, where did you get that thing?” 

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “@global.w_solve_teen_boy_1 bought it for me. It’s a nice phone, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1. It takes great photos!"
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: "@global.w_solve_teen_girl, umekitoa wapi hicho?"

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “@global.w_solve_teen_boy_1 ameninunulia. Ni simu nzuri, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1. Inapiga picha nzuri sana!"

SourceText:
