@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: “I don’t want to see that expensive thing! That boy is no good! How does he think you are going to repay him for this?!”  

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “That’s not how it works, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1! That’s not fair!”
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: "Sitaki kuona hicho kitu cha bei ghali! Huyo kijana si mtu mzuri! Hivi anafikiria utamlipaje hiyo simu?!”

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “Sio hivyo, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1! Hivyo sio sawa!”

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: “I do not want to hear it!” 

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “You are not even trying to listen to me! I do not know why I even try with you!”
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_1: "Sitaki kusikia hiyo habari!"

@global.w_solve_teen_girl: “Hutaki hata kunisikiliza! Hata sijui nikwambieje!”

SourceText: Dealing with bullies
text: Kukabiliana na uonevu

SourceText: Let’s see how problem solving works in practice.
text: Hebu tuone jinsi utatuzi wa matatizo unavyofanya kazi katika maisha halisi.

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 is coming home from work. 

@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 (thinking): "Ay my poor feet! I need to sit down a moment and drink a cup of coffee before I start preparing food for everyone."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 anarudi nyumbani kutoka kazini.

@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 (akiwaza): "Miguu yangu maskini! Ninahitaji kukaa chini kidogo na kunywa kikombe cha kahawa kabla ya kuanza kuandaa chakula cha wote."

SourceText: @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2! What are you doing? That bread is for dinner! Now there will not be enough for us all!"
text: @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2! Unafanya nini? Huo mkate ni wa chakula cha usiku! Sasa hautatutosha sisi sote!"

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: “Sorry, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2, I was just hungry. I can explain, you see, there is this guy at school...” 

@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 (thinking): “Take a pause… just breathe…”
text:
@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Samahani, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2, nilikuwa na njaa. Ngoja nikwambie basi, kuna mtu mmoja shuleni...”

@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2 (akiwaza): "Tulia... vuta pumzi kidogo..."

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: “Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having enough food for dinner.” 

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: “I am sorry, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Hebu niache kidogo. Nimechoka na sasa nihangaike kutafuta chakula cha kututosha usiku.”

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Nisamehe, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."

SourceText: Step 1: KNOW IT
text: Hatua ya Kwanza: ELEWA

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Now tell me, why are you so hungry? Did you not eat your lunch at school?” 

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "That is the problem. There is a guy at school who bullies me. He says if I do not give my lunch to him every day, he and his friends will hurt me. He makes me so mad!"
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Sasa niambie, kwa nini una njaa sana? Mchana hukula shuleni?”

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Hilo ndo tatizo. Kuna mtu shuleni ananionea. Anasema nisipompa chakula changu kila siku, yeye na marafiki zake watanipiga. Ananikasirisha sana!"

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "I am sorry to hear that but am glad that you told me, @global.w_solve_teen_boy_2. It does not mean that you can eat everybody’s dinner. After we speak, you need to go to the shop to buy some more bread. But first: What do you think we should do about the bully problem?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Well… I want to just hit him or get him back."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Nasikitika kusikia hivyo lakini nimefurahi kwamba umeniambia, @global.w_solve_teen_boy_2. Hata hivyo, hiyo siyo sababu ya wewe kula chakula cha kila mtu. Tukimaliza kuzungumza, uende dukani kununua mkate mwingine. Lakini kwanza: Unadhani tufanyeje kuhusu hili tatizo la kuonewa?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Unajua... Nataka nije nimpige au nimlipizie kisasi."

SourceText: Step 2: SOLVE IT
text: Hatua ya Pili: TAFUTA UTATUZI

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Hmmm… what do you think will happen to you if you do that?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "I don’t know. He is bigger than me so he will probably hurt me more. And I could get into trouble at school and expelled."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Hmmm… unafikiri nini kitakutokea ukifanya hivyo?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Sijui. Yeye ni mkubwa kuliko mimi kwa hiyo anaweza akaniumiza mno. Na ninaweza kupata matatizo shuleni, nikafukuzwa."

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Yes, that could happen. What could we do instead?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "I guess I could tell the teacher. But then the other kids will call me a tattletale. Maybe you could talk to the teacher?"
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Ndiyo, inaweza kuwa hivyo. Tunaweza kufanya nini badala yake?"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Nadhani ninaweza kumwambia mwalimu. Lakini watoto wengine wataniita mjinga. Au ukazungumze na mwalimu?"

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "That sounds like a better idea. I could also have a word with his parents if you want me to."

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Sure. If you think that would help too. Thanks, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Nadhani hilo ni wazo zuri zaidi. Ninaweza pia kwenda kuzungumza na wazazi wake ukitaka nifanye hivyo."

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Ni sawa kama unadhani kufanya hivyo kutasaidia pia. Asante, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Anything for you, my dear. I will do it first thing after dinner. And you know? If that does not work, we can always try something else together."

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Thanks, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Chochote kwa ajili yako mpendwa. Nitafanya mara tu ya baada ya chakula cha usiku. Halafu unajua? Kama hilo lisipofanikiwa, tunaweza kujaribu kitu kingine kwa pamoja."

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Asante, @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2."

SourceText: Step 3: TRY IT
text: Hatua ya Tatu: CHAGUA

SourceText: Step 4: TEST IT
text: Hatua ya Nne: JARIBU

SourceText:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "I am sorry to hear that, @global.w_solve_teen_boy_2. Shall I ask your uncle to go talk to his parents? If that does not work, we will try something else!"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Yes, thank you @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2. At least I know you are on my side."
text:
@global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2: "Nasikitika kusikia hivyo, @global.w_solve_teen_boy_2. Je, nimuombe mjomba wako aende kuongea na wazazi wake? Hilo lisipofanikiwa, tutajaribu njia nyingine!"

@global.w_solve_teen_boy_2: "Sawa, asante @global.w_solve_female_caregiver_2. Angalau najua uko upande wangu."

SourceText: Man in car
text: Mwanaume ndani ya gari

SourceText:
Communication is the most important thing!

Let's see what happened with @global.w_safe_female_caregiver and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1:
text:
Mawasiliano ni jambo muhimu zaidi!

Hebu tuangalie kile kilichotokea kwa @global.w_safe_female_caregiver na @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1:

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Something happened when I was out with my friends @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 and @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Tell me, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1."
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Kuna kitu kilitokea nilipoenda kutembea na marafiki zangu @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2 na @global.w_safe_teen_girl_3!"

@global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Niambie, @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1."

SourceText:
Man in car: “Hey beautiful. I have been looking at you for a while. You are very beautiful, what is your name?"

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Her name is @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1.”
text:
Mwanaume ndani ya gari: “Halo, mrembo. Nimekuwa nakuona kwa muda. Wewe ni mrembo sana, unaitwa nani?"

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: "Anaitwa @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1."

SourceText:
Man in car: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, would you like to come with me to have something to drink and chips? Come on, get in, you will be back in time, I promise…”

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I am not sure if that is a good idea…”
text:
Mwanaume ndani ya gari: "@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, ungependa kuongozana nami tukapate chipsi na kinywaji? Twende, ingia, utawahi kurudi, nakuahidi… ”

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Sidhani kama hilo ni wazo zuri…"

SourceText: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “You are lucky, my friend. I wish a man would ask ME out and buy me gifts. I am telling you, if you do not do this I’m going to tell everyone you are stupid!”
text: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: “Una bahati, rafiki yangu. Natamani mwanamume aniombe MIMI tutoke akaninunulie zawadi. Ninakuambia, usipofanya hivyo, nitaenda nimwambie kila mtu kuwa wewe ni mjinga!”
note: The string @global.w_safe_teen_girl_2: should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1 do not go! Be careful! Let’s go home. It is dangerous to go with people you do not know. Besides, he is too old for you and what he is doing is wrong."

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: “I just do not know…”
text:
@global.w_safe_teen_girl_3: “@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1, usiende! Kuwa mwangalifu! Twende nyumbani. Ni hatari kwenda na watu usiowajua. Tena, mtu mwenyewe ni mkubwa sana kwako na anachokifanya sio sawa."

@global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Hata sijui nifanye nini…"

SourceText: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Pfff, I am so proud of you that you did not get into the car. That was a dangerous situation, thank you for telling me!"
text: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Ninafurahi sana kwamba hukuingia kwenye gari. Hiyo ilikuwa hali ya hatari, asante kwa kuniambia!"
note: The string @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: should not be translated.

SourceText: Online contact
text: Mawasiliano mitandaoni

SourceText: Let's look at another example of a dangerous situation together.
text: Hebu tuangalie pamoja mfano mwingine wa tukio la hatari.

SourceText: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "My friend has been talking with a guy our age online... She is going to send him photos of herself. Is that better because he is our age?"
text: @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: "Rafiki yangu amekuwa akiwasiliana na mvulana wa rika letu mtandaoni... Atamtumia picha zake. Je, hilo ni jambo zuri kwa sababu yeye ni wa rika letu?"
note: The string @global.w_safe_teen_girl_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "You are a good friend for being worried about her. Sending sexy photos is a real risk too."
text: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Wewe ni rafiki mzuri kwa kumjali mwenzako. Kutuma picha zinazovutia kimapenzi ni hatari sana pia."
note: The string @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Sometimes people are not who they say they are online – he could say he is your age but be a 50 year old man. Or when they break up, he could send those photos to everyone and your friend would feel awful."
text: @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: "Wakati mwingine watu wanadanganya mtandaoni – anaweza kusema ni wa rika lako kumbe ni mwanaume wa miaka 50. Au wakivunja mahusiano, anaweza kutuma picha hizo kwa kila mtu na rafiki yako akajisikia vibaya sana."
note: The string @global.w_safe_female_caregiver: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1's crisis
text: Matatizo ya @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1's
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1's should not be translated.

SourceText:
Crisis can happen to anyone. 

Let's see what happened with @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 and @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver:
text:
Hali ya hatari inaweza kumtokea mtu yeyote.

Hebu tuone kilichotokea kwa @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1 na @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver:

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?"
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Jamani, Mjukuu wangu, unaonekana unasikitika sana, unataka kuniambia kilichotokea?"
note: The string @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: should not be translated.

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "It is true, he… he… made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble."
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Ni kweli, ali-… ali-… alisabisha nifanye hivyo! Alisababisha nifanye naye mapenzi! Naapa, sikutaka; hadi nikasema HAPANA, lakini akaniambia nitapata shida."
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Asante kwa kunishirikisha mimi pia. Usihofu. Hili sio kosa lako."

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ah I know, let’s go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?"

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Yes… Okay… But will you come with me?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ah najua, twende kliniki. Wao watajua tufanye nini ili kukusaidia. Je, hiyo ni sawa kwako?"

@global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1: "Ndiyo… Sawa… Lakini, je, tunaenda wote na wewe?"

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Of course I will. And @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this."
text: @global.w_crisis_female_caregiver: "Ni sawa kabisa. Na @global.w_crisis_teen_girl_1? Kumbuka hili siyo kosa lako. Ninakupenda. Wewe ni mtu mzuri. Tutalimaliza hili."

SourceText: The fight
text: Kupigana

SourceText: Another problem that many parents are worried about is violence and crime. Let’s look at an example together.
text: Tatizo jingine ambalo wazazi wengi wana wasiwasi nalo ni vurugu na uhalifu. Hebu tuangalie pamoja mfano mmoja.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, you look worried since yesterday. What is wrong?"
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1, unaonekana una wasiwasi tangu jana. Kuna tatizo gani?"

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Yesterday, my friends and I went to a soccer match. Some guys who were drunk started a fight with my friend."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Continue, I am listening. I hope you did not fight?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Jana, mimi na marafiki zangu tulienda kwenye mpira. Kuna vijana waliokuwa wamelewa, walianza kupigana na rafiki yangu."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Endelea, ninakusikiliza. Natumaini haukupigana?"

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "I did not want to, but I could not just stand there and let them beat up my friend, so…"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "So, did you fight in order to help defend your friend?"
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Sikutaka kupigana, lakini nisingeweza kukaa tu hapo na kuwaacha wampige rafiki yangu, kwa hiyo..."

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Kwa hiyo, ulipigana ili kumtetea rafiki yako?"

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Everyone was fighting. I saw someone lying on the field in a pool of blood. He looked… dead."
text: @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: “Kila mtu alikuwa anapigana. Niliona mtu mmoja amelala uwanjani kwenye dimbwi la damu. Alionekana... amefariki."
note: The string @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "I am glad you are telling me about this, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Let’s sit down together now and discuss whether we should involve the police or someone else to help."
text: @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Nimefurahi unaniambia kuhusu jambo hili, @global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1. Hebu tukae pamoja sasa na kujadili iwapo tunapaswa kuwahusisha polisi au mtu mwingine wa kutusaidia."

SourceText:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Thank you, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "We will get through this. Remember, we will support you as a family."
text:
@global.w_crisis_teen_boy_1: "Asante, @global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1"

@global.w_crisis_male_caregiver_1: "Tutalimaliza hili. Kumbuka, tutakusaidia kama familia."

SourceText: Sex talk
text: Maongezi ya kingono

SourceText:
Teenagers can get information about sex from school, their friends, home or social media. This information may not always be right or suitable for their age and situation. 

Parents and teenagers can feel uncomfortable when topics around ‘sex’ are mentioned. They may even get into arguments, especially when parents do not approve of their teen’s behaviour. 

Let’s look at an example:
text:
Vijana wanaweza pata taarifa kuhusu ngono kutoka shuleni, marafiki zao, nyumbani au mitandao ya kijamii. Taarifa hii huenda isiwe sahihi kila wakati au inafaa kwa umri na hali zao.

Wazazi na vijana wanaweza kujisikia vibaya pale mambo ya kingono yanapotamkwa. Wanaweza hata kuingia katika mabishano, hasa wakati wazazi hawaidhinishi tabia ya kijana wao.

Tuangalie mfano:

SourceText:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1: “What is this talk of sex in my house! You are too young…”

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_1: “But @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1, it’s not like that…!”
text:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1 (amekasirika): "Ni nini hii maongezi kuhusu ngono nyumbani kwangu! Wewe bado ni mdogo..."

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_1 (anaingilia): "Ila @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1, sio hivyo...!"

SourceText:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1: “No, no, no, @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1! I will not have this discussion with you. Is that what you do at school? Talking about things not suited for your age instead of focusing on school? You won’t go out with those friends of yours anymore. You want to bring shame in this home. Come here now! I am going to hit you. Stupid girl!”

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_1: “No @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1, please don’t hit me, it is not what you think!”
text:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1: “Hapana, hapana, hapana, @global.w_srh_teen_girl_1! Sitakuwa na mjadala huu na wewe. Je, ndivyo unavyofanya shuleni? Je, unazungumza kuhusu mambo ambayo hayakufai kwa umri wako badala ya kuzingatia shule? Hutatoka tena na hao marafiki zako. Unataka kuleta aibu katika nyumba hii. Njoo hapa sasa! Mimi naenda kukupiga. Msichana mjinga!”

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_1: “Hapana @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_1, tafadhali usinipige, sivyo unavyofikiri

SourceText: My new boyfriend
text: Mpenzi wangu mpya wa kiume

SourceText:
It can be hard for parents and teens to talk about boyfriends and girlfriends. 

Let’s look at an example of how this can happen calmly:
text:
Inaweza kuwa ngumu kwa wazazi na vijana kuzungumza kuhusu marafiki wa kiume na wa kike.

Hebu tuangalie mfano namna gani hii inaweza kutokea kwa utulivu:

SourceText:
@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2: “@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2, can I talk to you about something?”

@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2 (calmly): “Sure, my darling. What is the matter?”
text:
@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2 (anaangalia chini): "@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2,naweza kuzungumza na wewe kuhusu kitu?"

@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2 (kwa utulivu): "Hakika, kipenzi changu. Nini shida?"

SourceText:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2: “What do you think would be a fair rule about how you spend time together?”

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2: “How about: We can spend time together if there is an adult with us?”
text:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2: "Unadhani sheria gani itakuwa sawa kuhusu namna mnatumia muda kwa pamoja?"

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2: "Vipi kuhusu: Tunaweza kutumia muda kwa pamoja kama mtu mzima yupo nasi?"

SourceText:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2: “That would be fine as long as his parents also know. I will chat with his mother when I see her later today. And after you get back, we can talk about how it went.”

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2 (hugs @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2): “Okay. Thank you for coming up with a plan together, @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2.”
text:
@global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2: “Hilo ni sawa kama wazazi wake pia wanajua. Nitazungumza na mama yake nitakapoonana nae baadaye leo. Na utakaporudi, tunaweza kuzungumza jinsi ilivyokuwa."

@global.w_srh_teen_girl_2 (anamkumbatia @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2): “Sawa. Asante kwa kuja na mpango pamoja, @global.w_srh_female_caregiver_2."

SourceText: Stop crying
text: Acha kulia

SourceText:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour – especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

Let’s see what happened with @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 who lost her mother 6 months ago:
text:
Hisia mbaya zinaweza kusababisha tabia mbaya- hasa kwa watoto. Kumpoteza mlezi au mpendwa wako inaweza kumfanya kijana wako ahisi wasiwasi, kutokujiamini, au hasira, na mara nyingi inaweza kumfanya aigize.

Hebu tuone kilichotokea kwa @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 aliyefiwa na mama yake miezi 6 iliyopita:
note: The string @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1 should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: "I miss @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1 so much..."
text: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: "Nimemkumbuka @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1 sana..."

SourceText:
@global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1, you need to stop crying. It has been months already! This crying will not bring @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1 back and you are doing worse and worse in school!" 

@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: "You just don't understand how I feel! You never listen!"
text:
@global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: "@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1, unatakiwa uache kulia. Miezi imepita tayari! Kilio hiki hakitamrudisha @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1 na unazidi kufanya vibaya zaidi shuleni!"

@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: "Huelewi jinsi ninavyohisi! Hujawahi kunisikiliza!"

SourceText: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: "Stop being so dramatic! Your behaviour is unacceptable!"
text: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: "Acha vituko! Tabia yako haikubaliki!"
note: The string @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: Sharing memories
text: Kushirikishana kumbukumbu

SourceText:
Thank you for thinking along!

Let’s see what happens if @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1 tries to support @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1:
text:
Asante kwa kufikiri nasi!

Hebu tuone kitakachotokea endapo @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1 atajaribu kumsaidia @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1:

SourceText:
@global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: “I know you are sad, @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1. I also miss @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1. What do you think we can do to help you feel better?”

@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: “Maybe we can visit @global.w_grief_aunt, so we can share stories about @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1?”
text:
@global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: “Najua una huzuni, @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1. Pia namkumbuka @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1. Unafikiri tunaweza kufanya nini ili kusaidia kujisikia vizuri?”

@global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: "Labda tunaweza kumtembelea @global.w_grief_aunt, ili tushirikishane hadithi kuhusu @global.w_grief_female_caregiver_1?"

SourceText: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: “I like that idea, let’s go see her on Saturday. Do you already want to tell me more about how you feel now?”
text: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: “Nimependa wazo hilo, twende tukamuone Jumamosi. Je, uko tayari kuniambia zaidi kuhusu jinsi unavyohisi sasa?”
note: The string @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: “I honestly feel angry that she left. Is it okay to say that?”
text: @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: “Kwa kweli nimeshikwa na hasira kwa sababu aliondoka. Je, ni sawa kusema hivyo?”
note: The string @global.w_grief_teen_girl_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: “Yes, it is normal to feel angry. We all have different feelings at different times, and that is okay. It is good to talk about this together, thank you for sharing with me.”
text: @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: "Ndio, ni kawaida kuwa na hasira. Sisi sote tuna hisia tofauti kwa nyakati tofauti, na hiyo ni kawaida. Ni vizuri kuzungumza juu ya hili pamoja, asante kwa kunishirikisha."
note: The string @global.w_grief_male_caregiver_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: Busy day
text: Siku yenye shughuli nyingi

SourceText:
Caregivers and teens who spend time together are more likely to have happy and healthy relationships. But spending time together is not always easy. Sometimes we can both get angry, get annoyed and argue or fight. 

Let’s take a look at an example:
text:
Walezi na vijana wanaotumia muda pamoja wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuwa na mahusiano yenye furaha na afya. Lakini kutumia muda pamoja si rahisi kila wakati. Wakati fulani sote tunaweza kukasirika, kuudhika na kugombana au kupigana.

Tuangalie mfano huu:

SourceText:
@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1: “@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1, why did you not cook dinner yet?! Why do I always have to do everything myself?”

@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: “That is not fair, I looked after @global.w_learn_girl_1 and washed all the school clothes already! All you do is complain!”
@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: “Get out of my way!”
text: @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: "Ondoka mbele yangu!"
note: The string @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: should not be translated.

SourceText: When you are ready
text: Ukiwa tayari

SourceText: Let’s go back in time and see what happens when @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 does things differently:
text: Hebu turudi nyuma tuone kitakachotokea wakati @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 anapofanya mambo kwa njia tofauti:
note: The string @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 should not be translated.

SourceText:
One afternoon, @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 is looking after her younger sibling @global.w_learn_girl_1. 

@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 (thinking): “It has been such a hard day at school… I can’t wait for @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 to come home so I can tell her about it.”
text:
Siku moja mchana, @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 alimtazama mdogo wake @global.w_learn_girl_1.

@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1 (akifikiria): "Imekuwa siku ngumu sana shuleni… Siwezi kungoja @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 arudi nyumbani ili nimwambie kuhusu jambo hilo."

SourceText:
@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 comes home late.

@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 (thinking): “I am so exhausted.”
text:
@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 huchelewa kurudi nyumbani.

@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1 (akiwaza): "Nimechoka."

SourceText:
@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1: “Hi everyone, I am so glad to see you! @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1, thank you for looking after your sister and washing the school clothes. I am going to wash my hands, and then we can cook together and you can tell me about your day.”

@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: “Thank you, @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1, you can call me when you are ready.”
text:
@global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1: “Hamjambo, nimefurahi sana kuwaona! @global.w_learn_teen_girl_1, asante kwa kumwangalia dada yenu na kufua nguo za shule. Naenda kunawa mikono, nakuja tupike pamoja na unaweza kunieleza kuhusu siku yako.”

@global.w_learn_teen_girl_1: “Asante, @global.w_learn_female_caregiver_1, unaweza kuniita ukiwa tayari.”

SourceText: Practice
text: Mazoezi

SourceText: Find a chair and pretend it is the attacker. Practise saying/doing these responses:
text: Chukua kiti na igiza kama kiti ndiyo mvamizi. Igiza ukisema/kufanya majibu haya:

SourceText: Yell
text: Piga kelele

SourceText: “No!”
text: "Hapana!"

SourceText: Call for help
text: Ita msaada

SourceText: “Someone help me!”
text: "Jamani nisaidieni"

SourceText: Warn of consequences
text: Tahadharisha kuhusiana na matokeo

SourceText: “I will call the police if you touch me again.”
text: "Nitaita polisi kama ukinishika tena"

SourceText: Name the behaviour
text: Taja tabia

SourceText: "Do not touch my bum.” or “Do not yell at me.”
text: " Usishike matako yangu." au "Usinifokee."

SourceText: Act crazy
text: Anajitoa ufaamu

SourceText: Make a crazy scream or act like a gorilla!
text: Anapiga kelele kama kichaa na anaigiza kama sokwe!

SourceText: Pretend to go along to buy time
text: Jifanye kushriki ili kupoteza muda

SourceText: “I will do anything you want, just please don’t hurt me.”
text: "Nitafanya chochote unachotaka, tafadhali usinidhuru."

SourceText: Use humour
text: Tumia vichekesho

SourceText: “No lift for me, thanks. Last time I got a lift I threw up EVERYWHERE!”
text: "Hakuna lifti kwa ajili yangu, asante. Mara ya mwisho nilipopata lifti nilitapika kila mahali!"

SourceText: Give something to get what you want
text: Toa kitu ili upate kile unachotaka

SourceText: “I will give you my phone if you let me go.”
text: "Nitakupa simu yangu ikiwa utaniruhusu niende."

SourceText: First targets
text: Malengo ya kwanza

SourceText: Eyes
text: Macho

SourceText:
Use your fingers as claws and scratch the attacker’s face as hard as possible. 

Push your thumbs into the eye sockets of your attacker and then outward towards the sides of their head.
text:
Tumia kucha za vidole vyako na kwaruza uso wa mshambuliaji kwa bidii iwezekanavyo. 

Ingiza kidole gumba kwenye tundu la jicho la mshambuliaji wako sukuma jicho kama linatoka nje na kwenda pembeni.

SourceText: Throat
text: Koo

SourceText:
Push your finger into the hole at the bottom of the attacker’s throat. 

Punch the throat with your fist or back of your elbow.
text:
Sukuma kidole chako kwenye shimo chini ya koo la mshambuliaji. 

Piga koo lake kwa ngumi au tumia kiwiko chako.

SourceText: Groin
text: Sehemu za siri

SourceText:
Kick the attacker’s groin with your knee, or punch it with your fist or elbow.

Grab, squeeze, twist and pull the attacker’s testicles with your hand.
text:
Mpige mvamizi sehemu za siri kwa kutumia goti, au piga eneo hilo kwa kutumia ngumi au kiwiko.

Kamata, sukuma, tingisha na vuta korodani za mvamiza kwa kutumia mkono wako.

SourceText: Knees
text: Magoti

SourceText: Kick against your attacker’s knee with your foot.
text: Piga goti ya mvamizi kwa kutumia mguu wako.

SourceText: Second targets
text: Eneo la pili

SourceText: Temples
text: Sehemu za pembeni za kichwa

SourceText: Punch the attacker’s temples with your fist or the back of your elbow.
text: Piga sehemu za pembeni za kichwa kuwa kutumia ngumi au kwa kutumia kiwiko.

SourceText: Nose
text: Pua

SourceText: Punch the attacker’s nose with your fist or the back of your elbow.
text: Piga pua ya mvamizi kwa kutumia ngumi au kiwiko.

SourceText: Ears
text: Masikio

SourceText: With flat hands, smack the attacker’s ears from both sides as hard as possible. You can also pull or twist them.
text: Kwa kutumia viganja, mpige mvamizi masikio pande zote mbili kwa nguvu kadri iwezekanavyo. Unaweza kumvuta au kuyaviringinya.

SourceText: Ribs
text: Mbavu

SourceText: Punch the attacker in the ribs with your fist or the back of your elbow.
text: Piga sehemu za pembeni za kichwa kuwa kutumia ngumi au kwa kutumia kiwiko.

SourceText: Fingers
text: Vidole

SourceText: Pull the attackers pinky or little finger away from the other fingers hard and fast (it breaks easily).
text: Vuta kidole cha mwisho cha wavamizi au kidole kidogo mbali na vidole vingine kwa bidii na haraka (kinavunjika kwa urahisi).

SourceText: Shins
text: Ugoko

SourceText: Kick against the attacker’s shins as hard as you can.
text: Piga sehemu ya mguu ya mvamizi kwa nguvu kadri uwezavyo.

SourceText: Top of feet
text: Juu ya mguu

SourceText: Lift your foot and stomp your heel on the top of your attacker’s foot.
text: Inua mguu wako na ukanyage kisigino chako juu ya mguu wa mvamizi wako.

SourceText: Examples
text: Mifano

SourceText: Here are some examples of how you can use the weak spots or targets on your attacker’s body.
text: Hii hapa ni baadhi ya mifano ya jinsi unavyoweza kutumia maeneo dhaifu au shabaha kwenye mwili wa mvamizi wako.

SourceText: It is hard to find time to do something nice with your teenager.
text: Ni ngumu kupata muda wa kufanya kitu kizuri na kijana wako.

SourceText: How many times in the past month did you get involved in activities that your teen likes?
text: Ni mara ngapi kwa mwezi uliopita ulijihusisha na shughuli ambazo kijana wako anapenda?

SourceText: In our busy lives it is hard to focus on the positive.
text: Katika maisha yetu yenye shughuli nyingi ni vigumu kuzingatia mambo chanya.

SourceText: How many times in the past month have you praised your teen?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita ulimsifia kijana wako?

SourceText: Being a parent can be stressful.
text: Kuwa mzazi inaweza ikaleta mfadhaiko.

SourceText: How many times in the past month did caring for your children make you feel very stressed?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita kuwajali watoto wako kulikufanya uhisi mfadhaiko?

SourceText: There are days in our lives where we feel sad and down, and days where we feel happy.
text: Kuna siku maishani mwetu tunahisi huzuni na tunakuwa wanyonge na kunasiku ambazo tunahisi furaha.

SourceText: How many days in the past week have you felt depressed?
text: Ni siku ngapi katika wiki iliyopita umehisi sonona?

SourceText: How many days in the past week have you felt that everything you did was an effort?
text: Ni siku ngapi katika wiki iliyopita ulihisi kuwa kila kitu ulichofanya ulitumia jitihada?

SourceText: How many days in the past week have you felt hopeful for the future?
text: Ni siku ngapi katika wiki iliyopita ulikuwa na matumaini kwa ajili ya wakati ujao?

SourceText: Days in the past week
text: Siku za wiki iliyopita

SourceText: Sometimes our children make us really upset.
text: Wakati mwingine watoto wetu hutukasirisha sana.

SourceText: How many times in the past month did you shout, scream or yell at your teen?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita umempayukia, umepigia kelele au kumfokea kijana wako?

SourceText: How many times in the past month did you insult your teen or call them names or stupid?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita ulimtukana kijana wako au kumuita mjinga au majina mabaya?

SourceText: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families.
text: Pesa ni miongoni mwa vyanzo vikubwa zaidi vya msongo wa mawazo katika familia.

SourceText: How many times in the past month have you felt worried or anxious about money?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita ulihisi wasiwasi au uwoga kuhusu fedha?

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food?
text: Je, ni siku ngapi katika mwezi uliopita (siku 30) ulikosa pesa za kununulia chakula?

SourceText: Days in the past month
text: Siku katika mwezi uliopita

SourceText: Families also have difficult experiences like sickness and losing loved ones.
text: Familia pia hupitia wakati mgumu kama ugonjwa na kupoteza wapendwa wao.

SourceText: Has a caregiver of your teen (like a parent or grandparent) ever passed away?
text: Je kuna mlezi wa kijana wako (kama mzazi au bibi/babu) ambae amefariki?

SourceText: Did they pass away in the last 3 years?
text: Je alifariki katika kipindi cha miaka mitatu iliyopita?

SourceText: It is so stressful when children misbehave.
text: Watoto wanapokuwa na tabia mbaya wanaleta msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: How many times in the past month did you physically discipline your teen by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or belt?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita ulimpatia mwanao adhabu za mwilini kwa kumpiga, kumchapa makalioni au kumpiga kofi au na kitu kama fimbo au mkanda?

SourceText: How many times in the past month did you discipline your teen with a push or grab?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika wiki iliyopita ulimuadhibu kwa kumsukuma au kumkamata kwa nguvu?

SourceText: It is hard to keep track of our teenagers when they are becoming more independent.
text: Ni ngumu kuwafuatilia vijana wetu pale wanapoanza kujitegemea.

SourceText: How many times in the past month did your teen stay out in the evening past the time that they are supposed to be home?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita, kijana wako alikaa nje mida ya jioni zaidi ya muda anaotakiwa kuwepo nyumbani?

SourceText: How many times in the past month did your teen go out with friends you do not know?
text: Je, ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita, kijana wako alitoka na marafiki usiowajua?

SourceText: How many times in the past month did your teen not let you know where they were going?
text: Je, mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita kijana wako hakukuambia wapi wanapoenda?

SourceText: Sometimes teenagers are hard to talk to.
text: Muda mwingine ni vigumu kuongea na vijana.

SourceText: Have you ever talked with your teen about ways to avoid being touched or made to do sexual things with people or online?
text: Uliwahi kuongea na kijana wako kuhusiana na njia za kuzuia kushikwa au kulazimishwa kufanya matendo ya kingono na watu au mitandaoni?

SourceText: Well done for talking to your teen about keeping safe.
text: Vizuri kwa kuongea na kijana wako kuhusu kujiweka salama.

SourceText: How many times in the last month have you had a talk like this?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita mliweza kuwa na maongezi kama haya?

SourceText: How many times in the past month has your teen walked home alone, taken a lift with someone they do not know or hung out in a place that made you worried for their safety?
text: Ni mara ngapi katika mwezi uliopita kijana wako alirudi nyumbani akiwa peke yake, kupewa lifti na mtu asiyemjua au kwenda sehemu iliokufanya uwe na mashaka juu ya usalama wao?

SourceText: Times in the past month
text: Nyakati katika mwezi uliopita

SourceText: It can sometimes be difficult to have a positive relationship with our children.
text: Wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kuwa na mahusiano chanya na watoto wetu.

SourceText: How confident do you feel about your ability as a parent/caregiver to have a positive relationship with your children?
text: Kwa kiwango gani unajiamini kuhusu uwezo wako kama mzazi/mlezi katika kujenga mahusiano chanya na watoto wako?

SourceText: Spending time with your teen is not always easy. You’ll find ideas about how to do this in the @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. You can also find information in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Kutumia muda na kijana wako daima sio rahisi  . Unaweza kupata vidokezo ya namna ya kufanya hivi kupitia @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. Unaweza kutafuta taarifa katika @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Well done! You’ll find more ideas about how to do this in  the @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title.
text: Vizuri! Utakuta namna nyingi zaidi kuhusu jinsi ya kufanya hizi kupitia @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. should not be translated.

SourceText: It’s not always easy to praise. You’ll learn more about this skill in the @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title. If you want help right away, you can find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Sio rahisi kusifia kila mara. Utajifunza ujuzi huu kupitia @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title. Ikiwa unataka msaada wa papo kwa hapo, unaweza ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Wonderful that you are praising your teen! This helps them feel valued.
text: Vizuri kuwa unawasifia vijana wako. Hii itasaidia wajihisi wanathaminiwa.

SourceText: Great job managing your stress. You'll learn more about how to relax, recognise and reward yourself in the @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title.
text: Kazi nzuri katika kudhibiti mafadhaiko yako. Utajifunza zaidi jinsi ya kutulia, kutambua na kujipongeza ndani ya @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title. should not be translated.

SourceText: Life can definitely get stressful. You'll learn more about taking care of yourself well in the @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title and about managing stress in the @data.workshop.w_stress.in_text_title. If you want help right away, you can find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Maisha yanaweza yakawa ya mafadhaiko. Utajifunza zaidi namna ya kujithamini vizuri ndani ya @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title. Kama ukihitaji msaada wa papo kwa hapo unaweza ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Thank you for answering these questions. When life gets difficult, it’s easy to forget about the good. You are the best parent your teen could have!
text: Nashukuru kwa kujibu haya maswali. Maisha yanapokuwa magumu, ni rahisi kusahau mazuri. Wewe ni mzazi mzuri kijana wako anayeweza kuwa nae!

SourceText: Well done for controlling your anger. You'll learn more about how to respond calmly in the @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title.
text: Vizuri sana kwa kudhibiti hasira yako. Utajifunza zaidi jinsi ya kujibu kwa utulivu ndani ya @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_self_care.in_text_title. should not be translated.

SourceText: All parents use certain methods to teach children how to behave. Sometimes our children make us really angry or upset and we do things we wish we hadn’t.  You’ll learn more effective methods to respond to your teen and help them behave well in the @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title. If you want help right away, you can also find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Wazazi wote hutumia njia flani kuwafundisha watoto namna tabia zao zinapaswa kuwa. Wakati mwengine watoto wetu hutukasirisha sana na tunafanya vitu tunatamani tusingefanya. Utajifunza njia zenye matokeo za kukabiliana na kijana wako na kumsaidia kuwa na tabia njema ndani ya @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title. Ikiwa unahitaji msaada wa papo kwa hapo unaweza pia ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Money stress can affect any family. You can learn more about budgeting in the @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title to help with money stress and reduce money-related arguments.
text: Mfadhaiko wa kifedha unaweza kuathiri familia yoyote. Unaweza ukajifunza zaidi kuhusu kubajeti ndani ya @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title kusaidia na mfadhaiko wa kifedha na kupunguza ugomvi unaohusiana na maswala ya kifedha.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: Money stress can be overwhelming. The @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title includes information that will help with budgeting. If you want help right away, you can also find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Mafadhaiko ya kifedha yanaweza kukusonga. @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title inajumuisha taarifa ambazo zitakusaidia na kubajeti. Ikiwa unahitaji msaada wa papo kwa hapo unaweza pia ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Losing loved ones is hard. You can find ways to help you and your teen cope with grief in @data.parent_centre.bereavement.location_text.
text: Kuwapoteza wapendwa ni ngumu. Unaweza ukapata njia za kukusaidia wewe na kijana wako kukabiliana na majonzi @data.parent_centre.bereavement.location_text.
note: The string @data.parent_centre.bereavement.location_text. should not be translated.

SourceText: It is wonderful that you are responding calmly when your teen does something upsetting. They can learn so much from you!
text: Inafurahisha sana kuona unajibu kwa utulivu licha ya kijana wako kufanya jambo la kufadhaisha. Anaweza kujifunza mambo mengi sana kutoka kwako!

SourceText: We all feel overwhelmed sometimes. The information in the @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title will help you feel less stressed and show you effective ways to teach your children the right behaviour. If you want help right away, you can also find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Muda mwingine sote tunahisi kuzidiwa. Taarifa ndani ya @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title itakusaidia kupunguza mfadhaiko na kuonyesha njia bora ya kumfundisha kijana wako tabia njema. Kama unahitaji msaada wa papo kwa hapo, unaweza pia ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: Great job keeping your teen safe. You’ll learn more about this in the @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title.
text: Ni kazi nzuri kumuweka kijana wako salama. Utajifunza zaidi kuhusu hili ndani ya @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title. should not be translated.

SourceText: Keeping track of our teens is not easy. Information in the @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title will support with building communication and keeping your teen safe. If you want help right away, you can also find it in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.
text: Kuwafuatilia vijana wetu si kazi rahisi. Taarifa ndani ya @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title itakusaidia kujenga mahusiano na kumuweka kijana wako salama. Ukihitaji msaada wa papo kwa hapo, unaweza ukaupata ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text.

SourceText: It can be difficult to know how to keep our teens safe. We often feel powerless as parents. You can get essential tools to help with safety planning in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text at any time.
text: Ni vigumu kujua namna ya kuweka vijana wetu salama. Mara nyingi wazazi tunahisi hatuna nguvu. Unaweza pata nyenzo muhimu kukusaidia kupanga usalama ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text muda wowote.
note: The string @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text should not be translated.

SourceText: It can be hard to know what your teen is doing and parents worry about their safety. You can get essential tools to help with safety planning in @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text at any time.
text: Ni vigumu kujua namna ya kuweka vijana wetu salama. Mara nyingi wazazi tunahisi hatuna nguvu. Unaweza pata nyenzo muhimu kukusaidia kupanga usalama ndani ya @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text muda wowote.
note: The string @data.parent_centre.my_tips.location_text should not be translated.

SourceText: How to do self-care
text: Jinsi ya kujithamini

SourceText: RELAX
text: Chukua pumziko

SourceText: Do a 30 second quick relaxation activity.
text: Fanya shughuli ya kuchukua pumziko ya haraka kwa sekunde 30.

SourceText: Relax activity
text: Shughuli ya kujiburudisha

SourceText: RECOGNISE
text: TAMBUA

SourceText: Take a moment and think of one thing YOU have done recently that you have done well! Say it aloud if you can: "Well done for …"
text: Fikiria jambo moja ambalo WEWE umelifanya vizuri hivi karibuni! Sema kwa sauti kama unaweza: "Ninajipongeza kwa…"

SourceText: Recognise activity
text: Shughuli ya kujitambua

SourceText: REWARD
text: TUZO

SourceText: Remember, you deserve your quality time too! What makes you happy?
text: Kumbuka, unastahili pia kuwa na wakati bora! Ni nini kinachokufurahisha?

SourceText: Reward activity
text: Shughuli ya kujipongeza

SourceText: One-on-one time with your teen can be fun for you, too! It might even make you feel less stressed.
text: Muda wa pamoja na kijana wako mkiwa wawili unaweza kukufurahisha wewe pia! Unaweza hata kukupunguzia msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: How to spend one-on-one time
text: Jinsi ya kutumia muda wa pamoja wawili

SourceText: DAY
text: SIKU

SourceText:
Try to do it every day. 

Find 5 minutes (or more!) each day when your teen does not have something else they want to do.
text:
Jaribu kufanya hivi kila siku.

Tafuta dakika 5 (au zaidi!) kila siku wakati kijana wako hana kitu kingine anachotaka kufanya.

SourceText: PLAY
text: CHEZA

SourceText:
Let your teen choose. 

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but will come to enjoy this time with you!
text:
Muache kijana wako achague.

Mwambie kijana wako kwamba ungependa kutumia muda pamoja naye na kwamba anaweza kuchagua cha kufanya au cha kuzungumzia. Mwanzoni, anaweza kuona kuwa hili ni jambo la ajabu, lakini baadaye atafurahia muda huu wa kuwa na wewe!

SourceText: STAY
text: KAA

SourceText:
Focus on your teen. 

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.
text:
Weka umakini kwa kijana wako.

Zima runinga na weka simu kando. Mtazame kijana wako. Fanya ishara kwa kichwa au sema "ndiyo" ili kuonyesha kuwa unampa mkazo. Kubali anachosema bila kumhukumu.

SourceText: How to praise
text: Jinsi ya kusifia

SourceText: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good, and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Tafuta kitu chochote anachofanya kijana wako kwa ajili ya kusaidia au kilicho kizuri, na umsifie kwa kitu hicho. Anaweza asioneshe furaha yake, lakini utamwona akifanya tena kitu hicho kizuri. Pia itamthibitishia kuwa unatambua anachokifanya na unajali.

SourceText: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
text: Onyesha shauku – unaposema jambo, liseme kwa moyo wa dhati!

SourceText: REPEAT IT
text: RUDIA

SourceText: Try to find something to thank them for every day. Even something really small.
text: Jaribu kutafuta kitu cha kukufanya umshukuru kila siku. Hata kitu kidogo sana.

SourceText: You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text: Unaweza pia kuwasifia watu wazima wengine kwenye kaya yako. Chunguza mwitikio utakavyokuwa!

SourceText: How to give positive instructions
text: Jinsi ya kutoa maelekezo chanya

SourceText: GET REAL
text: KUWA HALISI

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.
text: Je, kijana wako anaweza kweli kufanya kile unachotaka kumwambia? Inaweza kuwa vigumu kwao kusoma kimya kwa siku nzima, lakini ukimwambia afanye hivyo kwa nusu saa unapohitaji sana afanye hivyo, ni jambo linalotekelezeka.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: KUWA NA MTAZAMO CHANYA

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye, and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Tabasamu, mwangalie machoni, na tumia maneno chanya. Msifie mara tu anapoanza kufanya kile unachotaka!

SourceText: GET CLEAR
text: KUWA WAZI

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we don’t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try ‘please come home by 7pm’ instead of ‘come home in time’.
text: Mara nyingi tunajua nafsini mwetu kile tunachokitaka, lakini hakitusemi bayana kiasi cha kueleweka. Sema kile unachotaka kuona kijana wako akifanye. Jaribu kusema 'tafadhali, ifikapo saa 1 jioni uwe tayari umerudi nyumbani' badala ya kusema 'uwahi kurudi nyumbani'.

SourceText: How to manage stress
text: Jinsi ya kudhibiti msongo wa mawazo

SourceText:
Breathe. Slowly. Pause. 

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
text:
Vuta pumzi. Taratibu. Tulia.

Kabla ya kusema chochote, vuta pumzi polepole na kuzishusha mara tano. Kufanya hivyo kutakutuliza, na kukupa nafasi ya kufikiria.

SourceText:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
text:
Shirikisha namna unahisi.

Hili ni jambo gumu. Wengi wetu tuliambiwa tusilie, au kuonesha hisia zetu kwa watoto wetu. Lakini vuta pumzi ndefu na uwaambie kwa utulivu jinsi unavyohisi. Wataelewa vizuri, na pia watajifunza kutoka kwako jinsi ya kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: SHOW
text: ONESHA

SourceText:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
text:
Waonyeshe unajali.

Hili pia ni jambo gumu! Msongo wa mawazo hutufanya tujiangalie sisi wenyewe. Lakini vijana wetu wanahitaji msaada wetu. Waulize wanajisikiaje. Wasikilize na uwafariji. Jaribu kuwakumbatia au sema "Ninaelewa". Kufanya hivyo kunaweza kubadilisha kila kitu.

SourceText: SEEK
text: TAFUTA

SourceText:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
text:
Tafuta kitu chanya.

Je, wewe na kijana wako mnaweza kufikiria mawazo yanayoweza kusaidia? Je, mnaweza kufanya pamoja kitu chanya ili kuhamisha mawazo yako kutoka kwenye msongo wa mawazo?

SourceText: If all else fails, breathe. You can do this.
text: Kama mengine yote hayatafaulu, vuta pumzi. Unao uwezo wa kulishinda hili.

SourceText: How to solve problems
text: Jinsi ya kutatua matatizo

SourceText: Take a few deep breaths to calm down, and
text: Vuta pumzi ndefu mara kadhaa upate kutulia, kisha

SourceText: Identify the problem.
text: Bainisha tatizo.

SourceText: SOLVE IT
text: TAFUTA UTATUZI

SourceText: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
text: Fikiria njia za utatuzi zinazowezekana na kile kitakachotokea kama tutazitumia.

SourceText: TRY IT
text: JARIBU

SourceText: Choose a solution and try it out.
text: Chagua njia ya utatuzi na uijaribu.

SourceText: TEST IT
text: JARIBU

SourceText: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.
text: Je, imefanikiwa? Safi sana! Kama haikufanikiwa, basi jaribu njia nyingine ya utatuzi.

SourceText: How to budget & save
text: Jinsi ya kutengeneza bajeti & kuweka akiba

SourceText: STEP 1: THINK
text: HATUA YA 1: FIKIRIA

SourceText: What do we spend on now?
text: Kwa sasa tunatumia pesa kwenye mambo gani?

SourceText: Think Activity
text: Shughuli ya kufikiri

SourceText: STEP 2: CHOOSE
text: HATUA YA 2: CHAGUA

SourceText: Talk together about needs and wants.
text: Zungumzeni pamoja kuhusu mahitaji na matamanio.

SourceText: Choose Activity
text: Chagua Shughuli

SourceText: STEP 3: BUILD
text: HATUA YA 3: JENGA

SourceText: Make your own budget.
text: Tengeneza bajeti yako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Build Activity
text: Shughuli ya Kufikiri

SourceText: STEP 4: PLAN
text: HATUA YA 4: PANGA

SourceText: Emergencies and family goals.
text: Dharura na malengo ya familia.

SourceText: Plan Activity
text: Panga Shughuli

SourceText: How to create rules
text: Jinsi ya kuunda sheria

SourceText: TEAM RULES
text: SHERIA ZA KIKUNDI

SourceText: Household rules help keep our teenagers safe, and understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
text: Sheria za kaya husaidia kuwaweka vijana wetu salama, na kuelewa kinachotarajiwa kutoka kwao. Unapomhusisha kijana katika kutengeneza sheria, anakuwa na uwezekano mkubwa wa kuzifuata.

SourceText: REAL RULES
text: SHERIA ZINAZOTEKELEZEKA

SourceText: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first – you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.
text: Panga sheria PAMOJA NA kijana wako. Anza kwanza na sheria mpya moja – unaweza kuongeza nyingine baadaye. Jadilini sababu za kuweka sheria na usikilize maoni yake.

SourceText: PRAISE RULES!
text: SHERIA ZA USIFIAJI!

SourceText: Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it!
text: Msifie kijana wako kwa kuweka sheria pamoja na wewe, na msifie kwa kuifuata!

SourceText: How to give calm consequences
text: Jinsi ya kuamuru athari nyepesi zifanywe

SourceText: How you introduce calm consequences is important. Remember, when you involve your teen, things usually go better!
text: Jinsi unavyoweka athari ni jambo muhimu. Kumbuka, unapomhusisha kijana wako, kwa kawaida mambo huenda vizuri!

SourceText: EXPLAIN
text: ELEZA

SourceText:
Check you are both calm. Take a few breaths. Explain to your teen why you are concerned about their behaviour.

Explain the reasons why the rule mattered. You can share your feelings – it is okay to say you are disappointed.
text:
Hakikisha nyote wawili mmetulia. Vuta pumzi mara kadhaa. Mweleze kijana wako kwa nini una wasiwasi na tabia zake.

Eleza kwa nini sheria hiyo ilikuwa muhimu. Unaweza kumshirikisha hisia zako – si vibaya kusema umesikitika.

SourceText: AGREE
text: KUBALI

SourceText:
Plan consequences with your teen for following and not following the rule.

Ask for their ideas. Talk until you agree on something realistic.

Make a consequence for NOT following the rule and a privilege when they DO follow the rule.
text:
Panga na kijana wako athari za kufuata sheria na kutofuata sheria.

Mwombe atoe maoni yake. Zungumzeni hadi mtakapokubaliana kuhusu kitu halisi.

Weka athari za KUTOFUATA sheria na upendeleo pindi WANAPOFUATA sheria.

SourceText: ACT
text: TENDA

SourceText:
**When your teen follows the rule, give praise and privileges!**
They will feel respected and valued. Remember: The more we praise them, the more they will show that good behaviour!

**When your teen does not follow the rule, follow through with the consequence.**
When your teen breaks the rule, calmly give the consequence. This should be FAIR (not too harsh), IMMEDIATE (do it straight away), CONSISTENT (same every time).
text:
**Kijana wako anapofuata sheria, mpe sifa na upendelea!**
Watajisikia kuheshimiwa na kuthaminiwa. Kumbuka: Kadiri tunavyowasifu, ndivyo watakavyoonyesha tabia hiyo njema!

**Wakati kijana wako hafuati sheria, fuata adhabu yake.**
Wakati kijana wako anavunja sheria, toa adhabu kwa utulivu. Hii inapaswa kuwa HAKI (sio kali sana), HARAKA (ifanye mara moja), THABITI (sawa kila wakati).

SourceText: How to keep your teen safe
text: Jinsi ya kumweka salama kijana wako

SourceText: MAPS
text: RAMANI

SourceText: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.
text: Tengeneza ramani na kijana wako juu ya maeneo salama na yasiyo salama kwenye jamii yenu na mtandaoni. Zungumzieni jinsi ya kuweka taarifa zao, picha na video zake ziwe za faragha mtandaoni. Zungumzieni jinsi ambavyo kitu kikishawekwa mtandaoni, kitakaa hapo daima. Wanaweza kujua mfano kutoka kwa marafiki zao.

SourceText: Safety Plan Activity
text: Shughuli ya Mpango wa Usalama

SourceText: RULES
text: SHERIA

SourceText:
Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided) and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like. 

Remember the story about Online Safety? See it again here.
text:
Tengeneza sheria na kijana wako kuhusu namna gani wanaweza kuwa salama katika jamii yako (hasa katika maeneo ya hatari ambayo hayawezi kuepukika) na namna wanaweza kutumia kwa usalama programu na mitandao ambayo wanapenda.

Unakumbuka hadithi kuhusu Usalama Mtandaoni? Angalia tena hapa.

SourceText: Online Safety Story
text: Hadithi ya Usalama Mtandaoni

SourceText: SAFETY WORD
text: NENO LA USALAMA

SourceText:
Agree on a @global.safety_word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the @global.safety_word  and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong. 

Remember the story about the @global.safety_word? See it again here.
text:
Kubaliana kuhusu @global.safety_word. Kama kitu kikitokea ambacho kitamfanya kijana wako akasirike, kukosa uhuru au kuogopa,  wanaweza kusema @global.safety_word na utawasaidia bila kukasirika au kuwaadhibu,  hataka kama walikuwa wanafanya kitu ambacho sio sahihi.

Kumbuka hadithi kuhusu @global.safety_word? Angalia tena hapa.

SourceText: @global.safety_word Story
text: Hadithi ya @global.safety_word
note: The string @global.safety_word should not be translated.

SourceText: Digital parenting is just like parenting in the real world. You have taken a BIG STEP to keeping your teen safe in the community AND online. Good for you!
text: Malezi yanayohusu masuala ya kidijitali ni sawa tu na malezi ya masuala mengine maishani. Umepiga HATUA KUBWA ya kumweka salama kijana wako katika jamii NA mtandaoni. Ni jambo zuri kwako!

SourceText: How to deal with crisis
text: Jinsi ya kushughulikia hali ya hatari

SourceText: Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think.
text: Mgogoro unaweza kutufanya tukasirike au tujione wanyonge. Lakini huo ndio wakati hasa ambao vijana wetu wanatuhitaji sisi. Tuvute pumzi, tusikilize na kufikiri.

SourceText: BREATHE
text: VUTA PUMZI

SourceText: Stay calm. Ask yourself "What does my teen need right now?"
text: Tulia. Jiulize "Kijana wangu anahitaji nini sasa hivi?"

SourceText: LISTEN
text: SIKILIZA

SourceText: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
text: Mwambie upo kwa ajili yake na mpende.

SourceText: THINK
text: FIKIRI

SourceText: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? You might need to make immediate plans now, and then long-term plans later.
text: Zungumza na kijana wako. Kitu gani kinaweza kusaidia kwenye hali hiyo? Unaweza kutakiwa kupanga mipango ya haraka sasa, halafu mipango ya muda mrefu baadaye.

SourceText: You can be proud of yourself for exploring ways to get help!
text: Jionee fahari kwa kutafuta njia za kupata msaada!

SourceText: How to support each other
text: Jinsi ya kusaidiana

SourceText: MEET
text: KUKUTANA

SourceText: Keep meeting regularly to give each other parenting support.
text: Endeleeni kukutana mara kwa mara ili kupeana msaada wa malezi.

SourceText: CALL
text: PIGIANA SIMU

SourceText: Be ‘parenting buddies’ to call when you are upset or do not know what to do.
text: Kuweni 'marafiki wa malezi' wanaopigiana simu pindi mmoja wenu anaposikitika au asipojua cha kufanya.

SourceText: TEXT
text: KUTUMIANA UJUMBE WA MAANDISHI

SourceText: Text each other every week to share what you have done well.
text: Tumianeni ujumbe wa maandishi kila wiki ili kushirikishana kile mlichofanya vizuri.

SourceText: SHARE
text: KUSHIRIKISHANA

SourceText: Share @global.parent_app and help other families start their journey.
text: Sambaza @global.parent_app ili usaidie familia nyingine kuanza safari yao.
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText: How to talk about sensitive topics
text: Namna ya kuzungumza kuhusu maada nyeti

SourceText: Discussing body changes and intimate relationships can be uncomfortable, but it is so important in order to keep your teen happy, healthy and safe.
text: Kujadili mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya karibu inaweza kuwa ngumu, lakini ni muhimu sana ili kuweka kijana wako mwenye furaha, afya na salama.

SourceText: BUILD
text: TENGENEZA

SourceText:
Build a strong relationship with your teen by spending time with them and showing them you trust them. Create a safe, encouraging space, and avoid judging them.

That will make your teen share their questions and worries with you, when they need advice or are in a potentially dangerous situation.
text:
Jenga uhusiano mzuri na kijana wako kwa kutumia muda pamoja naye na kuwaonyesha kuwa unamwamini. Unda nafasi salama, ya kutia moyo, na uepuke kuwahukumu.

Hilo litamfanya kijana wako ashiriki maswali na mahangaiko yake nawe, anapohitaji ushauri au yuko katika hali inayoweza kuwa hatari.

SourceText: START
text: ANZA

SourceText:
Your teen may feel scared, so as parents we need to start the conversation on body changes and intimate relationships.

Start young (before 9 years) by answering their questions in a simple and honest way. That builds your and your child’s confidence.

It is okay to feel uncomfortable. Be open, use the correct words, and get more information for yourself if you do not have all the answers.
text:
Kijana wako anaweza kuogopa, kwa hivyo kama wazazi tunahitaji kuanza mazungumzo juu ya mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

Anza mapema (kabla ya miaka 9) kwa kujibu maswali yao kwa njia rahisi na ya uaminifu. Hiyo hujenga kujiamini kwako na kwa mtoto wako.

Ni sawa kuwa na wasiwasi. Kuwa muwazi, tumia maneno sahihi, na tafuta maelezo zaidi ikiwa huna majibu yote.

SourceText: GUIDE
text: MWONGOZO

SourceText:
Your teen will get information about sex from many different sources. When they feel safe and comfortable with you, you can guide them and build their ability to find good information and solutions now and in the future.

Help them think about the consequences of behaviours (without shame or blame). Make sure they understand that they should never feel pressured (or pressure someone else) into any sexual activity or relationship.

Get help or information for yourself from other adults or medical professionals.
text:
Kijana wako atapata taarifa kuhusu ngono kutoka vyanzo mbalimbali. Wanapojisikia salama na kustarehe wakiwa na wewe, unaweza kuwaongoza na kuwajengea uwezo wa kupata taarifa nzuri na masuluhisho sasa na siku zijazo.

Wasaidie kufikiria juu ya matokeo ya tabia (bila aibu au lawama). Hakikisha wanaelewa kwamba hawapaswi kamwe kuhisi kushinikizwa (au kumshinikiza mtu mwingine) katika shughuli yoyote ya ngono au uhusiano.

Pata usaidizi au maelezo yako kutoka kwa watu wazima wengine au wataalamu wa matibabu.

SourceText: How to stay safe
text: Jinsi ya kukaa salama

SourceText: In a dangerous situation, we may not know what to do and freeze – this is normal. These tools can help you and your teen stay safe.
text: Katika hali ya hatari, hatuwezi kujua nini cha kufanya na kuganda - hii ni ya kawaida. Zana hizi zinaweza kukusaidia wewe na kijana wako kuwa salama.

SourceText: KNOW IT
text: FAHAMU

SourceText:
Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships. If you are attacked, know that it is never your fault. You are allowed to say and do what is needed to stay safe and get away – do not worry about what others may think.

You are worth defending. You are strong and powerful.
text:
Fahamu tofauti kati ya mahusiano yenye afya na yasiyofaa. Ukishashambuliwa ujue kuwa sio kosa lako kamwe. Unaruhusiwa kusema na kufanya kile kinachohitajika ili kuwa salama na kuondoka - usijali kuhusu kile ambacho wengine wanaweza kufikiria.

Unastahili kujitetea. Una uwezo na nguvu.

SourceText: SEE IT
text: ONA

SourceText:
When someone makes you (or someone else) feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, that is never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home.

See the warning signs and follow your feeling. When you feel attacked with words or actions, your goal is to get away.
text:
Mtu anapokufanya (au mtu mwingine) kujisikia kutoridhika na kile anachosema au kufanya, hiyo si sawa kamwe! Sote tuna haki ya kujisikia salama, hasa nyumbani.

Tazama ishara za onyo na ufuate hisia zako. Unapohisi kushambuliwa kwa maneno au vitendo, lengo lako ni kuondoka.

SourceText: SAY IT
text: SEMA

SourceText:
Your voice can stop many attacks. Yell ‘No!’, call for help, warn of consequences, name the behaviour, act crazy, pretend to go along to buy time, use humour, calm them down, or negotiate. 

Be clear, confident and direct. Speak using your voice, body language and eye contact.
text:
Sauti yako inaweza kuzuia mashambulizi mengi. Piga kelele ‘Hapana!’, omba usaidizi, onya kuhusu matokeo, taja tabia, jifanye kichaa, jifanye kushirikiana nae ili kupoteza muda, tumia ucheshi, watulize, au wajadiliane.

Kuwa wazi, ujasiri na moja kwa moja. Zungumza ukitumia sauti yako, lugha ya mwili na mguso wa macho.

SourceText: DO IT
text: IFANYE

SourceText:
When our voice is not changing the situation, we can use our bodies.

Know the ‘weapons’ on your body and know the ‘targets’ on your attacker’s body. Use what is free on your body that you can fight with and what is open on the attacker’s body to hit.
text:
Wakati sauti yetu haibadilishi hali, tunaweza kutumia miili yetu.

Jua 'silaha' kwenye mwili wako na ujue 'malengo' kwenye mwili wa mshambuliaji wako. Tumia kile ambacho ni bure kwenye mwili wako ambacho unaweza kupigana nacho na kilicho wazi kwenye mwili wa mshambuliaji kupiga.

SourceText:
If you as a teen or parent do get hurt by someone, remember it is never your fault. Ask someone you trust for help. 

As a parent, make sure your teen knows they can tell you anything, so you can find a solution together.
text:
Ikiwa wewe kama kijana au mzazi umeumizwa na mtu fulani, kumbuka kamwe si kosa lako. Uliza mtu unayemwamini akusaidie.

Kama mzazi, hakikisha kwamba kijana wako anajua kwamba anaweza kukuambia chochote, ili mpate suluhu pamoja.

SourceText: How to cope with grief
text: Jinsi ya kukabiliana na majonzi

SourceText: ACCEPT
text: KUBALI

SourceText:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. You do not have to feel better quickly, and there is no right or wrong way to grieve.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, not understand or not believe it, or feel unwell. They may have pains, nightmares, or problems at school. They may seem happy, but still feel sad. All of this is normal.
text:
Kumpoteza mtu tunayempenda kunaweza kutuathiri kwa wiki, miezi au miaka. Si lazima ujisikie vizuri haraka, na hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kuhuzunika.

Kijana wako anaweza kujisikia huzuni, hasira, asielewe au asiamini, au ajisikie vibaya. Wanaweza kuwa na maumivu, ndoto mbaya, au matatizo shuleni. Wanaweza kuonekana kuwa na furaha, lakini bado wanahisi huzuni. Yote haya ni ya kawaida.

SourceText: SAY GOODBYE
text: SEMA KWAHERI

SourceText:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.
text:
Tafuta njia ya kusema kwaheri inayokufaa wewe na familia yako. Baadhi ya watu hufanya sherehe au huandaa chakula maalum ili kumsherehekea mtu huyo.

Muulize kijana wako angependa kufanya nini ili kusema kwaheri.

SourceText: TALK
text: ONGEA

SourceText:
It can help just to talk about the person when you think about them or write down how you feel. Share your memories, the good ones and the difficult ones. 

Children may feel like the person’s death was their fault or that they behaved badly. Tell them clearly that they did nothing wrong. Explain that your teen can always tell you how they feel, and encourage them by also sharing how you feel.
text:
Inaweza kusaidia kuzungumza juu ya mtu endapo unawaza juu ya huyo mtu au kuandika jinsi unavyohisi. Shirikishana kumbukumbu zako, nzuri na ngumu.

Watoto wanaweza kuhisi kama kifo cha mtu huyo kilikuwa kosa lao au kwamba walifanya vibaya. Waambie wazi kwamba hawakufanya kosa lolote. Elezea kwamba kijana wako anaweza kukwambia kila mara jinsi anavyohisi, na umtie moyo kwa kuwaambia pia jinsi unavyohisi.

SourceText: How to help your teen learn
text: Jinsi ya kumsaidia kijana kujifunza

SourceText: GET TOGETHER
text: KUKUTANA PAMOJA

SourceText: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
text: Watu hujifunza vizuri zaidi wanapojifunza na wengine. Tumia wakati na kijana wako na waache wajifunze nawe. Mnapofanya shughuli pamoja, unawapa nafasi ya kujifunza, kufanya makosa na kukuuliza maswali.

SourceText: SUPPORT
text: MSAADA

SourceText: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them “learn how to learn”, because they feel safe with you.
text: Kijana wako atajifunza kutoka kwako ikiwa anajua unamuunga mkono. Waache wajaribu mambo na kuwa na subira kwao. Hii inawasaidia "jinsi ya kujifunza", kwa sababu wanahisi kuwa salama na wewe

SourceText: PRAISE
text: USIFIAJI

SourceText: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.
text: Kumsifu kijana wako ni njia nzuri ya kumsaidia kujaribu tena. Vijana hawafanyi mambo sawa mara ya kwanza na wanapaswa kujifunza jinsi ya kujaribu tena. Wasifu kwa kujaribu kufanya mambo, ili wajifunze kutokana na makosa yao.

SourceText:
We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent! 

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Mara nyingi hatujithamini vya kutosha. Lakini kufanya hivyo ni muhimu sana, hasa kwa mzazi!

Kupunguza msongo wa mawazo na kujithamini vizuri hutusaidia sisi PAMOJA NA vijana wetu.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is self-care.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves to learn the techniques for keeping ourselves calm, in case problems, challenges or issues come up.

When we are calm we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kujithamini wenyewe.

Kuna nyakati tunapata changamoto, tunakabiliwa na matatizo na hatujui cha kufanya. Ni muhimu kujithamini kwa kujifunza mbinu tunazoweza kuzitumia kuwa watulivu iwapo matatizo, changamoto au shida zitatokea.

Tunapokuwa watulivu, tunakuwa katika hali nzuri ya kufikiria vizuri na kupata ufumbuzi chanya wa changamoto zozote tunazoweza kukabiliwa nazo.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_self_care.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_self_care.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_self_care.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our children never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Kuwa mzazi ni kugumu sana. Wakati mwingine inaonekana kama watoto wetu hawatusikilizi kabisa.

Lakini sayansi inaonyesha kwamba kutumia dakika chache tu kila siku kutumia muda wa pamoja na kijana wako mkiwa wawili husaidia kujenga uaminifu na upendo.

SourceText:
One-on-one time is when you focus on them, without TV or phones. Let them lead what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can do twenty minutes a day, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Muda wa kuzungumza wawili ni ule ambao wewe unamzingatia yeye, bila kutazama runinga au kutumia simu. Hebu mruhusu aongoze kile mnachofanya au mnachozungumzia.

Ni jambo zuri zaidi kama utaweza kufanya hivyo kwa dakika ishirini kwa siku, lakini hata dakika tano kwa siku ni jambo zuri sana.

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.
text:
Habari!

Mada yetu ya leo inahusu kuzungumza na watoto wetu mkiwa wawili.

Ni muhimu kutumia muda tukiwa na watoto wetu ili waweze kutuelewa, na sisi kupata fursa ya kuwaelewa.

Kumbuka, familia inayoelewana vizuri huishi kwa utulivu.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
Kusifia ni ujuzi wenye nguvu katika malezi.

Kama tutawasifia vijana wetu wanapofanya jambo vizuri, tutawaona wakifanya mambo mazuri zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone. 

Our topic today is about praise. 

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see. 

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good too!
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada yetu ya leo inahusu kusifia.

Ni vizuri kuwasifia watoto wetu wanapofanya vizuri kwa sababu tunapofanya hivyo, watazidi kuifanya tabia nzuri tunayotaka kuiona.

Na tusisahau pia kujisifia sisi wenyewe tunapofanya mazuri!

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_praise.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_praise.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_praise.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Focus on the positive! 

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.

You will see the difference.
text:
Zingatia mambo chanya!

Kuwaambia vijana wetu kile hasa tunachotaka wafanye ni vizuri kuliko kuwakataza kufanya kitu.

Utaona mabadiliko.

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions. 

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do, and they do it the way we want them to do it. 

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Habari zenu?

Leo mada yetu inahusu maelekezo chanya.

Ni muhimu kutoa maelekezo chanya kwa watoto wetu, kwa sababu tunapowapa maelekezo chanya, wanajua na kuelewa kile tunachotarajia wakifanye, na wanakifanya kwa namna tunavyotaka wakifanye.

Kwa hiyo, mwishowe kila mtu hufurahi.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_instruct.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_instruct.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_instruct.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText: We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you – and your family.
text: Tunajua jinsi gani ni kazi kulea vijana katika nyakati hizi. Kujifunza kudhibiti msongo wako wa mawazo kunakusaidia wewe na familia yako.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone. 

Today's topic is managing stress. 

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too. 

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.
text:
Salamu kwa wote.

Kipindi cha leo ni kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo.

Ni muhimu kufahamu namna ya kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo. Wakati mwingine, watoto wetu wanaweza kuwa na tabia zikatufanya kuwa na mawazo na sisi kama wazazi tunaweza kuwafanya watoto wetu wawe na mawazo pia.

Kwa hiyo, ni muhimu kutambua wakati tunahisi mawazo kisha tutulie na kuvuta pumzi ndefu. Hii itakusaidia kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_stress.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_stress.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_stress.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way. 

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!
text:
