Kila familia hukabiliwa na changamoto, lakini tunapofanya kazi pamoja tunaweza kushughulikia matatizo kwa njia iliyo bora na ya amani.

Ni ujuzi mzuri sana kwa kijana wako pia kujifunza!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is problem solving. 

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions. 

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use. 

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kutatua matatizo.

Sote tunajua kuwa katika maisha kuna nyakati tunakabiliwa na matatizo, na sote tunajua kwamba tunapojikuta katika nyakati hizo, ni vigumu kufikiria haraka ufumbuzi chanya.

Kwa hiyo, tunapokabiliwa na matatizo ni muhimu tupumzike, tupumue, tutulie na tufikirie ujuzi wa kutatua matatizo tunaoweza kuutumia. 

Tunapotatua matatizo, tukumbuke kuwashirikisha vijana wetu. Kufanya hivyo kutawasaidia kuwajibika na kujifunza jinsi ya kutatua matatizo yao wenyewe siku zijazo.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_solve.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_solve.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_solve.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things! 

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our family’s goals.
text:
Familia nyingi zina msongo wa mawazo kutokana na pesa, hasa pale vijana wanapoendelea kuomba vitu!

Tunapotengeneza bajeti pamoja, tunaweza kukubaliana jinsi ya kufanya matumizi pamoja NA kuweka akiba ili kuzuia msongo wa mawazo na kutekeleza malengo ya familia zetu.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is family budgeting. 

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family. 

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family, and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kutengeneza bajeti ya familia.

Kutengeneza bajeti ni muhimu, lakini kutengeneza bajeti kwa kuhusisha familia nzima ni muhimu zaidi.

Kufanya hivyo pamoja husaidia kuongeza uelewa kuhusu jinsi mnavyotumia pesa kama familia na kiasi mnachoweka akiba kwa ajili ya familia, na mnaweza hata kubuni mipango ya kuweka akiba kama familia.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_money.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_money.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_money.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Rules help teens understand what is expected from them. 

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!
text:
Sheria huwasaidia vijana kuelewa wanachotakiwa kukifanya.

Vijana wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kufuata sheria kama mtaweka sheria hizo PAMOJA na kumsifia anapozifuata!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is rules. 

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members. 

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules. 

A household with family rules lives in peace.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu sheria.

Sheria huleta amani ndani ya kaya na maelewano miongoni mwa wanafamilia.

Sheria huleta uwajibikaji kwa kila mwanafamilia; kwa hiyo, ni muhimu kuwa na sheria za familia.

Kaya yenye sheria za familia huishi kwa amani.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_rules.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_rules.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_rules.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Our actions have consequences: Some consequences happen naturally (“if you break something, you can’t use it anymore”). Other consequences we set as a family to motivate us to follow the rules (“if you come home late, you can’t go out with friends tomorrow”).

HOW you set and use consequences together matters.

Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text:
Angalizo: Matendo yetu yana matokeo: Baadhi ya matokeo yanatokea kwa kawaida ("kama ukivunja kitu, huwezi kukitumia tena"). Adhabu nyepesi nyingine tunaweka kama familia kutuhamasisha kufuata sheria ("kama ukichelewa kurudi nyumbani, hautatoka na marafiki kesho"). 

JINSI mnavyoweka na kutumia adhabu kwa pamoja ni muhimu.

Kuweka adhabu sahihi inasaidia kijana kuwa na tabia njema na kufanya maisha ya familia kuwa na utulivu.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist in us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Habari, kila mmoja.

Maada ya leo ni adhabu tulivu.

Ni muhimu kwamba tunapotambulisha adhabu kwa vijana wetu tuwahusishe, lakini pia ni muhimu kwamba sisi ni watulivu tunapotambulisha adhabu.

Hiyo itatusaidia kukubaliana kwenye kutambulisha adhabu tulivu kwa vijana wetu na vijana wetu watazikumbuka kirahisi wakiwa wameshirikishwa na kwamba itawafanya kuwa wawajibikaji.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_consequence.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_consequence.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_consequence.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
Teens can spend a lot of time outside the house or online, where it is harder for us to keep them safe. 

Talking together about safe and unsafe places, and how to prevent problems, really helps!
text:
Vijana wanaweza kutumia muda mwingi nje ya nyumba au mtandaoni, ambako ni vigumu kwetu kuwaweka salama.

Kuzungumza pamoja kuhusu maeneo salama na yasiyo salama, na jinsi ya kuzuia matatizo, husaidia sana!

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today our topic is teen safety. 

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities. 

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.
text:
Habari zenu?

Leo mada yetu inahusu usalama wa vijana.

Kama wazazi, ni jukumu letu kuwaweka salama vijana wetu wakati wote. Tunahitaji kuhakikisha kuwa vijana wetu wako salama katika jamii tunazoishi. Ni jukumu letu kuwafahamisha maeneo salama na yasiyo salama katika jamii hizo.

Pia ni jukumu letu kuhakikisha kwamba wanaelewa hatari zinazoweza kuwakabili wanapokuwa mtandaoni. Kwa njia hiyo, vijana wetu watawajibika na wataweza kufanya maamuzi sahihi ya kujiweka salama.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_safe.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_safe.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_safe.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText: All families experience crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help BEFORE something bad happens, we can overcome any crisis.
text: Kila familia hukabiliwa na hali ya hatari. Tunapojiandaa pamoja na kujua mahali pa kupata msaada KABLA ya kutokea kwa jambo baya, tunaweza kuishinda hali yoyote ya hatari.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crises may occur anywhere. Crises may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation. 

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected. 

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe, and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kushughulikia hali ya hatari.

Hali ya hatari inaweza kutokea mahali popote. Hali ya hatari inaweza kutokea wakati wowote. Kwa hiyo, kama familia, ni muhimu kuwa na mipango ya kukabiliana na hatari kwa ajili ya mwanafamilia yeyote atakayejikuta kwenye hali ya hatari.

Ni muhimu kuwa na mipango ili kila mwanafamilia ahisi kulindwa.

Unaposhughulikia hali ya hatari, kumbuka kupumzika, kupumua, na kutulia. Kufanya hivyo kutakusaidia kushughulikia hali ya hatari vizuri zaidi.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_crisis.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_crisis.lower_case_title?

SourceText: Why celebrate?
text: Kwa nini kusherehekea?

SourceText:
CONGRATULATIONS! You have done it! You have built 11 important parenting skills. 

This is a huge achievement. It shows such care for your family. 

Let’s celebrate you, and plan your future @global.parent_app support.
text:
HONGERA! Umefaulu! Umejifunza stadi 11 muhimu za malezi.

Haya ni mafanikio makubwa. Inaonyesha unavyoijali sana familia yako.

Ngoja tukusherehekee, na tupange tutakavyokusaidia baadaye kwenye @global.parent_app.
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today’s topic is celebration and next steps.

It has been amazing, it has been wonderful having you on this journey. Today we are celebrating our journey together. 

Today we are celebrating all the learnings that we have learnt throughout.
text:
Msalimie kila mtu.

Mada ya leo ni sherehe na hatua zinazofuata.

Imekuwa ya kushangaza, imekuwa nzuri kuwa na wewe kwenye safari hii. Leo tunasherehekea safari yetu pamoja.

Leo tunsherehekea mafunzo yote ambayo tumejifunza kote.

SourceText:
Teenagers go through a lot of changes, both in their bodies and in how they feel and experience the world. By speaking with them you can help them handle this change as well. 

Let your teen know you may not have all the answers, but you are there to support them and find solutions together. That way your teen knows you are there to listen and talk. You will not judge or shame them and can support them to make healthy and confident decisions.
text:
Vijana hupitia mabadiliko mengi katika miili yao na jinsi wanavyohisi na kupata uzoefu duniani. Kwa kuzungumza nao unaweza kuwasaidia kushughulikia mabadiliko haya pia.

Mjulishe kijana wako kuwa huenda huna majibu yote, lakini uko pale ili kuwaunga mkono na kutafuta suluhu pamoja. Kwa njia hiyo kijana wako anajua upo kusikiliza na kuzungumza. Hutawahukumu au kuwaaibisha na unaweza kuwaunga mkono kufanya maamuzi yenye afya na kujiamini

SourceText:
Think back to your own teenage years: 
* Did you ever experience a difficult situation as a teenager around body changes? And what about relationships? 
* What kind of support or information do you wish you had at the time?
* Do you think your teen may be experiencing any challenges in these areas?
text:
Fikiria miaka yako ya ujana:
* Je, umewahi kupata hali ngumu wakati kijana karibu na mabadiliko ya mwili? Na vipi kuhusu mahusiano?
* Je, ni aina gani ya usaidizi au taarifa unayotamani kuwa nayo wakati huo?
* Je, unafikiri kijana wako anaweza kuwa anapitia changamoto zozote katika maeneo haya?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is body changes and intimate relationships. 

Discussing body and intimate relationships with your child can be difficult. However, it is important to have these discussions in order for your teen to understand that this stage of life is normal. This will help them to acknowledge the changes in their bodies and be able to take positive decisions regarding intimate relationships.
text:
Nawasalimia wote.

Mada ya leo ni mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

Kujadili mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi ukiwa na mtoto wako inaweza kuwa ngumu. Hata hivyo, ni muhimu kuwa na majadiliano haya ili kijana wako aelewe kwamba hatua hii ya maisha ni ya kawaida. Hii itawasaidia kutambua mabadiliko katika miili yao na kuwa na uwezo wa kufanya maamuzi chanya kuhusu mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_srh.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_srh.lower_case_title?
note: The string @data.workshop.w_srh.lower_case_title? should not be translated.

SourceText:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in.

We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts, voice, AND body in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!
text:
Ili kuwaweka vijana wetu salama, tunahitaji kuelewa uhalisia wao na hali hatari ambazo wanaweza kujikuta katika.

Tunaweza kuwasaidia vijana wetu kujua jinsi ya kutumia mawazo, sauti na miili yao katika hali hatari. Inafanya tofauti kubwa!

SourceText:
Our topic is staying safe. 

As parents it is important to ensure that our teens are safe at all times. Our safety and our children’s safety is important. We may need to have discussions with our children about their safety, and how they can keep themselves safe always.
text:
Mada yetu ni kuwa salama.
Kama wazazi ni muhimu kuhakikisha kwamba vijana wetu wako salama wakati wote. Usalama wetu na usalama wa watoto wetu ni muhimu. Huenda tukahitaji kuwa na majadiliano na watoto wetu kuhusu usalama wao, na jinsi wanavyoweza kujiweka salama kila wakati.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_svp.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_svp.lower_case_title?

SourceText:
Grief affects us all in different ways. 

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.
text:
Huzuni hutuathiri sisi sote kwa njia tofauti.

Chochote unachohisi, unahuzunika kwa njia yako mwenyewe, na hiyo ni sawa.

SourceText:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief. 

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.
text:
Nawasalimia wote.

Mada ya leo ni kukabiliana na majonzi.

Kujitunza ni muhimu, hasa tunapokabiliana na changamoto na nyakati ngumu kama vile kukabiliana na huzuni. Tunatakiwa kuwa watulivu ili kufikiri kutenda vyema kila tunapojikuta tumeelemewa. Tunaweza kutumia mbinu kama vile kutulia ili kujituliza.

SourceText: Why @data.workshop.w_grief.lower_case_title?
text: Kwanini @data.workshop.w_grief.lower_case_title?

SourceText:
Did you know that your one-on-one time with your teen can help them at school?  Today we will share some ideas on how to do this.

By spending time with them, you teach them important life skills that will help them at school and at home.
text:
Je, unajua kwamba wakati wako wa moja kwa moja na kijana wako unaweza kuwasaidia shuleni? Leo tutashiriki maoni kadhaa juu ya jinsi ya kufanya hivyo.

Kwa kutumia muda pamoja nao, unawafundisha stadi muhimu za maisha ambazo zitawasaidia shuleni na nyumbani.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone! 

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn. 

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!
text:
Habari zenu wote!

Mada ya leo ni kumsaidia kijana wako kujifunza.

Kuna njia tofauti za Kufurahisha na shughuli ambazo tunaweza kutumia kama wazazi kusaidia vijana wetu kujifunza. Baadhi ya shughuli hizo zinaweza kuwa kucheza michezo pamoja au kufanya kazi za nyumbani pamoja. Kumbuka, vijana wetu hujifunza vyema zaidi wanapoburudika!

SourceText: Welcome and Self-Care
text: Makaribisho na Kujithamini

SourceText: Self-Care
text: Kujithamini

SourceText: self-care
text: kujithamini

SourceText: This @global.workshop is about YOU. Looking after yourself is essential for a happy family.
text: @global.workshop_capital hiki ni kwa ajili YAKO. Kujiangalia mwenyewe ni muhimu kwenye familia yenye furaha.
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.parent_app, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family! 

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even 5 minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
text:
Kwa mimi kama mzazi, ilikuwa kama haiwezekani kupata muda kwa ajili yangu. Nilikuwa na kazi nyingi za kumwangalia kila mmoja. Kupitia @global.parent_app, niligundua ni jinsi gani ilivyo muhimu kujijali mwenyewe. Inanisaidia mimi na familia yangu!

Kuwa na muda kwa ajili yangu binafsi inanisaidia kupumua na kujua jinsi ninavyo hisi. Hata dakika 5 za kupata kikombe cha chai inaleta mabadiliko makubwa. Sasa naweza kushughulikia msongo wangu wa mawazo vizuri zaidi.
note: The string @global.parent_app, should not be translated.

SourceText:
My dad was always busy. He would come home from work and snap at us when we started asking him questions. 

@global.parent_app helped us a lot. We no longer fight. Now, when my dad comes home, he first sits down by himself for 5 minutes and then we do a relaxing activity from @global.parent_app together, so we can all take a deep breath and relax. Then we can chat about our day, about anything good or bad that happened. Everyone is so much happier now.
text:
Mara nyingi Baba yangu alikuwa na kazi nyingi. Angweza kurudi kutoka kazini na kuwa mwenye haraka pale tunapoanza kumuuliza maswali.

@global.parent_app imetusaidia sana. Hatugombani tena. sasa hivi, baba yangu akirudi nyumbani, anakaa kwanza chini kwa dakika 5 na baadae tunafanya pamoja zoezi la kupumzika kutoka katika @global.parent_app, hivyo wote tunaweza kuvuta pumzi ndefu na kupumzika. Baadae tunaweza kuongelea kuhusu siku yetu, kuhusu chochote kibaya au kizuri kilichotokea. Kila mmoja ni mwenye furaha zaidi sasa hivi.

SourceText: **Welcome and Self-Care** @global.workshop
text: **Ukaribisho na kujithamini** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Muda wa Pamoja Wawili

SourceText: one-on-one time
text: muda wa pamoja wawili

SourceText: Spending time with your teen builds a positive relationship.
text: Kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako hujenga mahusiano chanya.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together. 

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time. 

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence, and even about girlfriends and those things!
text:
Niliposikia kwa mara ya kwanza ninatakiwa kuwa na muda wa pamoja na kijana wangu, ilikuwa vigumu kwangu. Sikujua wakati gani wa kufanya au nini cha kusema. Sikutaka kumharibu kijana wangu ili kwamba ajue tunatakiwa kufanya kila kitu pamoja.

Lakini nilitaka sana kujenga uhusiano wangu na kijana wangu na nilitaka awe muwazi kuhusu nini kinachomsumbua. Hivyo tulijaribu muda wa pamoja.

Mwanzo, ilionekana ajabu, lakini ilibadilika na kuwa ya kufurahisha! Sasa hivi tunaangalia pamoja vipindi vyake vya TV na tunaviongelea. Na tunaweza hata tukaongea kuhusu jinsi mtoto wangu wa kiume anavyobadilika, na hata kuhusu marafiki wa kike na vitu hivyo!

SourceText:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick”. But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted. 

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own. 

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
text:
Mama yangu alipoomba kutumia muda na mimi, niliwaza " Labda kitu flani hakiko sawa, labda anaumwa". Lakini alisema "Hapana, nahitaji tu kutumia muda. "Nilikuwa na mashaka, lakini nilikubali.

Aliniuliza nini ninapenda kufanya. Kilikuwa kitu kigeni na sikuwa huru, kwa sababu hajawahi kutumia muda pamoja na mimi kwa ajili yangu.

Kadri alivyoendelea kujaribu na tulitumia muda pamoja, ilikuwa safi sana. Aliweza kinishirikisha utoto wake, vitu ambavyo sikuwa kusikia kabla. Hiyo ilinisaidia pia kusema kinachoendelea katika maisha yangu. Tuliongea hata kuhusu marafiki zangu wa kiume na kuhusu matatizo. Najua ninaweza kuongea na mama yangu sasa hivi.

SourceText: **One-on-One Time** @global.workshop
text: **Muda wa Pamoja Wawili** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Praise
text: Kusifia

SourceText: praise
text: kusifia

SourceText: Praise helps teens show more positive behaviour.
text: Kusifia husaidia vijana kuwa na tabia chanya.

SourceText:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
text:
Tulipojifunza kuhusu jambo hili la kusifu nilifikiri, “Hatukusifiwa kamwe kwa mambo tukiwa vijana, kwa hivyo kwa nini tuanze sasa?” Lakini nilipendezwa nilipojifunza faida za kusifu zingeweza kuwa nini.

Mara tu baada ya warsha ya kila wiki, niliona kijana wangu akifanya kile anachofanya kila siku: kuosha vyombo. Na nikasema, "Asante kwa kuosha vyombo, msichana wangu, inanifurahisha sana kwamba unasaidia." Kijana wangu alikuwa akitabasamu na hata alikuja kunikumbatia, jambo ambalo huwa hafanyi.

Biashara hii ya kusifu ni ngumu. Bado ninasahau wakati mwingine au kutoa sifa wakati huo huo kama ukosoaji. Lakini kusifu kunafanya tofauti. Sikuwahi kufikiria kwamba sifa rahisi inaweza kufanya mabadiliko hayo kwa mtu!

SourceText:
I was grateful that my mother learnt about praise. 

My mother always noticed when I was doing something wrong. She would shout at me and hit me. 

But when my mother did the workshop, she would praise me for little things. First I thought “What is going on?” but then it continued. I liked it so I did more good things I thought she would like. 

It feels great that my mother sees the good things I do, and not just the bad things.

I even said it to her once. During @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title, I said “Thank you, mom, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.” This made us both very happy.
text:
Nilishukuru kwamba mama yangu alijifunza kuhusu sifa.

Mama yangu aliona kila wakati nikifanya kitu kibaya. Alinifokea na kunipiga.

Lakini mama yangu alipofanya warsha hiyo, alinisifu kwa mambo madogo. Kwanza nilifikiria "Ni nini kinaendelea?" lakini iliendelea. Niliipenda kwa hivyo nilifanya mambo mazuri zaidi ambayo nilifikiri angependa.

Ninahisi vizuri kwamba mama yangu huona mambo mazuri ninayofanya, na sio tu mambo mabaya.

Nilimwambia hata mara moja. Wakati wa @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title, nilisema “Asante, mama, kwa kusema jambo zuri ninapofanya mambo vizuri, si tu ninapofanya mambo vibaya.” Hili lilitufurahisha sana sote wawili.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_1on1.lower_case_title, should not be translated.

SourceText: **Praise** @global.workshop
text: **Kusifia** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Positive Instructions
text: Maelekezo Chanya

SourceText: positive instructions
text: maelekezo chanya

SourceText: Teens follow instructions that are positive more easily.
text: Vijana hufuata maelekezo chanya kwa urahisi zaidi.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.” 

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day “I really love this new mom,” and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Hapo awali, nilikuwa nikiwalea vijana wangu jinsi nilivyolelewa: ningewaambia “msifanye hivi, msifanye vile.” Tulikuwa tunapigana sana, lakini mambo yamebadilika sana nilipojifunza kuhusu kutoa maagizo chanya.

Sasa ninazingatia tabia ninayotaka kuona, na kutoa maagizo wazi na rahisi kwa vijana wangu. Ilichukua muda kujifunza kusema “tafadhali fanya hivi” badala ya “usifanye hivi.”

Vijana wangu na hata mume wangu huniambia kwamba wanapenda njia hii ya kufanya mambo, kwa sababu sasa wanajua kinachopaswa kufanywa. Kijana wangu alisema siku moja "Ninampenda sana mama huyu mpya," na viwango vyangu vya dhiki vimeshuka sana.

SourceText:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing @global.parent_app. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like “Hmmm okay,” because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted – she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home. 

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said “Thank you for being on time.” It was strange, but I liked it. 

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
text:
Mwanzoni, sikumjali sana mama yangu alikuwa akifanya @global.parent_app. Lakini nilianza kumwona mama akibadili jinsi alivyowasiliana nasi.

Siku moja, nilipokuwa nikitoka na marafiki zangu, alisema lazima niwe nyumbani kufikia saa kumi na mbili jioni. Nilikuwa kama "Hmmm sawa," kwa sababu kwa kawaida hakutoa maagizo wazi juu ya kile alichotaka - hakusema chochote na kisha kunipigia kelele kwa kuchelewa nilipofika nyumbani.

Nilipofika nyumbani saa kumi na moja jioni, mama yangu alinikumbatia na kusema “Asante kwa kufika kwa wakati.” Ilikuwa ajabu, lakini niliipenda.

Tangu wakati huo, tuna mawasiliano ya wazi zaidi ndani ya nyumba.
note: The string @global.parent_app. should not be translated.

SourceText: **Positive Instructions** @global.workshop
text: **Maelekezo Chanya** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Managing Stress
text: Kudhibiti Msongo wa Mawazo

SourceText: managing stress
text: kudhibiti msongo wa mawazo

SourceText: Life is stressful. Staying calm helps us handle any situation better.
text: Maisha ni ya mafadhaiko. Kuwa na utulivu husaidia kukabiliana na hali yoyote vyema.

SourceText:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.parent_app, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home, because they knew I would start yelling at them. 

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first, but every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home, and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!
text:
Maisha ni magumu wakati mwingine. Kabla sijajiunga na @global.parent_app, Nilikuwa mwenye hasira wakati wote. Nilitoa hasira zangu kwa watu wote katika familia, si kwa vijana wangu tu bali hata kwa Mume wangu pia. Walikuwa wakikimbia pindi niliporudi nyumbani, kwa sababu walijua nitaanza kuwafokea.

Kujifunza kupumzika na kuvuta pumzi awali ilikuwa ngumu, lakini wakati mwingi nilijaribu, Ilinisaidia kutulia. Sasa Vijana wangu hawakimbii tena pindi ninaporudi nyumbani, na wanasikiliza vizuri zaidi kuliko nilipokuwa nikiwafokea awali!
note: The string @global.parent_app, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me, and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else. 

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
text:
Pindi nilipofanya kitu kibaya, Baba yangu alinikasirikia sana na kunipiga. Alikuwa hanisikilizi na hii ilinifanya kumkasirikia yeye pamoja na watu wengine.

Sasa, pindi anapokuwa na hasira, anachukua dakika chache kuvuta pumzi ndefu kabla hajajibu chochote. Inafanya kila mtu kutulia badala ya kusababisha ugomvi mkubwa.

Hii inanisaidia sana nyumbani na hata shuleni, hata Mimi sasa siwakasirikii wengine na si mtu wa hisia kali. Pindi ninapojihisi hasira au mwenye msongo wa mawazo, Navuta pumzi ndefu kama Baba yangu anavyofanya. Nimekuwa mtu tofauti.

SourceText: **Managing Stress** @global.workshop
text: **Kudhibiti Msongo wa Mawazo** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Problem Solving
text: Kutatua Matatizo

SourceText: problem solving
text: kutatua matatizo

SourceText: Together with your teen, you can handle any challenge.
text: Pamoja na kijana wako mnaweza kutatua changamoto yoyote.

SourceText:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school. 

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.
text:
Sina mahusiano mazuri na binti yangu. Mara nyingi nilikuwa nikimfokea, na alikuwa akikataa kwenda shuleni.

Mara nilipoanza kutumia muda wangu pamoja naye, Nilitambua kwamba hakutaka kwenda shuleni kwa sababu alikuwa akionewa. Tulikaa chini na kutumia hatua sita za kutatua tatizo. Tulitambua tatizo, na kutafuta suluhisho kwa pamoja:"Naweza kufanya nini kama mzazi ili uweze kuhudhuria shuleni na kujihisi salama?"

Tulikubaliana kuwa nitakwenda kuzungumza na mwalimu kutafuta suluhisho. Ni kweli tulipata suluhisho kwa pamoja, na sasa tupo karibu.

SourceText:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends. 

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.” 

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well! 

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
text:
Pindi Baba yangu aliponitambulisha hatua za kutatua tatizo, ilinisaidia mimi na familia yangu, lakini pia iliwasaidia marafiki zangu.

Niliwaambia marafiki zangu kuhusu hatua hizo, na sasa wakati tunapobishana tunakaa chini na kila mmoja anakuja na suluhisho. Kisha tunaangalia madhara hasi na chanya ya kila suluhisho, na tunakubaliana"sawa ngoja tujaribu hii moja,"

Marafiki zangu huchukua na kupeleka nyumbani kwao, na inawasaidia wao na familia zao pia!

Ni furaha pindi ambapo wengine wanakusikiliza na kukubaliana na mawazo yako hata kama wewe ni mdogo. Sote tunaweza kuleta maelewano na marafiki na familia.

SourceText: **Problem Solving** @global.workshop
text: **Kutatua matatizo** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Family Budgets
text: Bajeti za Familia

SourceText: family budgets
text: bajeti za familia

SourceText: Making a plan to budget and save as a family prevents disagreements.
text: Kupanga bajeti na kuweka akiba kama familia husaidia kupunguza hali ya kutokuelewana.

SourceText:
Saving and budgeting helps me as a parent, and it helps my teens as well to understand where the money goes.

My teens always asked for a lot of things and they did not understand when I said “I do not have money.” They would say “but you have a job!” 

I sat down with them and showed them all the things we pay for and how much is left. They understand now and even give ideas on how we can save to work towards our goals like new shoes or a birthday and bigger goals like their school fees. For the older one, I even opened a savings account.
text:
Kuweka akiba na kupanga bajeti inanisaidia kama mzazi, na inawasaidia vijana wangu kuelewa mahali pesa inapokwenda.

Vijana wangu mara nyingi walikuwa wakiuliza vitu vingi na walikuwa hawaelewi pindi niliposema "Sina pesa" Walikuwa wakisema "Lakini una kazi!"

Nilikaa nao chini na kuwaonyesha vitu vyote tunavyolipa na kiasi kilichobaki. Sasa wanaelewa na wananipa mawazo namna ya kufanya ili kuweka akiba na kufanyia kazi malengo yetu kama viatu vipya au sherehe ya kuzaliwa na malengo makubwa kama ada yao ya shule. Kwa mkubwa mmoja, niliweza kufungua akaunti ya akiba.

SourceText:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say “I do not have money,” but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point “she does not love me.”

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked “what are the needs and wants in our house.” I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family. 

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
text:
Nilikuwa nikimwambia Mama yangu aninunulie nguo nzuri kila wakati, wakati mwingi alisema " Sina pesa", lakini nilikuwa najua kwamba anapata pesa kutoka kwa Mjomba. Sikuelewa kwanini alikuwa akikataa kuninunulia nguo. Nilifikiri kwa wakati fulani " Kwamba hanipendi."

Lakini siku moja, aliniita na kunikalisha chini na kuniuliza " Ni yapi mahitaji na matakwa katika nyumba yetu." Nilianza kuorodhesha mahitaji na matakwa yangu.
Kisha Mama alinisaidia kufikiri juu ya mahitaji ya familia. Sasa naelewa ni wapi pesa zetu zinakwenda, kwenye vitu tunavyohitaji kama familia.
Kuanzia siku hiyo, Nilielewa na siwezi kuja kila mara kuuliza. Sasa, ninapohitaji kitu fulani, nasubiri mpaka mwisho wa mwezi tunapojadili bajeti kwa pamoja kuona kama itawezekana. Tunaelewana kila mmoja kwa sasa.

SourceText: **Family Budgets** @global.workshop
text: **Bajeti za Familia** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Rules
text: Sheria

SourceText: rules
text: sheria

SourceText: Teens follow rules more when you create them together.
text: Vijana hufuata sheria zaidi pale unapotengeneza nao pamoja.

SourceText:
My teenagers always just disappeared. I did not know where they were, and I would get so worried and angry with them. I used to say “this is my house, and these are my rules, if you do not want to follow them you can leave and stay in your own place.” 

When we learnt in @global.parent_app about rules, I learnt that there are rules for teens and for adults and for everyone. If we follow the rules as parents, our teens will follow our example.

I explained my worry and we all agreed: We all follow the rule and say where we are going when we leave the house. Coming up with rules together helped us a lot, as my teens do not see me anymore as that annoying parent that just makes up unnecessary rules.
text:
Vijana wangu mara nyingi hutoweka. Sijui wanakuwa wapi, huwa napata wasiwasi na hasira nao. Nilikuwa nikisema "hii ni nyumba yangu, na hizi ni sheria zangu, ikiwa hutaki kuzifuata unaweza kuondoka na kukaa mahali pako."

Tulipojifunza katika @global.parent_app kuhusu sheria, nilijifunza kwamba kuna sheria za vijana na za watu wazima na kwa kila mtu. Tukifuata sheria tukiwa wazazi, vijana wetu watafuata mfano wetu.

Nilielezea wasiwasi wangu na sote tukakubaliana: Sote tunafuata sheria na kusema tunapotoka nyumbani. Kutunga sheria pamoja kulitusaidia sana, kwa kuwa vijana wangu hawanioni tena kuwa mzazi huyo mwenye kuudhi anayetunga tu sheria zisizo za lazima.
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText:
I never liked rules and I used to forget rules a lot. 

One day, I was playing with my friends. The rule at home was that we should be in the yard by 6pm, but I forgot again. By 6.30 it was getting dark and I was still outside and playing with my phone. Then a boy came, grabbed my phone and ran away. 

I understood that rules can really help to keep us safe, so I changed my behaviour and I was in the yard by 5pm from then.
text:
Sikuwahi kupenda sheria na nilikuwa nikisahau sheria mara nyingi.

Siku moja, nilikuwa nikicheza na marafiki zangu. Sheria ya nyumbani ilikuwa ni kwamba lazima tuwe nyumbani saa kumi na mbili jioni, lakini nilisahau tena. Ilipofika saa kumi na mbili na nusu ilikuwa usiku na bado nilikuwa nje nikichezea simu yangu. Kisha alikuja kijana, na kukwapua simu yangu na kukimbia.

Nilielewa kwamba sheria zinatusaidia kuwa salama, hivyo nilibadili tabia yangu na nilirudi nyumbani saa kumi na moja kwa wakati huo.

SourceText: **Rules** @global.workshop
text: **Sheria** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Calm Consequences
text: Athari Nyepesi

SourceText: calm consequences
text: adhabu nyepesi

SourceText: Consequences help us discipline our teens in a calm way – it works.
text: Athari husaidia kuadabisha vijana wetu kwa namna ya utuilivu - inafanya kazi.

SourceText:
When my teenagers did something to make me angry, I would shout at them and punish them right away. But the next time they did it again! I could not understand why they did not hear me even when I shouted. 

@global.parent_app helped me understand that my teenagers will listen to me more when I am calm. So, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say “we will talk about this later when we are both calm.”

We even agree on the consequences together now before something goes wrong. This has worked wonders – I have seen a huge change in my teen’s behaviour now that they are more involved, and I have less stress. 

I wish I knew this long ago, but it is never too late to start!
text:
Vijana wangu walipofanya jambo la kunikasirisha, niliwafokea na kuwaadhibu mara moja. Lakini wakati mwingine walifanya tena! Sikuweza kuelewa kwa nini hawakunisikia hata nilipopiga kelele.

@global.parent_app ilinisaidia kuelewa kwamba vijana wangu watanisikiliza zaidi ninapokuwa mtulivu. Kwa hiyo, jambo linapotokea, mimi hupumua kwa kina na kusema “tutazungumza kuhusu hili baadaye tukiwa tumetulia.”

Hata tunakubaliana juu ya matokeo pamoja sasa kabla ya hitilafu. Hii imefanya maajabu - nimeona mabadiliko makubwa katika tabia ya kijana wangu sasa kwamba wanahusika zaidi, na nina matatizo kidogo.

Natamani ningelijua hili zamani, lakini sijachelewa kuanza!
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view – before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
text:
Mama yangu na Baba yangu mara nyingi waliniadhibu pindi walipokuwa na hasira na mimi. Walinifokea na mimi nilipata hasira. Mara nyingi sikufuata sheria zao, kwa sababu zilikuwa kali, sikuelewa kile walichokuwa wakisema, au Nilikuwa sijihangaishi kuwasikiliza, kwa sababu wote tulikuwa na hasira.

Siku moja, waliniuliza: Hebu tufikiri kwa pamoja madhara yanayoweza kukupata kwa kushindwa kurudi nyumbani kwa wakati. Ilikuwa ni furaha kubwa kutoa maoni yangu kabla kitu hakijatokea na kutufanya wote kuwa na hasira. Wote tulitulia na kukubaliana kwanza. Sasa ni rahisi kwangu kufuata sheria kwa sababu najua na nilikubali sheria hizo na madhara kama sitafuata sheria hizo.

SourceText: **Calm Consequences** @global.workshop
text: **Adhabu Nyepesi** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Teen Safety
text: Usalama wa Vijana

SourceText: teen safety
text: usalama wa vijana

SourceText: Talking and planning helps prevent dangerous situations, in-person and online.
text: Kuongea na kupanga husaidia kuzuia hali hatarishi, ana kwa ana na mtandaoni.

SourceText:
I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of. 

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.
text:
Nilikuwa mwenye furaha kufanya mipango salama na kijana wangu. Nilifikiri nilijua ni maeneo yapi ni salama kwa kijana wangu na yapi si salama. Lakini pindi tulipofanya mipango salama kwa pamoja, Niligundua kwamba binti yangu anajua zaidi maeneo ambayo mimi sikuyafahamu.

Pia nilifikiri kwamba alikuwa salama alipokuwa shuleni, lakini kwa shughuli hii niligundua kwamba alikuwa akionewa shuleni na walimu hawakufanya chochote kuhusu hilo.

Kadiri tulivyozidi kuongea, ndivyo nilivyozidi kuelewa na kupata taarifa kutoka kwa kijana wangu. Hii imenisaidia sana kumlinda kijana wangu na kumuweka salama.

SourceText:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me. 

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot – also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad. 

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!
text:
Wakati marafiki zangu au mimi nilipoingia katika ugomvi, nilikuwa mara nyingi nikijaribu kuficha kwa mama angepata hasira na kunifokea.

Wakati tulitengeneza ramani ya maeneo salama na yasiyo salama, nilijifunza mengi-pia kwanini ni hatari kushirikisha kila picha kwenye mtandao wa kijamii. Mama yangu aliniambia kwamba naweza kumuuliza wakati wowote kama kuna tatizo na aliahidi kutokukasirika.

Alitunza ahadi yake, hivyo sasa kama nina tatizo au sijihisi salama najua tunaweza kukaa na kuja na suluhisho la pamoja. Kwa sasa nawezi hata kuzungumza na Mama yangu kuhusu mambo ninayofanya kwenye mtandao!

SourceText: **Teen Safety** @global.workshop
text: **Usalama wa kijana** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Dealing with Crisis
text: Kushughulikia Hali ya Matatizo

SourceText: dealing with crisis
text: kushughulikia hali ya hatari/dharula

SourceText: A crisis can happen in any family. You can be prepared.
text: Matatizo yanaweza kutokea katika familia yoyote. Unaweza kuwa tayari.

SourceText:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.parent_app, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out. 

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!
text:
Kijana wangu alikuwa mwenye hasira muda wote. Alikuwa hasikilizi na tulikuwa tunajikuta katika marumbano makubwa kila siku. Kupitia @global.parent_app, nilianza kutumia muda zaidi na kijana wangu na kuimarisha uhusiano wetu. Siku moja alinishirikisha kwamba alikuwa sehemu ya genge lakini alikuwa anataka kujitoa.

Tuliweka pamoja mipango ya muda mfupi na ya muda mrefu jisni tunaweza kufanya hivyo. Maisha yetu yanaonekana tofauti sasa hivi!
note: The string @global.parent_app, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go. 

When my mother started with @global.parent_app, she started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
text:
Miaka miwili iliyopita, nilibakwa na mjomba wangu aliyekuwa anaishi nyumbani kwetu. Sikumwambia mama yangu, kwa sababu niliogopa angenipiga, kunifokea, au hata kunifukuza ndani ya nyumba. Sikuwa na mahali popote pengine pa kwenda.

Wakati mama yangu alipoanza @global.parent_app, alianza kutumia muda zaidi pamoja. Nilikuwa bado naogopa, lakini mwisho nilimshirikisha mama yangu.Mama yangu hakufoka, lakini alinisikiliza na kuniambia siyo kosa langu. Tulienda polisi na kliniki pamoja. Ninashukuru sana sihitaji kutunza zaidi siri hii.
note: The string @global.parent_app, should not be translated.

SourceText: **Dealing with Crisis** @global.workshop
text: **Kushughulikia Hali ya Hatari/Dharula** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

text: Kusherehekea na Hatua Zinazofuata

SourceText: celebration and next steps
text: kusherehekea na hatua zinazofuata

SourceText: Celebrate everything you learnt and continue to support your family.
text: Sherehekea kila unachojifunza na uendelee kusaidia familia yako.

SourceText: **Celebration and Next Steps** @global.workshop
text: **Kusherehekea na Hatua Zinazofuata** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Body Changes and Intimate Relationships
text: Mabadiliko ya Mwili na Mahusiano ya Kimapenzi

SourceText: body changes and intimate relationships
text: mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi

SourceText: Open discussions help your teen understand changes and make healthy choices.
text: Majadiliano ya wazi humsaidia kijana wako kuelewa mabadiliko na kufanya uchaguzi mzuri.

SourceText:
Thanks to the app, I can now talk to my son about all these changes that he is going through with his body and emotions and relationships. We were both not comfortable bringing it up before, but the practical examples in the app made it possible for us to start talking. And I was really surprised by how many questions and experiences my son already has, even though he is only 14!

Now he can come to me if there is something happening at school or if he is not sure how to handle something. The other day he even told me that some of his friends were making fun of him because he does not have a girlfriend yet, so we talked about it and I could explain to him that it is important to focus on school first and that it is never okay for someone to pressure him to have a relationship.
text:
Nashukuru kwa programu, sasa ninaweza kuongea na kijana wangu kuhusu mabadiliko haya yote anayokabiliana nayo katika mwili wake, hisia na mahusiano. Wote hatukuwa huru kuzungumzia kabla, lakini mifano halisi katika programu imetufanikisha kuanza kuzungumza. Na nilishangazwa na maswali na uzoefu kijana wangu alionao, japokuwa anamiaka 14 tu!

Sasa anakuja kwangu kama kuna kitu kimetokea shuleni au kama hana uhakika namna ya kukabiliana na jambo. Siku moja aliniambia baadhi ya marafiki zake walikuwa wanamtania kwa sababu hakuwa na rafiki wa kike, hivyo tulizungumza na nilimwelezea kwamba ni muhimu kuweka mkazo kwenye shule kwanza na kwamba sio sawa kwa mtu kumlazimisha kuwa na mahusiano.

SourceText:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. I thought all those things were true, and I was doing a lot of things secretly, because my friends were pushing me and I was afraid of what my mother would say.

When I did this app together with my mother, I realised that so many things I learnt were not true. I learnt I can get better information and I learnt others should never push me to do things I do not want to do. My mother and I can talk about these things now. I wish we could have done that when I was younger, because it would have helped me a lot, but I am still glad we can talk today. Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my mother and she will help me think of answers and solutions together
text:
Kama vijana, tunasikia mambo mengi kuhusu ngono kutoka kwa wengine shuleni na mtandaoni. Nilidhani yote hayo ni kweli, na nilikuwa nafanya mengi kwa usiri, kwa sababu marafiki zangu walikuwa wananishawishi na nilikuwa naogopa kwamba mama yangu atasema nini.

Nilipopitia programu hii pamoja na mama, niligundua kwamba mengi niliyojifunza yalikuwa sio kweli. Nilijifunza naweza kupata taarifa nzuri zaidi na nilijifunza wengine wasinisukume kufanya jambo ambalo nisilotaka kufanya. Mimi na mama yangu tunaweza kuongelea haya mambo kwa sasa. Nilitamani tungeweza fanya haya nilipokuwa mtoto, kwa sababu ingenisaidia sana, lakini bado ninafurahi tunaweza kuzungumza leo. Kila ninapokuwa na swali au tatizo sasa, ninajua naweza kumuuliza mama yangu na atanisaidia kufikiria majibu na suluhisho kwa pamoja

SourceText: **Body Changes and Intimate Relationships** @global.workshop
text: **Mabadiliko ya Mwili na Mahusiano ya Kimapenzi** @global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Staying Safe
text: Kukaa salama

SourceText: staying safe
text: kukaa salama

SourceText: Help your teen recognise dangerous situations and stay safe.
text: Msaidie kijana wako kutambua hali hatari na awe salama.

SourceText:
Learning how to stay safe really helped us. The other day, my daughter got invited to a party by an older boy, and he said he would pay for her transport. Before, she would just go secretly, but now she came to me to talk about it. 

We reminded each other that it is important to see the warning signs and stay safe, and she decided to say ‘no’. I am so proud of her. Even me, I now know that others should not pressure or convince me to do something. I can give the right example to my children.
text:
Kujifunza jinsi ya kuwa salama imetusaidia sana. Siku iliyopita, binti yangu alialikwa kwenye sherehe na mvulana mkubwa, na alisema atamlipia usafiri. Hapo kabla, alikuwa anaenda kwa usiri, ila sasa anakuja na kuzungumza na mimi kuhusiana na hilo.

Tulikumbushana kwamba ni muhimu kuona ishara za hatari na kubaki salama, na aliamua kusema 'hapana'. Ninajivunia binti yangu. Hata mimi, sasa ninajua kwamba wengine wasinilazimishe au kunishawishi kufanya jambo. Ninaweza kutoa mfano halisi kwa watoto wangu.

SourceText: It helped me a lot that I learnt I can use my voice to stay safe. A while ago, I was walking home alone and some man began to follow me and I felt scared. My father taught me that the most important thing is to be safe, so I turned around and said loud and clear ‘Why are you following me, I don’t want that’. It really surprised the man and even some other people looked at us, so the man walked away. I felt so relieved and even told my father. He said I did well and I felt really good. Before, I would have been too scared, also what other people think, but now I feel confident.
text: Imenisaidia sana kwamba ninaweza kutumia sauti yangu na kuwa salama. Siku chache zilizopita, nilikuwa naelekea nyumbani peke yangu na mwanaume alianza kunifuata nami niliogopa. Baba yangu alinifundisha kwamba jambo muhimu sana ni kuwa salama, kwahiyo niligeuka na kuongea kwa sauti kubwa ' kwanini unanifuatilia, sitaki!' Ilimshangaza mwanaume huyo na hata watu wengine walitutazama, hivyo mwanaume yule aliondoka. Nilijisikia amani na hata kumwambia baba yangu. Alisema nilifanya vyema na nilijisikia vizuri. Hapo awali, ningekuwa naogopa sana, na nini watu wengine wangefikiria, lakini sasa nahisi ujasiri.

SourceText: Coping with Grief
text: Kukabiliana na Majonzi

SourceText: coping with grief
text: kukabiliana na Majonzi

SourceText: Help your teen cope after losing a loved one.
text: Msaidie kijana wako kukabiliana na hali ya majonzi baada ya kupoteza mpendwa.

SourceText:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We don’t feel alone anymore.
text:
Baada ya kufiwa na mume wangu, vidokezo vya malezi nilivyojifunza vilinisaidia sana: Nilianza kuvuta pumzi kwa utulivu kila ninapohisi huzuni na hasira, na watoto wangu walihisi tofauti kwa sababu nilikuwa najifunza kuwa na utulivu.

Kuelezea hisia zetu na kuwa wazi kuhusu namna tunavyojisikia imenisaidia kuwa karibu na mtoto wangu. Hapo awali, nilihisi mimi peke yangu ndiye napitia hizi hisia, lakini sasa najua kwamba na mtoto wangu anahisi pia hali hiyo. Tunaweza kuzungumza kuhusu hilo na kusaidiana. Hatuhisi upweke tena.

SourceText:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.
text:
Nilipofiwa na mama yangu, kila kitu kilibadilika. Nilikuwa na huzuni sana, lakini ilikuwa kama baba yangu hakuelewa. Iliathiri mahusiano yetu. Kila mtu aliendelea na mambo yake na tuliacha kuongea. Lakini baadae jambo la ajabu lilitokea.

Baba yangu alijifunza mambo haya yote kutoka kwenye programu kuhusu nini cha kufanya pale unapofiwa na mtu. Aliniuliza ninaendeleaje na tulianza kuongea. Alielezea kwamba alikuwa na huzuni pia, na aliomba msamaha kwa kutozungumza na mimi baada ya mama kufariki. Sasa tunaweza kuona kwamba ni vigumu kwetu sisi, na tunaweze kusaidiana. Ananisaidia na tupo karibu zaidi.

SourceText: **Coping with Grief** @global.workshop
text: **Kukabiliana na Majonzi**@global.workshop
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Helping Your Teen Learn
text: Kumsaidia Kijana Wako Kujifunza

SourceText: helping your teen learn
text: kumsaidia Kijana Wako Kujifunza

SourceText: Education is important! Learn fun ways to support your teen.
text: Elimu ni muhimu! Jifunze njia za kufurahisha za kusaidia kijana wako.

SourceText:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him. 

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.
text:
Tangu tulipoanza kutumia muda wa pamoja. tumekuwa na uhusiano mzuri, maelewano mazuri baina yetu. Najisikia vizuri na malezi ninayotoa. Ninafanya vizuri kama mzazi, sio tu kuwa mzazi, lakini kuonesha upendo na kufanya kazi pamoja naye.

Ninapenda kwamba programu inahamasisha kufanya kazi pamoja na watoto wako, na pia inatufanya tuwe sawa kusiwe na matabaka kati ya mzazi na mtoto, na pia tunawahusisha katika maamuzi yenye matokeo kwao.

SourceText:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using @global.parent_app, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions. 

We play games, we sing together and other stuff… She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like “what you did is not good” and such.
text:
Katika kipindi cha nyuma mama yangu alikuwa na hasira na muda mwingine alikuwa ananifokea kabla ya kunipiga. Lakini tangu mama yangu aanze kutumia @global.parent_app, anajaribu kutafuta muda wa kufanya mazungumzo na kufurahi pamoja nasi.

Tunacheza michezo, tunaimba pamoja na kufanya mambo mengine...Anachukua muda kunisikiliza kabla ya kufanya maamuzi, anasikiliza halafu anatulia na anachukua muda kuelezea, na anasema "ulichofanya sio kizuri" na usirudie tena.
note: The string @global.parent_app, should not be translated.

SourceText:
You are a star! 

Every day, recognise something you have done well. Reward yourself with something that makes you happy. And take a deep breath to relax. 

Remember, you earn a @global.parent_point every time you care for yourself – you matter!

Wewe ni hodari!

Kumbuka, unapata @global.parent_point kila wakati unapojijali - ni muhimu!

text:

SourceText:
Spending time with your teen helps build trust. 

Continue your @global.parent_app journey for great results.

SourceText: Have you spent time with your teen already?

SourceText: Well done for completing the @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. Tomorrow, you can access a new @global.workshop to help you relax, enjoy and learn new skills!
text: Hongera kwa kumaliza @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. Kesho, utaweza kupata @global.workshop kipya cha kukusaidia kuchukua pumziko, na kujifunza ujuzi mpya!

SourceText:
Remember to finish the @data.workshop.w_1on1.in_text_title. You will get valuable information within minutes!

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name! Today we are celebrating two @global.parent_app months! 
This week you'll learn to how help your teen follow household rules.
text:
Habari @fields.user_name! Leo tunasherekea warsha mbili @global.parent_app months!
Wiki hii utajifunza jinsi ya kumsaidia kikana wako kufuata sheria za nyumbani.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.group_name! Today we are celebrating two @global.parent_app months!

Wiki hii utajifunza jinsi ya kumsaidia kikana wako kufuata sheria za nyumbani.

SourceText:
Think about every time you have made your teen smile and all the care you have given them.  

You should be so proud - this is a hard time to be a parent.
text:
Fikiria kila muda uliomfanya kijana wako akatabasamu na matunzo yote uliyompa.

Unatakiwa kujisifu - huu ni muda mgumu kuwa mzazi.

SourceText: Well done - you’ve gained 6 parenting tools already! Do the next @global.workshop to get more!
text: Vizuri sana - umeshapata nyenzo 6 za malezi tayari! Fanya @global.workshop inayofuata kupata zaidi!

SourceText: Complete the @global.workshop and talk with your teen about a positive and a negative consequence of a behaviour.
text: Maliza @global.workshop hii halafu ujaribu kujadili pamoja na kijana wako kuhusu matokeo ya tabia chanya na hasi.
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: Have you thought of a positive and a negative consequence of a behaviour with your teen yet?
text: Je, umewahi kufikiria matokeo chanya na hasi ya tabia na kijana wako?

SourceText: Well done for completing the @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title. Access a new @global.workshop tomorrow to help you enjoy and learn useful skills!
text: Vizuri sana kwa kumaliza warsha @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title. Pata @global.workshop mpya kesho kukusaidia kufurahia na kujifunza ujuzi muhimu!

SourceText:
Calm consequences help your teen follow rules. If you haven't finished  the @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title, give it a go!

Well done for showing so much commitment.
text:
Matokeo tulivu husaida kijana wako kufuata sheria.
Kama hujamaliza warsha  @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title, anza sasa!

Vizuri sana kwa kuonesha kujitolea sana.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_consequence.in_text_title, should not be translated.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name! Crises happen to anyone - being ready helps a lot. 

This @global.workshop will show you how.
text:
Habari @fields.user_name! Matatizo yanaweza kumtokea mtu yeyote – kujiandaa mapema husaidia sana.

@global.workshop hii itakuonyesha jinsi ya kujiandaa mapema.

SourceText:

SourceText: Be proud, you are a committed parent. This is a big achievement!
text: Jivunie, wewe ni mzazi unayejitolea sana. Haya ni mafanikio makubwa!

SourceText:
Crises may happen, and we CAN be prepared!

Start the next @global.workshop to see how with your teen.
text:
Matatizo yanaweza kutokea, na TUNAWEZA kuwa na maandalizi! 

Anza @global.workshop inayofuata kuona jinsi ya kujiandaa mapema wewe na kijana wako.
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText:
Great that you joined this parenting journey! 

Complete the @data.workshop.w_crisis.in_text_title to learn the best way to react when teens need us.
text:
Tunafurahi sana kwamba uko pamoja nasi katika safari hii ya malezi!

Maliza @data.workshop.w_crisis.in_text_title na jifunze njia nzuri ya namna ya kufanya pale kijana wako anapokuhitaji zaidi.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_crisis.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: Have you and your teen discussed what you would do in a crisis?
text: Je, wewe na kijana wako mmejadili nini cha kufanya katika matatizo?

SourceText: Well done for finishing the @data.workshop.w_crisis. Tomorrow, you can access the final @global.workshop to reflect on your journey and plan what to do next!
text: Vizuri sana kwa kumaliza warsha @data.workshop.w_crisis. Kesho, unaweza kupata @global.workshop ya mwisho kuvuta kumbukumbu ya safari na kupanga cha kufanya wakati ujao!

SourceText:
The final @global.workshop unlocks tomorrow!

First try to finish the @data.workshop.w_crisis.in_text_title. That way, you can complete your set of parenting skills and decide what to do next.
text:
@global.workshop ya mwisho inafunguliwa kesho!

Kwanza jaribu kukamilisha warsha @data.workshop.w_crisis.in_text_title. Kwa njia hiyo, unaweza kukamilisha sehemu yako ya ujuzi wa malezi na kuamua nini cha kufanya kwa siku baadaye.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name, well done for starting week 4! 

This week helps increase your chances of getting your teen to do what you ask them.

Habari @fields.user_name, umefanya vizuri kwa kuanza wiki ya 4!

Wiki hii husaidia kuongeza nafasi zako za kumfanya kijana wako afanye kile unachomwambia.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself. No parent is perfect. Using @global.parent_app shows you care!
text: Kuwa mpole kwako mwenyewe. Hakuna mzazi aliyekamilika. Tumia @global.parent_app huoenesha unajari!

SourceText: Teens don’t always listen. Look at this week's @global.workshop to learn how positive instructions can help.

SourceText:
Positive instructions improves behaviour.

Complete the @data.workshop.w_instruct.in_text_title for ideas on how this can work in your family.
text:
Maelekezo chanya huboresha tabia.

Kamilisha warsha ya @data.workshop.w_instruct.in_text_title kwa mawazo ya jinsi gani hii inaweza kufanya kazi katika familia yako.

SourceText: Some parents use the app after their evening meal. Why not complete the @data.workshop.w_instruct.in_text_title when you have a few minutes?

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name! Amazing, this is your second month with @global.parent_app.

Most families struggle with money. This @global.workshop will give you tools to plan your expenses to help you through the month.
text:
Habari @fields.user_name! Unaanza mwezi wako wa pili wa kutumia @global.parent_app. Inastaajabisha!

Karibu kila familia inahangaishwa na masuala ya pesa, kwa hiyo, @global.workshop ya wiki hii itakupa nyenzo itakayokusaidia kupanga matumizi yako ili uweze kuwa na pesa za kutosha kumaliza mwezi.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.group_name! Amazing, this is your second month with @global.parent_app.

You are not alone. Parents around the world are going through the same struggles. 

You are doing your best and we are proud of you!

Hauko peke yako. Wazazi duniani kote wanapitia hali kama hii.

Unajitaidi sana na tunajivunia wewe!

SourceText:
Stressed about money? Does your teen ask for things you can’t afford? 

This week deals with money and budgeting.
text:
Je, unahisi msongo wa mawazo kuhusu fedha? Je, kijana wako anaendelea kuomba vitu ambavyo huwezi kuvimudu?

Warsha ya wiki hii inahusu fedha na bajeti.

SourceText:
Create a family budget with your teen - it will prevent money arguments. 

Complete the @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title to see how. It's easy - you'll see!
text:
Tengeneza bajeti ya familia na kijana wako - itazuia mabishano ya fedha.

Kamilisha warsha @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title kuona jinsi ilivyo rahisi - utaona!
note: The string @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: Have you talked with your teen about your family budget yet?

SourceText: Great, you completed the @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title! Tomorrow, access a new @global.workshop to help you set family rules that work.

SourceText:
Many parents say budgeting brings peace. If you haven't finished the @data.workshop.w_money.in_text_title, give it a go!

Thank you for your committed parenting.

Hongera kwa kutumia @global.parent_app!
Kumbuka kwamba mambo madogomadogo ndiyo huleta mabadiliko makubwa.

SourceText: Thank you for investing in yourself and your family.Try the @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title to build a great parenting skill!

SourceText:
Praise makes all the difference. 

Finish the @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title to see how to use it in YOUR family.

Kusifia huleta mabadiliko makubwa.

Maliza @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title uone jinsi ya kuitumia kwenye familia YAKO.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText:
Praise your teen for one thing they did well. 

And when last did you praise yourself or another adult? Try it!
text:
Msifie kijana wako kwa kitu kimoja alichofanya vizuri.

Na lini mara ya mwisho ulijisifia mwenyewe au kumsifia mtu mzima mwingine? Jaribu!

SourceText: Amazing, you completed the @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title. A new @global.workshop is ready tomorrow. Try it - you will see a change in your teen’s behaviour.
text: Safi sana, umemaliza warsha ya @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title. @global.workshop mpya ipo tayari kesho. Ijaribu - Utaona mabadiliko katika tabia za kijana wako.

SourceText:
Hi @global.user_name, a new @global.workshop awaits you tomorrow!

It seems like you haven’t finished the @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title. It’s short (promise!) – give it a go when you have a few minutes.

Habari @global.user_name, @global.workshop mpya inakusubiri kesho!

Inaonekana kama hujamaliza warsha ya @data.workshop.w_praise.in_text_title, ni fupi(nakuhakikishia!) - ifanye muda ukipata muda wa dakika chache.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! New week, new @global.workshop! Learn to set household rules that your teen understands and follows.

SourceText: Hi @fields.group_name! New week, new @global.workshop! Learn to set household rules that your teen understands and follows.
text: Habari @fields.group_name! Wiki mpya, @global.workshop mpya! Jifunze kuweka sheria za nyumbani ambazo kijana wako anazielewa na kuzifuata.

text:
Umejaribu kadri uwezavyo lakini kijana wako bado ana huzuni?
Kumbuka, unafanya kazi nzuri - kutakuwa na muda mzuri pamoja nao pia!

SourceText:
Thank you for investing in your parenting. 

Do the @data.workshop.w_rules.in_text_title to help your teen understand and follow household rules.

Asante kwa kuwekeza katika malezi.

Fanya warsha ya @data.workshop.w_rules.in_text_title kusaidia kijana wako kuelewa na kufuata sheria za nyumbani.

SourceText: So close to gaining another tool! Complete the @data.workshop.w_rules.in_text_title and set ONE simple, realistic rule with your teen, and see things change!

SourceText: Have you managed to set a rule with your teen?
text: Je, umeweza kutengeneza sheria pamoja na kijana wako?

SourceText:

Tomorrow, access a new @global.workshop! It will show you what to do when teens display bad (or good) behaviour!

Kesho, pata @global.workshop mpya! itakusaidia kujua nini cha kufanya pindi vijana wanapoonesha tabia mbaya (au nzuri)!

SourceText:
A brand-new @global.workshop unlocks tomorrow!
 
Complete the @local.workshop_data.in_text_title before moving on. Just a few more minutes to help your teen follow your rules!
text:
@global.workshop kabisa itafunguliwa kesho!

Kamilisha warsha @local.workshop_data.in_text_title kabla hujaendelea Kwa dakika chache zaidi kumsaidia kijana wao kufuata sheria!

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name! You're nearly at the end of your @global.parent_app journey! Thank you for sticking to it. 

This week is about keeping our teens safe online and in the community.
text:
Habari @fields.user_name! Unakaribia kumaliza warsha zako za @global.parent_app! Hongera kwa kujitolea kwako kwa dhati kwa muda mrefu.

Warsha ya wiki hii inahusu kuwaweka salama vijana wetu, mtandaoni na katika jamii.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.group_name! You're nearly at the end of your @global.parent_app journey! Thank you for sticking to it.  

This week is about keeping our teens safe online and in the community.
text:

Warsha ya wiki hii inahusu kuwaweka salama vijana wetu, mtandaoni na katika jamii.

SourceText: Parenting is tough, especially now. Be proud of your achievements. Of the care you give them. Of every time you make them smile. You're incredible!
text: Malezi ni kitu kigumu, hasa kwa siku hizi. Jivunie mafanikio yako. Ya matunzo unayowapa. Ya kila muda unaowafanya watabasamu. Wewe ni mzuri sana!

SourceText:
Think about all the parenting skills you've already gained!

Complete the next @global.workshop to get more.
text:
Fikiria kuhusu ujuzo wote wa malezi uliiupata!

Malizi @global.workshop inayofuata kupata zaidi.
note: The string @global.workshop should not be translated.

SourceText:
Chatting together about their community and online experiences helps keep teens safe. 

Complete the @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title to see how.
text:
Kuongea pamoja kuhusu jamii yao na uzoefu wa mitandaoni husaidia kuwaweka vijana wako salama.

Maliza warsha @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title kuona ni jinsi gani.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText: Have you talked with your teen about safety measures?
text: Je, umezungumza na kijana wako kuhusu hatua za usalama?

SourceText: Congratulations, you completed @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title. A new @global.workshop is ready tomorrow to help your family deal with any situation – together you can do so much!
text: Hongera, umemaliza @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title. Kesho, @global.workshop mpya itakuwa tayari kwa ajili yako ili kukusaidia wewe na familia yako kukabiliana na hali yoyote – pamoja mnaweza kufanya makubwa!

SourceText:
Finish the @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title before moving on. This can prevent many problems. 

Well done for using @global.parent_app to support your family.
text:
Maliza warsha @data.workshop.w_safe.in_text_title kabla ya kuendelea. Hii inaweza kuzuia matatizo mengi.

Vizuri sana kwa kutumia @global.parent_app kusaidia familia yako.

SourceText: This week is about YOU! Treat yourself well. You deserve it!
text: Wiki hii ni kuhusu WEWE! Jitunze vizuri. Unastahili!

SourceText: Start a brand new @global.parent_app @global.workshop tomorrow. You'll see great results!
text: Anza @global.workshop mpya kabisa ya @global.parent_app kesho. Utaona matokeo mazuri!

SourceText: Remember to tell your @global.parent_app partners about the app. Tomorrow, you can start doing @global.parent_app @global.workshops together!
text: Kumbuka kuwaambia washirika wako kwenye @global.parent_app kuhusu program. Kesho, unaweza kuanza kufanya @global.workshops pamoja kwenye @global.parent_app workshops!

SourceText:
Hi @fields.user_name! You are making such good progress! 

Having a teen means having lots of unexpected problems. This @global.workshop will show you how to deal with them.
text:
Habari @fields.user_name! Unaendelea vizuri sana katika safari yako ya malezi!

Kuwa na kijana kunaleta matatizo mengi yasiyotarajiwa. @global.workshop hii itakuonesha jinsi ya kuyashughulikia.

SourceText:
Hi @fields.group_name! You are making such good progress!

Having a teen means having a lot of unexpected problems to deal with. This @global.workshop will show you all how to deal with them.
text:
Habari @fields.group_name! Unaendelea vizuri sana katika safari yako ya malezi!

Kuwa na kijana kunaleta matatizo mengi yasiyotarajiwa ya kushughulikia. @global.workshop hii itakuonesha jinsi ya kuyashughulika nayo.

SourceText: Your commitment is inspiring. Keep calm and carry on!
text: Kujitolea kwako ni mfano wa kunahamasisha. Tulia na uendelee!

SourceText:
Unexpected problems arise when we have teens. 
 
Learn how to address them in the next @global.workshop.
text:
Matatizo yasiyotarajiwa hutokea tukiwa na vijana.

Jifunze jinsi ya kuyatatua katika @global.workshop inayofuata.
note: The string @global.workshop. should not be translated.

SourceText:
You are on the right track to solving problems with your teen! 

Complete the @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title to gain another parenting skill.
text:
Uko kwenye njia sahihi ya kuanza kutatua matatizo pamoja na kijana wako!

Malizia @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title ili upate ujuzi mwingine muhimu wa malezi.
note: The string @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title should not be translated.

SourceText:
Practise the four steps of problem-solving with your teen. 
 
KNOW IT, SOLVE IT, TRY IT, TEST IT!
text:
Fanyia mazoezi hatua nne za kutatua matatizo na kijana wako?
ELEWA – TAFUTA UTATUZI – CHAGUA – JARIBU!

SourceText: Great! You completed the @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title. Tomorrow, a new @global.workshop is unlocked to help you keep your teen safe.
text: Umefanya vizuri sana kumaliza @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title. Kesho, @global.workshop mpya itafunguliwa ili kukusaidia kumweka salama kijana wako.

SourceText:
Access a new @global.workshop tomorrow! 
 
 By completing the @data.workshop.w_solve.in_text_title first, you'll know how to solve problems together.
text:
Pata @global.workshop mpya kesho!

 By completing the @data.workshop.w_stress.in_text_title first, you lay a key foundation: If you feel good, your family will too!

SourceText:
By providing your consent below you acknowledge reading and accepting the @global.terms_and_conditions and @global.privacy_policy. The most important commitments are:
1. This is, and will always be, a fully free app.
2. Your data will never be sold. We are not for profit.
3. By using the app you are helping to make the app better for you and others.
4. Your anonymised data may be used for research purposes by our @global.parent_app team.
text:
Kwa kutoa ridhaa hii hapa chini unakubali kusoma na kukubali @global.terms_and_conditions na @global.privacy_policy. Mambo muhimu ya kukubaliana nayo:
1. Hii ni, na itazidi kuwa programu tumishi inayopatikana bure.
2. Taarifa zako kamwe hazitouzwa. Sisi hatupo kwa faida ya kifedha.
3. Kwa kutumia programu tumishi unasaidia kuiboresha programu tumishi kwa ajili yako na wengine. 
4. Taarifa zisizo na utambulisho zitatumika kwa ajili ya utafiti na timu yetu ya @global.parent_app.

SourceText: These policies are still under construction. We value advice and input to improve them.
text: Sera hizi bado zinatungwa. Tunathamini ushauri na nyongeza wa kuziboresha.

SourceText: I consent to the commitments stated above.
text: Ninaridhia na makubaliano yalioorodheshwa hapo juu.

SourceText: You can only move on and access the app if you provide your consent.
text: Utaweza kuendelea kutumia programu tumishi endapo utatoa ridhaa yako.
